+                      * The representation String of the primitive value that is
+                      * being evaluated.
+                      * @type {string}
+                      */
+                     sName =
+                         sPrefixed.substring(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC.length),
+                     /**
+                      * The number of source characters taken up by the
+                      * representation String of the primitive value that is
+                      * being evaluated.
+                      * @type {number}
+                      */
+                     nLengthOriginal = sName.length,
+                     /**
+                      * The number of source characters taken up by the
+                      * identifier name that could substitute the primitive
+                      * value that is being evaluated.
+                      * substituted.
+                      * @type {number}
+                      */
+                     nLengthSubstitution,
+                     /**
+                      * The number of source characters taken up by by the
+                      * representation String of the primitive value that is
+                      * being evaluated when it is represented by a string
+                      * literal.
+                      * @type {number}
+                      */
+                     nLengthString = oProcessor.make_string(sName).length;
+
+                 oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed] =
+                     new TPrimitiveValue();
+                 do {  // Find an identifier unused in this or any nested scope.
+                   nIndex = oScope.cname;
+                   oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName =
+                       oScope.next_mangled();
+                 } while (-1 !== oSourceElementsData.aIdentifiers.indexOf(
+                     oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName));
+                 nLengthSubstitution = oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[
+                     sPrefixed].sName.length;
+                 if (0 === sPrefixed.indexOf(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC)) {
+                   // foo:null, or foo:null;
+                   oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving -=
+                       nLengthSubstitution + nLengthOriginal +
+                       oWeights.N_VARIABLE_DECLARATION;
+                   // null vs foo
+                   oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
+                       oSourceElementsData.aCount[
+                           EPrimaryExpressionCategories.
+                               N_NULL_AND_BOOLEAN_LITERALS][sPrefixed] *
+                       (nLengthOriginal - nLengthSubstitution);
+                 } else {
+                   // foo:'fromCharCode';
+                   oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving -=
+                       nLengthSubstitution + nLengthString +
+                       oWeights.N_VARIABLE_DECLARATION;
+                   // .fromCharCode vs [foo]
+                   if (oSourceElementsData.aCount[
+                           EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_IDENTIFIER_NAMES
+                       ].hasOwnProperty(sPrefixed)) {
+                     oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
+                         oSourceElementsData.aCount[
+                             EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_IDENTIFIER_NAMES
+                         ][sPrefixed] *
+                         (nLengthOriginal - nLengthSubstitution -
+                          oWeights.N_PROPERTY_ACCESSOR);
+                   }
+                   // 'fromCharCode' vs foo
+                   if (oSourceElementsData.aCount[
+                           EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_STRING_LITERALS
+                       ].hasOwnProperty(sPrefixed)) {
+                     oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
+                         oSourceElementsData.aCount[
+                             EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_STRING_LITERALS
+                         ][sPrefixed] *
+                         (nLengthString - nLengthSubstitution);
+                   }
+                 }
+                 if (oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving &gt;
+                     0) {
+                   oSolutionCandidate.nSavings +=
+                       oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving;
+                 } else {
+                   oScope.cname = nIndex; // Free the identifier name.
+                 }
+               },
+               /**
+                * Adds a variable declaration to an existing variable statement.
+                * @param {!Array} aVariableDeclaration A variable declaration
+                *     with an initialiser.
+                */
+               cAddVariableDeclaration = function(aVariableDeclaration) {
+                 (/** @type {!Array} */ oSourceElements[nFrom][1]).unshift(
+                     aVariableDeclaration);
+               };
+
+           if (nFrom &gt; nTo) {
+             return;
+           }
+           // If the range is a closure, reuse the closure.
+           if (nFrom === nTo &amp;&amp;
+               'stat' === oSourceElements[nFrom][0] &amp;&amp;
+               'call' === oSourceElements[nFrom][1][0] &amp;&amp;
+               'function' === oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1][0]) {
+             fExamineSyntacticCodeUnit(oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1]);
+             return;
+           }
+           // Create a list of all derived primitive values within the range.
+           for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition &lt;= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
+             aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aPrimitiveValues.forEach(
+                 cAugmentList(oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues));
+           }
+           if (0 === oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.length) {
+             return;
+           }
+           for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition &lt;= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
+             // Add the number of occurrences to the total count.
+             fAddOccurrences(nPosition);
+             // Add identifiers of this or any nested scope to the list.
+             aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aIdentifiers.forEach(
+                 cAugmentList(oSourceElementsData.aIdentifiers));
+           }
+           // Distribute identifier names among derived primitive values.
+           do {  // If there was any progress, find a better distribution.
+             oSolutionBest = oSolutionCandidate;
+             if (Object.keys(oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues).length &gt; 0) {
+               // Sort primitive values descending by their worthwhileness.
+               oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.sort(cSortPrimitiveValues);
+             }
+             oSolutionCandidate = new TSolution();
+             oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.forEach(
+                 fEvaluatePrimitiveValue);
+             oScope.cname = nIndex;
+           } while (oSolutionCandidate.nSavings &gt; oSolutionBest.nSavings);
+           // Take the necessity of adding a variable statement into account.
+           if ('var' !== oSourceElements[nFrom][0]) {
+             oSolutionBest.nSavings -= oWeights.N_VARIABLE_STATEMENT_AFFIXATION;
+           }
+           if (bEnclose) {
+             // Take the necessity of forming a closure into account.
+             oSolutionBest.nSavings -= oWeights.N_CLOSURE;
+           }
+           if (oSolutionBest.nSavings &gt; 0) {
+             // Create variable declarations suitable for UglifyJS.
+             Object.keys(oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues).forEach(
+                 cAugmentVariableDeclarations);
+             // Rewrite expressions that contain worthwhile primitive values.
+             for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition &lt;= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
+               oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
+               oSourceElements[nPosition] =
+                   oWalker.with_walkers(
+                       oWalkersTransformers,
+                       cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
+             }
+             if ('var' === oSourceElements[nFrom][0]) {  // Reuse the statement.
+               (/** @type {!Array.&lt;!Array&gt;} */ aVariableDeclarations.reverse(
+                   )).forEach(cAddVariableDeclaration);
+             } else {  // Add a variable statement.
+               Array.prototype.splice.call(
+                   oSourceElements,
+                   nFrom,
+                   0,
+                   ['var', aVariableDeclarations]);
+               nTo += 1;
+             }
+             if (bEnclose) {
+               // Add a closure.
+               Array.prototype.splice.call(
+                   oSourceElements,
+                   nFrom,
+                   0,
+                   ['stat', ['call', ['function', null, [], []], []]]);
+               // Copy source elements into the closure.
+               for (nPosition = nTo + 1; nPosition &gt; nFrom; nPosition -= 1) {
+                 Array.prototype.unshift.call(
+                     oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1][3],
+                     oSourceElements[nPosition]);
+               }
+               // Remove source elements outside the closure.
+               Array.prototype.splice.call(
+                   oSourceElements,
+                   nFrom + 1,
+                   nTo - nFrom + 1);
+             }
+           }
+           if (bEnclose) {
+             // Restore the availability of identifier names.
+             oScope.cname = nIndex;
+           }
+         };
+
+     oSourceElements = (/** @type {!TSyntacticCodeUnit} */
+         oSyntacticCodeUnit[bIsGlobal ? 1 : 3]);
+     if (0 === oSourceElements.length) {
+       return;
+     }
+     oScope = bIsGlobal ? oSyntacticCodeUnit.scope : oSourceElements.scope;
+     // Skip a Directive Prologue.
+     while (nAfterDirectivePrologue &lt; oSourceElements.length &amp;&amp;
+            'directive' === oSourceElements[nAfterDirectivePrologue][0]) {
+       nAfterDirectivePrologue += 1;
+       aSourceElementsData.push(null);
+     }
+     if (oSourceElements.length === nAfterDirectivePrologue) {
+       return;
+     }
+     for (nPosition = nAfterDirectivePrologue;
+          nPosition &lt; oSourceElements.length;
+          nPosition += 1) {
+       oSourceElementData = new TSourceElementsData();
+       oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
+       // Classify a source element.
+       // Find its derived primitive values and count their occurrences.
+       // Find all identifiers used (including nested scopes).
+       oWalker.with_walkers(
+           oWalkers.oSurveySourceElement,
+           cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
+       // Establish whether the scope is still wholly examinable.
+       bIsWhollyExaminable = bIsWhollyExaminable &amp;&amp;
+           ESourceElementCategories.N_WITH !== oSourceElementData.nCategory &amp;&amp;
+           ESourceElementCategories.N_EVAL !== oSourceElementData.nCategory;
+       aSourceElementsData.push(oSourceElementData);
+     }
+     if (bIsWhollyExaminable) {  // Examine the whole scope.
+       fExamineSourceElements(
+           nAfterDirectivePrologue,
+           oSourceElements.length - 1,
+           false);
+     } else {  // Examine unexcluded ranges of source elements.
+       for (nPosition = oSourceElements.length - 1;
+            nPosition &gt;= nAfterDirectivePrologue;
+            nPosition -= 1) {
+         oSourceElementData = (/** @type {!TSourceElementsData} */
+             aSourceElementsData[nPosition]);
+         if (ESourceElementCategories.N_OTHER ===
+             oSourceElementData.nCategory) {
+           if ('undefined' === typeof nTo) {
+             nTo = nPosition;  // Indicate the end of a range.
+           }
+           // Examine the range if it immediately follows a Directive Prologue.
+           if (nPosition === nAfterDirectivePrologue) {
+             fExamineSourceElements(nPosition, nTo, true);
+           }
+         } else {
+           if ('undefined' !== typeof nTo) {
+             // Examine the range that immediately follows this source element.
+             fExamineSourceElements(nPosition + 1, nTo, true);
+             nTo = void 0;  // Obliterate the range.
+           }
+           // Examine nested functions.
+           oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
+           oWalker.with_walkers(
+               oWalkers.oExamineFunctions,
+               cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
+         }
+       }
+     }
+   }(oAbstractSyntaxTree = oProcessor.ast_add_scope(oAbstractSyntaxTree)));
+  return oAbstractSyntaxTree;
+};
+/*jshint sub:false */
+
+/* Local Variables:      */
+/* mode: js              */
+/* coding: utf-8         */
+/* indent-tabs-mode: nil */
+/* tab-width: 2          */
+/* End:                  */
+/* vim: set ft=javascript fenc=utf-8 et ts=2 sts=2 sw=2: */
+/* :mode=javascript:noTabs=true:tabSize=2:indentSize=2:deepIndent=true: */
+});
+define('uglifyjs/parse-js', [&quot;exports&quot;], function(exports) {
+/***********************************************************************
+
+  A JavaScript tokenizer / parser / beautifier / compressor.
+
+  This version is suitable for Node.js.  With minimal changes (the
+  exports stuff) it should work on any JS platform.
+
+  This file contains the tokenizer/parser.  It is a port to JavaScript
+  of parse-js [1], a JavaScript parser library written in Common Lisp
+  by Marijn Haverbeke.  Thank you Marijn!
+
+  [1] http://marijn.haverbeke.nl/parse-js/
+
+  Exported functions:
+
+    - tokenizer(code) -- returns a function.  Call the returned
+      function to fetch the next token.
+
+    - parse(code) -- returns an AST of the given JavaScript code.
+
+  -------------------------------- (C) ---------------------------------
+
+                           Author: Mihai Bazon
+                         &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+                       http://mihai.bazon.net/blog
+
+  Distributed under the BSD license:
+
+    Copyright 2010 (c) Mihai Bazon &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+    Based on parse-js (http://marijn.haverbeke.nl/parse-js/).
+
+    Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
+    modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
+    are met:
+
+        * Redistributions of source code must retain the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer.
+
+        * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
+          provided with the distribution.
+
+    THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER “AS IS” AND ANY
+    EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
+    IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
+    PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE
+    LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY,
+    OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
+    PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
+    PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
+    THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR
+    TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF
+    THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF
+    SUCH DAMAGE.
+
+ ***********************************************************************/
+
+/* -----[ Tokenizer (constants) ]----- */
+
+var KEYWORDS = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;break&quot;,
+    &quot;case&quot;,
+    &quot;catch&quot;,
+    &quot;const&quot;,
+    &quot;continue&quot;,
+    &quot;debugger&quot;,
+    &quot;default&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;do&quot;,
+    &quot;else&quot;,
+    &quot;finally&quot;,
+    &quot;for&quot;,
+    &quot;function&quot;,
+    &quot;if&quot;,
+    &quot;in&quot;,
+    &quot;instanceof&quot;,
+    &quot;new&quot;,
+    &quot;return&quot;,
+    &quot;switch&quot;,
+    &quot;throw&quot;,
+    &quot;try&quot;,
+    &quot;typeof&quot;,
+    &quot;var&quot;,
+    &quot;void&quot;,
+    &quot;while&quot;,
+    &quot;with&quot;
+]);
+
+var RESERVED_WORDS = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;abstract&quot;,
+    &quot;boolean&quot;,
+    &quot;byte&quot;,
+    &quot;char&quot;,
+    &quot;class&quot;,
+    &quot;double&quot;,
+    &quot;enum&quot;,
+    &quot;export&quot;,
+    &quot;extends&quot;,
+    &quot;final&quot;,
+    &quot;float&quot;,
+    &quot;goto&quot;,
+    &quot;implements&quot;,
+    &quot;import&quot;,
+    &quot;int&quot;,
+    &quot;interface&quot;,
+    &quot;long&quot;,
+    &quot;native&quot;,
+    &quot;package&quot;,
+    &quot;private&quot;,
+    &quot;protected&quot;,
+    &quot;public&quot;,
+    &quot;short&quot;,
+    &quot;static&quot;,
+    &quot;super&quot;,
+    &quot;synchronized&quot;,
+    &quot;throws&quot;,
+    &quot;transient&quot;,
+    &quot;volatile&quot;
+]);
+
+var KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;return&quot;,
+    &quot;new&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;throw&quot;,
+    &quot;else&quot;,
+    &quot;case&quot;
+]);
+
+var KEYWORDS_ATOM = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;false&quot;,
+    &quot;null&quot;,
+    &quot;true&quot;,
+    &quot;undefined&quot;
+]);
+
+var OPERATOR_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters(&quot;+-*&amp;%=&lt;&gt;!?|~^&quot;));
+
+var RE_HEX_NUMBER = /^0x[0-9a-f]+$/i;
+var RE_OCT_NUMBER = /^0[0-7]+$/;
+var RE_DEC_NUMBER = /^\d*\.?\d*(?:e[+-]?\d*(?:\d\.?|\.?\d)\d*)?$/i;
+
+var OPERATORS = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;in&quot;,
+    &quot;instanceof&quot;,
+    &quot;typeof&quot;,
+    &quot;new&quot;,
+    &quot;void&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;++&quot;,
+    &quot;--&quot;,
+    &quot;+&quot;,
+    &quot;-&quot;,
+    &quot;!&quot;,
+    &quot;~&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;&quot;,
+    &quot;|&quot;,
+    &quot;^&quot;,
+    &quot;*&quot;,
+    &quot;/&quot;,
+    &quot;%&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;==&quot;,
+    &quot;===&quot;,
+    &quot;!=&quot;,
+    &quot;!==&quot;,
+    &quot;?&quot;,
+    &quot;=&quot;,
+    &quot;+=&quot;,
+    &quot;-=&quot;,
+    &quot;/=&quot;,
+    &quot;*=&quot;,
+    &quot;%=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&lt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;|=&quot;,
+    &quot;^=&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;,
+    &quot;||&quot;
+]);
+
+var WHITESPACE_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters(&quot; \u00a0\n\r\t\f\u000b\u200b\u180e\u2000\u2001\u2002\u2003\u2004\u2005\u2006\u2007\u2008\u2009\u200a\u202f\u205f\u3000\uFEFF&quot;));
+
+var PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = array_to_hash(characters(&quot;[{(,.;:&quot;));
+
+var PUNC_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters(&quot;[]{}(),;:&quot;));
+
+var REGEXP_MODIFIERS = array_to_hash(characters(&quot;gmsiy&quot;));
+
+/* -----[ Tokenizer ]----- */
+
+var UNICODE = {  // Unicode 6.1
+    letter: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0041-\\u005A\\u0061-\\u007A\\u00AA\\u00B5\\u00BA\\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02C1\\u02C6-\\u02D1\\u02E0-\\u02E4\\u02EC\\u02EE\\u0370-\\u0374\\u0376\\u0377\\u037A-\\u037D\\u0386\\u0388-\\u038A\\u038C\\u038E-\\u03A1\\u03A3-\\u03F5\\u03F7-\\u0481\\u048A-\\u0527\\u0531-\\u0556\\u0559\\u0561-\\u0587\\u05D0-\\u05EA\\u05F0-\\u05F2\\u0620-\\u064A\\u066E\\u066F\\u0671-\\u06D3\\u06D5\\u06E5\\u06E6\\u06EE\\u06EF\\u06FA-\\u06FC\\u06FF\\u0710\\u0712-\\u072F\\u074D-\\u07A5\\u07B1\\u07CA-\\u07EA\\u07F4\\u07F5\\u07FA\\u0800-\\u0815\\u081A\\u0824\\u0828\\u0840-\\u0858\\u08A0\\u08A2-\\u08AC\\u0904-\\u0939\\u093D\\u0950\\u0958-\\u0961\\u0971-\\u0977\\u0979-\\u097F\\u0985-\\u098C\\u098F\\u0990\\u0993-\\u09A8\\u09AA-\\u09B0\\u09B2\\u09B6-\\u09B9\\u09BD\\u09CE\\u09DC\\u09DD\\u09DF-\\u09E1\\u09F0\\u09F1\\u0A05-\\u0A0A\\u0A0F\\u0A10\\u0A13-\\u0A28\\u0A2A-\\u0A30\\u0A32\\u0A33\\u0A35\\u0A36\\u0A38\\u0A39\\u0A59-\\u0A5C\\u0A5E\\u0A72-\\u0A74\\u0A85-\\u0A8D
 \\u0A8F-\\u0A91\\u0A93-\\u0AA8\\u0AAA-\\u0AB0\\u0AB2\\u0AB3\\u0AB5-\\u0AB9\\u0ABD\\u0AD0\\u0AE0\\u0AE1\\u0B05-\\u0B0C\\u0B0F\\u0B10\\u0B13-\\u0B28\\u0B2A-\\u0B30\\u0B32\\u0B33\\u0B35-\\u0B39\\u0B3D\\u0B5C\\u0B5D\\u0B5F-\\u0B61\\u0B71\\u0B83\\u0B85-\\u0B8A\\u0B8E-\\u0B90\\u0B92-\\u0B95\\u0B99\\u0B9A\\u0B9C\\u0B9E\\u0B9F\\u0BA3\\u0BA4\\u0BA8-\\u0BAA\\u0BAE-\\u0BB9\\u0BD0\\u0C05-\\u0C0C\\u0C0E-\\u0C10\\u0C12-\\u0C28\\u0C2A-\\u0C33\\u0C35-\\u0C39\\u0C3D\\u0C58\\u0C59\\u0C60\\u0C61\\u0C85-\\u0C8C\\u0C8E-\\u0C90\\u0C92-\\u0CA8\\u0CAA-\\u0CB3\\u0CB5-\\u0CB9\\u0CBD\\u0CDE\\u0CE0\\u0CE1\\u0CF1\\u0CF2\\u0D05-\\u0D0C\\u0D0E-\\u0D10\\u0D12-\\u0D3A\\u0D3D\\u0D4E\\u0D60\\u0D61\\u0D7A-\\u0D7F\\u0D85-\\u0D96\\u0D9A-\\u0DB1\\u0DB3-\\u0DBB\\u0DBD\\u0DC0-\\u0DC6\\u0E01-\\u0E30\\u0E32\\u0E33\\u0E40-\\u0E46\\u0E81\\u0E82\\u0E84\\u0E87\\u0E88\\u0E8A\\u0E8D\\u0E94-\\u0E97\\u0E99-\\u0E9F\\u0EA1-\\u0EA3\\u0EA5\\u0EA7\\u0EAA\\u0EAB\\u0EAD-\\u0EB0\\u0EB2\\u0EB3\\u0EBD\\u0EC0-\\u0EC4\\u0EC6\\u0EDC-\\u0
 EDF\\u0F00\\u0F40-\\u0F47\\u0F49-\\u0F6C\\u0F88-\\u0F8C\\u1000-\\u102A\\u103F\\u1050-\\u1055\\u105A-\\u105D\\u1061\\u1065\\u1066\\u106E-\\u1070\\u1075-\\u1081\\u108E\\u10A0-\\u10C5\\u10C7\\u10CD\\u10D0-\\u10FA\\u10FC-\\u1248\\u124A-\\u124D\\u1250-\\u1256\\u1258\\u125A-\\u125D\\u1260-\\u1288\\u128A-\\u128D\\u1290-\\u12B0\\u12B2-\\u12B5\\u12B8-\\u12BE\\u12C0\\u12C2-\\u12C5\\u12C8-\\u12D6\\u12D8-\\u1310\\u1312-\\u1315\\u1318-\\u135A\\u1380-\\u138F\\u13A0-\\u13F4\\u1401-\\u166C\\u166F-\\u167F\\u1681-\\u169A\\u16A0-\\u16EA\\u16EE-\\u16F0\\u1700-\\u170C\\u170E-\\u1711\\u1720-\\u1731\\u1740-\\u1751\\u1760-\\u176C\\u176E-\\u1770\\u1780-\\u17B3\\u17D7\\u17DC\\u1820-\\u1877\\u1880-\\u18A8\\u18AA\\u18B0-\\u18F5\\u1900-\\u191C\\u1950-\\u196D\\u1970-\\u1974\\u1980-\\u19AB\\u19C1-\\u19C7\\u1A00-\\u1A16\\u1A20-\\u1A54\\u1AA7\\u1B05-\\u1B33\\u1B45-\\u1B4B\\u1B83-\\u1BA0\\u1BAE\\u1BAF\\u1BBA-\\u1BE5\\u1C00-\\u1C23\\u1C4D-\\u1C4F\\u1C5A-\\u1C7D\\u1CE9-\\u1CEC\\u1CEE-\\u1CF1\\u1CF5\\u1CF6\\u1D
 00-\\u1DBF\\u1E00-\\u1F15\\u1F18-\\u1F1D\\u1F20-\\u1F45\\u1F48-\\u1F4D\\u1F50-\\u1F57\\u1F59\\u1F5B\\u1F5D\\u1F5F-\\u1F7D\\u1F80-\\u1FB4\\u1FB6-\\u1FBC\\u1FBE\\u1FC2-\\u1FC4\\u1FC6-\\u1FCC\\u1FD0-\\u1FD3\\u1FD6-\\u1FDB\\u1FE0-\\u1FEC\\u1FF2-\\u1FF4\\u1FF6-\\u1FFC\\u2071\\u207F\\u2090-\\u209C\\u2102\\u2107\\u210A-\\u2113\\u2115\\u2119-\\u211D\\u2124\\u2126\\u2128\\u212A-\\u212D\\u212F-\\u2139\\u213C-\\u213F\\u2145-\\u2149\\u214E\\u2160-\\u2188\\u2C00-\\u2C2E\\u2C30-\\u2C5E\\u2C60-\\u2CE4\\u2CEB-\\u2CEE\\u2CF2\\u2CF3\\u2D00-\\u2D25\\u2D27\\u2D2D\\u2D30-\\u2D67\\u2D6F\\u2D80-\\u2D96\\u2DA0-\\u2DA6\\u2DA8-\\u2DAE\\u2DB0-\\u2DB6\\u2DB8-\\u2DBE\\u2DC0-\\u2DC6\\u2DC8-\\u2DCE\\u2DD0-\\u2DD6\\u2DD8-\\u2DDE\\u2E2F\\u3005-\\u3007\\u3021-\\u3029\\u3031-\\u3035\\u3038-\\u303C\\u3041-\\u3096\\u309D-\\u309F\\u30A1-\\u30FA\\u30FC-\\u30FF\\u3105-\\u312D\\u3131-\\u318E\\u31A0-\\u31BA\\u31F0-\\u31FF\\u3400-\\u4DB5\\u4E00-\\u9FCC\\uA000-\\uA48C\\uA4D0-\\uA4FD\\uA500-\\uA60C\\uA610-\\uA61F\\uA62
 A\\uA62B\\uA640-\\uA66E\\uA67F-\\uA697\\uA6A0-\\uA6EF\\uA717-\\uA71F\\uA722-\\uA788\\uA78B-\\uA78E\\uA790-\\uA793\\uA7A0-\\uA7AA\\uA7F8-\\uA801\\uA803-\\uA805\\uA807-\\uA80A\\uA80C-\\uA822\\uA840-\\uA873\\uA882-\\uA8B3\\uA8F2-\\uA8F7\\uA8FB\\uA90A-\\uA925\\uA930-\\uA946\\uA960-\\uA97C\\uA984-\\uA9B2\\uA9CF\\uAA00-\\uAA28\\uAA40-\\uAA42\\uAA44-\\uAA4B\\uAA60-\\uAA76\\uAA7A\\uAA80-\\uAAAF\\uAAB1\\uAAB5\\uAAB6\\uAAB9-\\uAABD\\uAAC0\\uAAC2\\uAADB-\\uAADD\\uAAE0-\\uAAEA\\uAAF2-\\uAAF4\\uAB01-\\uAB06\\uAB09-\\uAB0E\\uAB11-\\uAB16\\uAB20-\\uAB26\\uAB28-\\uAB2E\\uABC0-\\uABE2\\uAC00-\\uD7A3\\uD7B0-\\uD7C6\\uD7CB-\\uD7FB\\uF900-\\uFA6D\\uFA70-\\uFAD9\\uFB00-\\uFB06\\uFB13-\\uFB17\\uFB1D\\uFB1F-\\uFB28\\uFB2A-\\uFB36\\uFB38-\\uFB3C\\uFB3E\\uFB40\\uFB41\\uFB43\\uFB44\\uFB46-\\uFBB1\\uFBD3-\\uFD3D\\uFD50-\\uFD8F\\uFD92-\\uFDC7\\uFDF0-\\uFDFB\\uFE70-\\uFE74\\uFE76-\\uFEFC\\uFF21-\\uFF3A\\uFF41-\\uFF5A\\uFF66-\\uFFBE\\uFFC2-\\uFFC7\\uFFCA-\\uFFCF\\uFFD2-\\uFFD7\\uFFDA-\\uFFDC]&quot;),
+    combining_mark: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0300-\\u036F\\u0483-\\u0487\\u0591-\\u05BD\\u05BF\\u05C1\\u05C2\\u05C4\\u05C5\\u05C7\\u0610-\\u061A\\u064B-\\u065F\\u0670\\u06D6-\\u06DC\\u06DF-\\u06E4\\u06E7\\u06E8\\u06EA-\\u06ED\\u0711\\u0730-\\u074A\\u07A6-\\u07B0\\u07EB-\\u07F3\\u0816-\\u0819\\u081B-\\u0823\\u0825-\\u0827\\u0829-\\u082D\\u0859-\\u085B\\u08E4-\\u08FE\\u0900-\\u0903\\u093A-\\u093C\\u093E-\\u094F\\u0951-\\u0957\\u0962\\u0963\\u0981-\\u0983\\u09BC\\u09BE-\\u09C4\\u09C7\\u09C8\\u09CB-\\u09CD\\u09D7\\u09E2\\u09E3\\u0A01-\\u0A03\\u0A3C\\u0A3E-\\u0A42\\u0A47\\u0A48\\u0A4B-\\u0A4D\\u0A51\\u0A70\\u0A71\\u0A75\\u0A81-\\u0A83\\u0ABC\\u0ABE-\\u0AC5\\u0AC7-\\u0AC9\\u0ACB-\\u0ACD\\u0AE2\\u0AE3\\u0B01-\\u0B03\\u0B3C\\u0B3E-\\u0B44\\u0B47\\u0B48\\u0B4B-\\u0B4D\\u0B56\\u0B57\\u0B62\\u0B63\\u0B82\\u0BBE-\\u0BC2\\u0BC6-\\u0BC8\\u0BCA-\\u0BCD\\u0BD7\\u0C01-\\u0C03\\u0C3E-\\u0C44\\u0C46-\\u0C48\\u0C4A-\\u0C4D\\u0C55\\u0C56\\u0C62\\u0C63\\u0C82\\u0C83\\u0CBC\\u0CBE-\\u0CC4\\u0CC6-\\u0C
 C8\\u0CCA-\\u0CCD\\u0CD5\\u0CD6\\u0CE2\\u0CE3\\u0D02\\u0D03\\u0D3E-\\u0D44\\u0D46-\\u0D48\\u0D4A-\\u0D4D\\u0D57\\u0D62\\u0D63\\u0D82\\u0D83\\u0DCA\\u0DCF-\\u0DD4\\u0DD6\\u0DD8-\\u0DDF\\u0DF2\\u0DF3\\u0E31\\u0E34-\\u0E3A\\u0E47-\\u0E4E\\u0EB1\\u0EB4-\\u0EB9\\u0EBB\\u0EBC\\u0EC8-\\u0ECD\\u0F18\\u0F19\\u0F35\\u0F37\\u0F39\\u0F3E\\u0F3F\\u0F71-\\u0F84\\u0F86\\u0F87\\u0F8D-\\u0F97\\u0F99-\\u0FBC\\u0FC6\\u102B-\\u103E\\u1056-\\u1059\\u105E-\\u1060\\u1062-\\u1064\\u1067-\\u106D\\u1071-\\u1074\\u1082-\\u108D\\u108F\\u109A-\\u109D\\u135D-\\u135F\\u1712-\\u1714\\u1732-\\u1734\\u1752\\u1753\\u1772\\u1773\\u17B4-\\u17D3\\u17DD\\u180B-\\u180D\\u18A9\\u1920-\\u192B\\u1930-\\u193B\\u19B0-\\u19C0\\u19C8\\u19C9\\u1A17-\\u1A1B\\u1A55-\\u1A5E\\u1A60-\\u1A7C\\u1A7F\\u1B00-\\u1B04\\u1B34-\\u1B44\\u1B6B-\\u1B73\\u1B80-\\u1B82\\u1BA1-\\u1BAD\\u1BE6-\\u1BF3\\u1C24-\\u1C37\\u1CD0-\\u1CD2\\u1CD4-\\u1CE8\\u1CED\\u1CF2-\\u1CF4\\u1DC0-\\u1DE6\\u1DFC-\\u1DFF\\u20D0-\\u20DC\\u20E1\\u20E5-\\u20F0\\u2CEF-\\
 u2CF1\\u2D7F\\u2DE0-\\u2DFF\\u302A-\\u302F\\u3099\\u309A\\uA66F\\uA674-\\uA67D\\uA69F\\uA6F0\\uA6F1\\uA802\\uA806\\uA80B\\uA823-\\uA827\\uA880\\uA881\\uA8B4-\\uA8C4\\uA8E0-\\uA8F1\\uA926-\\uA92D\\uA947-\\uA953\\uA980-\\uA983\\uA9B3-\\uA9C0\\uAA29-\\uAA36\\uAA43\\uAA4C\\uAA4D\\uAA7B\\uAAB0\\uAAB2-\\uAAB4\\uAAB7\\uAAB8\\uAABE\\uAABF\\uAAC1\\uAAEB-\\uAAEF\\uAAF5\\uAAF6\\uABE3-\\uABEA\\uABEC\\uABED\\uFB1E\\uFE00-\\uFE0F\\uFE20-\\uFE26]&quot;),
+    connector_punctuation: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u005F\\u203F\\u2040\\u2054\\uFE33\\uFE34\\uFE4D-\\uFE4F\\uFF3F]&quot;),
+    digit: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0030-\\u0039\\u0660-\\u0669\\u06F0-\\u06F9\\u07C0-\\u07C9\\u0966-\\u096F\\u09E6-\\u09EF\\u0A66-\\u0A6F\\u0AE6-\\u0AEF\\u0B66-\\u0B6F\\u0BE6-\\u0BEF\\u0C66-\\u0C6F\\u0CE6-\\u0CEF\\u0D66-\\u0D6F\\u0E50-\\u0E59\\u0ED0-\\u0ED9\\u0F20-\\u0F29\\u1040-\\u1049\\u1090-\\u1099\\u17E0-\\u17E9\\u1810-\\u1819\\u1946-\\u194F\\u19D0-\\u19D9\\u1A80-\\u1A89\\u1A90-\\u1A99\\u1B50-\\u1B59\\u1BB0-\\u1BB9\\u1C40-\\u1C49\\u1C50-\\u1C59\\uA620-\\uA629\\uA8D0-\\uA8D9\\uA900-\\uA909\\uA9D0-\\uA9D9\\uAA50-\\uAA59\\uABF0-\\uABF9\\uFF10-\\uFF19]&quot;)
+};
+
+function is_letter(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.letter.test(ch);
+};
+
+function is_digit(ch) {
+    ch = ch.charCodeAt(0);
+    return ch &gt;= 48 &amp;&amp; ch &lt;= 57;
+};
+
+function is_unicode_digit(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.digit.test(ch);
+}
+
+function is_alphanumeric_char(ch) {
+    return is_digit(ch) || is_letter(ch);
+};
+
+function is_unicode_combining_mark(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.combining_mark.test(ch);
+};
+
+function is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.connector_punctuation.test(ch);
+};
+
+function is_identifier_start(ch) {
+    return ch == &quot;$&quot; || ch == &quot;_&quot; || is_letter(ch);
+};
+
+function is_identifier_char(ch) {
+    return is_identifier_start(ch)
+        || is_unicode_combining_mark(ch)
+        || is_unicode_digit(ch)
+        || is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch)
+        || ch == &quot;\u200c&quot; // zero-width non-joiner &lt;ZWNJ&gt;
+        || ch == &quot;\u200d&quot; // zero-width joiner &lt;ZWJ&gt; (in my ECMA-262 PDF, this is also 200c)
+    ;
+};
+
+function parse_js_number(num) {
+    if (RE_HEX_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseInt(num.substr(2), 16);
+    } else if (RE_OCT_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseInt(num.substr(1), 8);
+    } else if (RE_DEC_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseFloat(num);
+    }
+};
+
+function JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos) {
+    this.message = message;
+    this.line = line + 1;
+    this.col = col + 1;
+    this.pos = pos + 1;
+    this.stack = new Error().stack;
+};
+
+JS_Parse_Error.prototype.toString = function() {
+    return this.message + &quot; (line: &quot; + this.line + &quot;, col: &quot; + this.col + &quot;, pos: &quot; + this.pos + &quot;)&quot; + &quot;\n\n&quot; + this.stack;
+};
+
+function js_error(message, line, col, pos) {
+    throw new JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos);
+};
+
+function is_token(token, type, val) {
+    return token.type == type &amp;&amp; (val == null || token.value == val);
+};
+
+var EX_EOF = {};
+
+function tokenizer($TEXT) {
+
+    var S = {
+        text            : $TEXT.replace(/\r\n?|[\n\u2028\u2029]/g, &quot;\n&quot;).replace(/^\uFEFF/, ''),
+        pos             : 0,
+        tokpos          : 0,
+        line            : 0,
+        tokline         : 0,
+        col             : 0,
+        tokcol          : 0,
+        newline_before  : false,
+        regex_allowed   : false,
+        comments_before : []
+    };
+
+    function peek() { return S.text.charAt(S.pos); };
+
+    function next(signal_eof, in_string) {
+        var ch = S.text.charAt(S.pos++);
+        if (signal_eof &amp;&amp; !ch)
+            throw EX_EOF;
+        if (ch == &quot;\n&quot;) {
+            S.newline_before = S.newline_before || !in_string;
+            ++S.line;
+            S.col = 0;
+        } else {
+            ++S.col;
+        }
+        return ch;
+    };
+
+    function eof() {
+        return !S.peek();
+    };
+
+    function find(what, signal_eof) {
+        var pos = S.text.indexOf(what, S.pos);
+        if (signal_eof &amp;&amp; pos == -1) throw EX_EOF;
+        return pos;
+    };
+
+    function start_token() {
+        S.tokline = S.line;
+        S.tokcol = S.col;
+        S.tokpos = S.pos;
+    };
+
+    function token(type, value, is_comment) {
+        S.regex_allowed = ((type == &quot;operator&quot; &amp;&amp; !HOP(UNARY_POSTFIX, value)) ||
+                           (type == &quot;keyword&quot; &amp;&amp; HOP(KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION, value)) ||
+                           (type == &quot;punc&quot; &amp;&amp; HOP(PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION, value)));
+        var ret = {
+            type   : type,
+            value  : value,
+            line   : S.tokline,
+            col    : S.tokcol,
+            pos    : S.tokpos,
+            endpos : S.pos,
+            nlb    : S.newline_before
+        };
+        if (!is_comment) {
+            ret.comments_before = S.comments_before;
+            S.comments_before = [];
+            // make note of any newlines in the comments that came before
+            for (var i = 0, len = ret.comments_before.length; i &lt; len; i++) {
+                ret.nlb = ret.nlb || ret.comments_before[i].nlb;
+            }
+        }
+        S.newline_before = false;
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function skip_whitespace() {
+        while (HOP(WHITESPACE_CHARS, peek()))
+            next();
+    };
+
+    function read_while(pred) {
+        var ret = &quot;&quot;, ch = peek(), i = 0;
+        while (ch &amp;&amp; pred(ch, i++)) {
+            ret += next();
+            ch = peek();
+        }
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function parse_error(err) {
+        js_error(err, S.tokline, S.tokcol, S.tokpos);
+    };
+
+    function read_num(prefix) {
+        var has_e = false, after_e = false, has_x = false, has_dot = prefix == &quot;.&quot;;
+        var num = read_while(function(ch, i){
+            if (ch == &quot;x&quot; || ch == &quot;X&quot;) {
+                if (has_x) return false;
+                return has_x = true;
+            }
+            if (!has_x &amp;&amp; (ch == &quot;E&quot; || ch == &quot;e&quot;)) {
+                if (has_e) return false;
+                return has_e = after_e = true;
+            }
+            if (ch == &quot;-&quot;) {
+                if (after_e || (i == 0 &amp;&amp; !prefix)) return true;
+                return false;
+            }
+            if (ch == &quot;+&quot;) return after_e;
+            after_e = false;
+            if (ch == &quot;.&quot;) {
+                if (!has_dot &amp;&amp; !has_x &amp;&amp; !has_e)
+                    return has_dot = true;
+                return false;
+            }
+            return is_alphanumeric_char(ch);
+        });
+        if (prefix)
+            num = prefix + num;
+        var valid = parse_js_number(num);
+        if (!isNaN(valid)) {
+            return token(&quot;num&quot;, valid);
+        } else {
+            parse_error(&quot;Invalid syntax: &quot; + num);
+        }
+    };
+
+    function read_escaped_char(in_string) {
+        var ch = next(true, in_string);
+        switch (ch) {
+          case &quot;n&quot; : return &quot;\n&quot;;
+          case &quot;r&quot; : return &quot;\r&quot;;
+          case &quot;t&quot; : return &quot;\t&quot;;
+          case &quot;b&quot; : return &quot;\b&quot;;
+          case &quot;v&quot; : return &quot;\u000b&quot;;
+          case &quot;f&quot; : return &quot;\f&quot;;
+          case &quot;0&quot; : return &quot;\0&quot;;
+          case &quot;x&quot; : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(2));
+          case &quot;u&quot; : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(4));
+          case &quot;\n&quot;: return &quot;&quot;;
+          default  : return ch;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function hex_bytes(n) {
+        var num = 0;
+        for (; n &gt; 0; --n) {
+            var digit = parseInt(next(true), 16);
+            if (isNaN(digit))
+                parse_error(&quot;Invalid hex-character pattern in string&quot;);
+            num = (num &lt;&lt; 4) | digit;
+        }
+        return num;
+    };
+
+    function read_string() {
+        return with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated string constant&quot;, function(){
+            var quote = next(), ret = &quot;&quot;;
+            for (;;) {
+                var ch = next(true);
+                if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) {
+                    // read OctalEscapeSequence (XXX: deprecated if &quot;strict mode&quot;)
+                    // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/178
+                    var octal_len = 0, first = null;
+                    ch = read_while(function(ch){
+                        if (ch &gt;= &quot;0&quot; &amp;&amp; ch &lt;= &quot;7&quot;) {
+                            if (!first) {
+                                first = ch;
+                                return ++octal_len;
+                            }
+                            else if (first &lt;= &quot;3&quot; &amp;&amp; octal_len &lt;= 2) return ++octal_len;
+                            else if (first &gt;= &quot;4&quot; &amp;&amp; octal_len &lt;= 1) return ++octal_len;
+                        }
+                        return false;
+                    });
+                    if (octal_len &gt; 0) ch = String.fromCharCode(parseInt(ch, 8));
+                    else ch = read_escaped_char(true);
+                }
+                else if (ch == quote) break;
+                else if (ch == &quot;\n&quot;) throw EX_EOF;
+                ret += ch;
+            }
+            return token(&quot;string&quot;, ret);
+        });
+    };
+
+    function read_line_comment() {
+        next();
+        var i = find(&quot;\n&quot;), ret;
+        if (i == -1) {
+            ret = S.text.substr(S.pos);
+            S.pos = S.text.length;
+        } else {
+            ret = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
+            S.pos = i;
+        }
+        return token(&quot;comment1&quot;, ret, true);
+    };
+
+    function read_multiline_comment() {
+        next();
+        return with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated multiline comment&quot;, function(){
+            var i = find(&quot;*/&quot;, true),
+            text = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
+            S.pos = i + 2;
+            S.line += text.split(&quot;\n&quot;).length - 1;
+            S.newline_before = S.newline_before || text.indexOf(&quot;\n&quot;) &gt;= 0;
+
+            // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/#issue/100
+            if (/^@cc_on/i.test(text)) {
+                warn(&quot;WARNING: at line &quot; + S.line);
+                warn(&quot;*** Found \&quot;conditional comment\&quot;: &quot; + text);
+                warn(&quot;*** UglifyJS DISCARDS ALL COMMENTS.  This means your code might no longer work properly in Internet Explorer.&quot;);
+            }
+
+            return token(&quot;comment2&quot;, text, true);
+        });
+    };
+
+    function read_name() {
+        var backslash = false, name = &quot;&quot;, ch, escaped = false, hex;
+        while ((ch = peek()) != null) {
+            if (!backslash) {
+                if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) escaped = backslash = true, next();
+                else if (is_identifier_char(ch)) name += next();
+                else break;
+            }
+            else {
+                if (ch != &quot;u&quot;) parse_error(&quot;Expecting UnicodeEscapeSequence -- uXXXX&quot;);
+                ch = read_escaped_char();
+                if (!is_identifier_char(ch)) parse_error(&quot;Unicode char: &quot; + ch.charCodeAt(0) + &quot; is not valid in identifier&quot;);
+                name += ch;
+                backslash = false;
+            }
+        }
+        if (HOP(KEYWORDS, name) &amp;&amp; escaped) {
+            hex = name.charCodeAt(0).toString(16).toUpperCase();
+            name = &quot;\\u&quot; + &quot;0000&quot;.substr(hex.length) + hex + name.slice(1);
+        }
+        return name;
+    };
+
+    function read_regexp(regexp) {
+        return with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated regular expression&quot;, function(){
+            var prev_backslash = false, ch, in_class = false;
+            while ((ch = next(true))) if (prev_backslash) {
+                regexp += &quot;\\&quot; + ch;
+                prev_backslash = false;
+            } else if (ch == &quot;[&quot;) {
+                in_class = true;
+                regexp += ch;
+            } else if (ch == &quot;]&quot; &amp;&amp; in_class) {
+                in_class = false;
+                regexp += ch;
+            } else if (ch == &quot;/&quot; &amp;&amp; !in_class) {
+                break;
+            } else if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) {
+                prev_backslash = true;
+            } else {
+                regexp += ch;
+            }
+            var mods = read_name();
+            return token(&quot;regexp&quot;, [ regexp, mods ]);
+        });
+    };
+
+    function read_operator(prefix) {
+        function grow(op) {
+            if (!peek()) return op;
+            var bigger = op + peek();
+            if (HOP(OPERATORS, bigger)) {
+                next();
+                return grow(bigger);
+            } else {
+                return op;
+            }
+        };
+        return token(&quot;operator&quot;, grow(prefix || next()));
+    };
+
+    function handle_slash() {
+        next();
+        var regex_allowed = S.regex_allowed;
+        switch (peek()) {
+          case &quot;/&quot;:
+            S.comments_before.push(read_line_comment());
+            S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
+            return next_token();
+          case &quot;*&quot;:
+            S.comments_before.push(read_multiline_comment());
+            S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
+            return next_token();
+        }
+        return S.regex_allowed ? read_regexp(&quot;&quot;) : read_operator(&quot;/&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function handle_dot() {
+        next();
+        return is_digit(peek())
+            ? read_num(&quot;.&quot;)
+            : token(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;.&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function read_word() {
+        var word = read_name();
+        return !HOP(KEYWORDS, word)
+            ? token(&quot;name&quot;, word)
+            : HOP(OPERATORS, word)
+            ? token(&quot;operator&quot;, word)
+            : HOP(KEYWORDS_ATOM, word)
+            ? token(&quot;atom&quot;, word)
+            : token(&quot;keyword&quot;, word);
+    };
+
+    function with_eof_error(eof_error, cont) {
+        try {
+            return cont();
+        } catch(ex) {
+            if (ex === EX_EOF) parse_error(eof_error);
+            else throw ex;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function next_token(force_regexp) {
+        if (force_regexp != null)
+            return read_regexp(force_regexp);
+        skip_whitespace();
+        start_token();
+        var ch = peek();
+        if (!ch) return token(&quot;eof&quot;);
+        if (is_digit(ch)) return read_num();
+        if (ch == '&quot;' || ch == &quot;'&quot;) return read_string();
+        if (HOP(PUNC_CHARS, ch)) return token(&quot;punc&quot;, next());
+        if (ch == &quot;.&quot;) return handle_dot();
+        if (ch == &quot;/&quot;) return handle_slash();
+        if (HOP(OPERATOR_CHARS, ch)) return read_operator();
+        if (ch == &quot;\\&quot; || is_identifier_start(ch)) return read_word();
+        parse_error(&quot;Unexpected character '&quot; + ch + &quot;'&quot;);
+    };
+
+    next_token.context = function(nc) {
+        if (nc) S = nc;
+        return S;
+    };
+
+    return next_token;
+
+};
+
+/* -----[ Parser (constants) ]----- */
+
+var UNARY_PREFIX = array_to_hash([
+    &quot;typeof&quot;,
+    &quot;void&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;--&quot;,
+    &quot;++&quot;,
+    &quot;!&quot;,
+    &quot;~&quot;,
+    &quot;-&quot;,
+    &quot;+&quot;
+]);
+
+var UNARY_POSTFIX = array_to_hash([ &quot;--&quot;, &quot;++&quot; ]);
+
+var ASSIGNMENT = (function(a, ret, i){
+    while (i &lt; a.length) {
+        ret[a[i]] = a[i].substr(0, a[i].length - 1);
+        i++;
+    }
+    return ret;
+})(
+    [&quot;+=&quot;, &quot;-=&quot;, &quot;/=&quot;, &quot;*=&quot;, &quot;%=&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;&lt;&lt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;|=&quot;, &quot;^=&quot;, &quot;&amp;=&quot;],
+    { &quot;=&quot;: true },
+    0
+);
+
+var PRECEDENCE = (function(a, ret){
+    for (var i = 0, n = 1; i &lt; a.length; ++i, ++n) {
+        var b = a[i];
+        for (var j = 0; j &lt; b.length; ++j) {
+            ret[b[j]] = n;
+        }
+    }
+    return ret;
+})(
+    [
+        [&quot;||&quot;],
+        [&quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;],
+        [&quot;|&quot;],
+        [&quot;^&quot;],
+        [&quot;&amp;&quot;],
+        [&quot;==&quot;, &quot;===&quot;, &quot;!=&quot;, &quot;!==&quot;],
+        [&quot;&lt;&quot;, &quot;&gt;&quot;, &quot;&lt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;in&quot;, &quot;instanceof&quot;],
+        [&quot;&gt;&gt;&quot;, &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;&quot;],
+        [&quot;+&quot;, &quot;-&quot;],
+        [&quot;*&quot;, &quot;/&quot;, &quot;%&quot;]
+    ],
+    {}
+);
+
+var STATEMENTS_WITH_LABELS = array_to_hash([ &quot;for&quot;, &quot;do&quot;, &quot;while&quot;, &quot;switch&quot; ]);
+
+var ATOMIC_START_TOKEN = array_to_hash([ &quot;atom&quot;, &quot;num&quot;, &quot;string&quot;, &quot;regexp&quot;, &quot;name&quot; ]);
+
+/* -----[ Parser ]----- */
+
+function NodeWithToken(str, start, end) {
+    this.name = str;
+    this.start = start;
+    this.end = end;
+};
+
+NodeWithToken.prototype.toString = function() { return this.name; };
+
+function parse($TEXT, exigent_mode, embed_tokens) {
+
+    var S = {
+        input         : typeof $TEXT == &quot;string&quot; ? tokenizer($TEXT, true) : $TEXT,
+        token         : null,
+        prev          : null,
+        peeked        : null,
+        in_function   : 0,
+        in_directives : true,
+        in_loop       : 0,
+        labels        : []
+    };
+
+    S.token = next();
+
+    function is(type, value) {
+        return is_token(S.token, type, value);
+    };
+
+    function peek() { return S.peeked || (S.peeked = S.input()); };
+
+    function next() {
+        S.prev = S.token;
+        if (S.peeked) {
+            S.token = S.peeked;
+            S.peeked = null;
+        } else {
+            S.token = S.input();
+        }
+        S.in_directives = S.in_directives &amp;&amp; (
+            S.token.type == &quot;string&quot; || is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)
+        );
+        return S.token;
+    };
+
+    function prev() {
+        return S.prev;
+    };
+
+    function croak(msg, line, col, pos) {
+        var ctx = S.input.context();
+        js_error(msg,
+                 line != null ? line : ctx.tokline,
+                 col != null ? col : ctx.tokcol,
+                 pos != null ? pos : ctx.tokpos);
+    };
+
+    function token_error(token, msg) {
+        croak(msg, token.line, token.col);
+    };
+
+    function unexpected(token) {
+        if (token == null)
+            token = S.token;
+        token_error(token, &quot;Unexpected token: &quot; + token.type + &quot; (&quot; + token.value + &quot;)&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function expect_token(type, val) {
+        if (is(type, val)) {
+            return next();
+        }
+        token_error(S.token, &quot;Unexpected token &quot; + S.token.type + &quot;, expected &quot; + type);
+    };
+
+    function expect(punc) { return expect_token(&quot;punc&quot;, punc); };
+
+    function can_insert_semicolon() {
+        return !exigent_mode &amp;&amp; (
+            S.token.nlb || is(&quot;eof&quot;) || is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)
+        );
+    };
+
+    function semicolon() {
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)) next();
+        else if (!can_insert_semicolon()) unexpected();
+    };
+
+    function as() {
+        return slice(arguments);
+    };
+
+    function parenthesised() {
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        var ex = expression();
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return ex;
+    };
+
+    function add_tokens(str, start, end) {
+        return str instanceof NodeWithToken ? str : new NodeWithToken(str, start, end);
+    };
+
+    function maybe_embed_tokens(parser) {
+        if (embed_tokens) return function() {
+            var start = S.token;
+            var ast = parser.apply(this, arguments);
+            ast[0] = add_tokens(ast[0], start, prev());
+            return ast;
+        };
+        else return parser;
+    };
+
+    var statement = maybe_embed_tokens(function() {
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;/&quot;) || is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;/=&quot;)) {
+            S.peeked = null;
+            S.token = S.input(S.token.value.substr(1)); // force regexp
+        }
+        switch (S.token.type) {
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+            var dir = S.in_directives, stat = simple_statement();
+            if (dir &amp;&amp; stat[1][0] == &quot;string&quot; &amp;&amp; !is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;))
+                return as(&quot;directive&quot;, stat[1][1]);
+            return stat;
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+          case &quot;regexp&quot;:
+          case &quot;operator&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            return simple_statement();
+
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+            return is_token(peek(), &quot;punc&quot;, &quot;:&quot;)
+                ? labeled_statement(prog1(S.token.value, next, next))
+                : simple_statement();
+
+          case &quot;punc&quot;:
+            switch (S.token.value) {
+              case &quot;{&quot;:
+                return as(&quot;block&quot;, block_());
+              case &quot;[&quot;:
+              case &quot;(&quot;:
+                return simple_statement();
+              case &quot;;&quot;:
+                next();
+                return as(&quot;block&quot;);
+              default:
+                unexpected();
+            }
+
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+            switch (prog1(S.token.value, next)) {
+              case &quot;break&quot;:
+                return break_cont(&quot;break&quot;);
+
+              case &quot;continue&quot;:
+                return break_cont(&quot;continue&quot;);
+
+              case &quot;debugger&quot;:
+                semicolon();
+                return as(&quot;debugger&quot;);
+
+              case &quot;do&quot;:
+                return (function(body){
+                    expect_token(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;while&quot;);
+                    return as(&quot;do&quot;, prog1(parenthesised, semicolon), body);
+                })(in_loop(statement));
+
+              case &quot;for&quot;:
+                return for_();
+
+              case &quot;function&quot;:
+                return function_(true);
+
+              case &quot;if&quot;:
+                return if_();
+
+              case &quot;return&quot;:
+                if (S.in_function == 0)
+                    croak(&quot;'return' outside of function&quot;);
+                return as(&quot;return&quot;,
+                          is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)
+                          ? (next(), null)
+                          : can_insert_semicolon()
+                          ? null
+                          : prog1(expression, semicolon));
+
+              case &quot;switch&quot;:
+                return as(&quot;switch&quot;, parenthesised(), switch_block_());
+
+              case &quot;throw&quot;:
+                if (S.token.nlb)
+                    croak(&quot;Illegal newline after 'throw'&quot;);
+                return as(&quot;throw&quot;, prog1(expression, semicolon));
+
+              case &quot;try&quot;:
+                return try_();
+
+              case &quot;var&quot;:
+                return prog1(var_, semicolon);
+
+              case &quot;const&quot;:
+                return prog1(const_, semicolon);
+
+              case &quot;while&quot;:
+                return as(&quot;while&quot;, parenthesised(), in_loop(statement));
+
+              case &quot;with&quot;:
+                return as(&quot;with&quot;, parenthesised(), statement());
+
+              default:
+                unexpected();
+            }
+        }
+    });
+
+    function labeled_statement(label) {
+        S.labels.push(label);
+        var start = S.token, stat = statement();
+        if (exigent_mode &amp;&amp; !HOP(STATEMENTS_WITH_LABELS, stat[0]))
+            unexpected(start);
+        S.labels.pop();
+        return as(&quot;label&quot;, label, stat);
+    };
+
+    function simple_statement() {
+        return as(&quot;stat&quot;, prog1(expression, semicolon));
+    };
+
+    function break_cont(type) {
+        var name;
+        if (!can_insert_semicolon()) {
+            name = is(&quot;name&quot;) ? S.token.value : null;
+        }
+        if (name != null) {
+            next();
+            if (!member(name, S.labels))
+                croak(&quot;Label &quot; + name + &quot; without matching loop or statement&quot;);
+        }
+        else if (S.in_loop == 0)
+            croak(type + &quot; not inside a loop or switch&quot;);
+        semicolon();
+        return as(type, name);
+    };
+
+    function for_() {
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        var init = null;
+        if (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)) {
+            init = is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;var&quot;)
+                ? (next(), var_(true))
+                : expression(true, true);
+            if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;in&quot;)) {
+                if (init[0] == &quot;var&quot; &amp;&amp; init[1].length &gt; 1)
+                    croak(&quot;Only one variable declaration allowed in for..in loop&quot;);
+                return for_in(init);
+            }
+        }
+        return regular_for(init);
+    };
+
+    function regular_for(init) {
+        expect(&quot;;&quot;);
+        var test = is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;) ? null : expression();
+        expect(&quot;;&quot;);
+        var step = is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;)&quot;) ? null : expression();
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return as(&quot;for&quot;, init, test, step, in_loop(statement));
+    };
+
+    function for_in(init) {
+        var lhs = init[0] == &quot;var&quot; ? as(&quot;name&quot;, init[1][0]) : init;
+        next();
+        var obj = expression();
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return as(&quot;for-in&quot;, init, lhs, obj, in_loop(statement));
+    };
+
+    var function_ = function(in_statement) {
+        var name = is(&quot;name&quot;) ? prog1(S.token.value, next) : null;
+        if (in_statement &amp;&amp; !name)
+            unexpected();
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        return as(in_statement ? &quot;defun&quot; : &quot;function&quot;,
+                  name,
+                  // arguments
+                  (function(first, a){
+                      while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;)&quot;)) {
+                          if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+                          if (!is(&quot;name&quot;)) unexpected();
+                          a.push(S.token.value);
+                          next();
+                      }
+                      next();
+                      return a;
+                  })(true, []),
+                  // body
+                  (function(){
+                      ++S.in_function;
+                      var loop = S.in_loop;
+                      S.in_directives = true;
+                      S.in_loop = 0;
+                      var a = block_();
+                      --S.in_function;
+                      S.in_loop = loop;
+                      return a;
+                  })());
+    };
+
+    function if_() {
+        var cond = parenthesised(), body = statement(), belse;
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;else&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            belse = statement();
+        }
+        return as(&quot;if&quot;, cond, body, belse);
+    };
+
+    function block_() {
+        expect(&quot;{&quot;);
+        var a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (is(&quot;eof&quot;)) unexpected();
+            a.push(statement());
+        }
+        next();
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    var switch_block_ = curry(in_loop, function(){
+        expect(&quot;{&quot;);
+        var a = [], cur = null;
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (is(&quot;eof&quot;)) unexpected();
+            if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;case&quot;)) {
+                next();
+                cur = [];
+                a.push([ expression(), cur ]);
+                expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+            }
+            else if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;default&quot;)) {
+                next();
+                expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+                cur = [];
+                a.push([ null, cur ]);
+            }
+            else {
+                if (!cur) unexpected();
+                cur.push(statement());
+            }
+        }
+        next();
+        return a;
+    });
+
+    function try_() {
+        var body = block_(), bcatch, bfinally;
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;catch&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+            if (!is(&quot;name&quot;))
+                croak(&quot;Name expected&quot;);
+            var name = S.token.value;
+            next();
+            expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+            bcatch = [ name, block_() ];
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;finally&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            bfinally = block_();
+        }
+        if (!bcatch &amp;&amp; !bfinally)
+            croak(&quot;Missing catch/finally blocks&quot;);
+        return as(&quot;try&quot;, body, bcatch, bfinally);
+    };
+
+    function vardefs(no_in) {
+        var a = [];
+        for (;;) {
+            if (!is(&quot;name&quot;))
+                unexpected();
+            var name = S.token.value;
+            next();
+            if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;=&quot;)) {
+                next();
+                a.push([ name, expression(false, no_in) ]);
+            } else {
+                a.push([ name ]);
+            }
+            if (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;))
+                break;
+            next();
+        }
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    function var_(no_in) {
+        return as(&quot;var&quot;, vardefs(no_in));
+    };
+
+    function const_() {
+        return as(&quot;const&quot;, vardefs());
+    };
+
+    function new_() {
+        var newexp = expr_atom(false), args;
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;(&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            args = expr_list(&quot;)&quot;);
+        } else {
+            args = [];
+        }
+        return subscripts(as(&quot;new&quot;, newexp, args), true);
+    };
+
+    var expr_atom = maybe_embed_tokens(function(allow_calls) {
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;new&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return new_();
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;)) {
+            switch (S.token.value) {
+              case &quot;(&quot;:
+                next();
+                return subscripts(prog1(expression, curry(expect, &quot;)&quot;)), allow_calls);
+              case &quot;[&quot;:
+                next();
+                return subscripts(array_(), allow_calls);
+              case &quot;{&quot;:
+                next();
+                return subscripts(object_(), allow_calls);
+            }
+            unexpected();
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;function&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return subscripts(function_(false), allow_calls);
+        }
+        if (HOP(ATOMIC_START_TOKEN, S.token.type)) {
+            var atom = S.token.type == &quot;regexp&quot;
+                ? as(&quot;regexp&quot;, S.token.value[0], S.token.value[1])
+                : as(S.token.type, S.token.value);
+            return subscripts(prog1(atom, next), allow_calls);
+        }
+        unexpected();
+    });
+
+    function expr_list(closing, allow_trailing_comma, allow_empty) {
+        var first = true, a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, closing)) {
+            if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+            if (allow_trailing_comma &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, closing)) break;
+            if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;) &amp;&amp; allow_empty) {
+                a.push([ &quot;atom&quot;, &quot;undefined&quot; ]);
+            } else {
+                a.push(expression(false));
+            }
+        }
+        next();
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    function array_() {
+        return as(&quot;array&quot;, expr_list(&quot;]&quot;, !exigent_mode, true));
+    };
+
+    function object_() {
+        var first = true, a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+            if (!exigent_mode &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;))
+                // allow trailing comma
+                break;
+            var type = S.token.type;
+            var name = as_property_name();
+            if (type == &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp; (name == &quot;get&quot; || name == &quot;set&quot;) &amp;&amp; !is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;:&quot;)) {
+                a.push([ as_name(), function_(false), name ]);
+            } else {
+                expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+                a.push([ name, expression(false) ]);
+            }
+        }
+        next();
+        return as(&quot;object&quot;, a);
+    };
+
+    function as_property_name() {
+        switch (S.token.type) {
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+            return prog1(S.token.value, next);
+        }
+        return as_name();
+    };
+
+    function as_name() {
+        switch (S.token.type) {
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+          case &quot;operator&quot;:
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            return prog1(S.token.value, next);
+          default:
+            unexpected();
+        }
+    };
+
+    function subscripts(expr, allow_calls) {
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;.&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return subscripts(as(&quot;dot&quot;, expr, as_name()), allow_calls);
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;[&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return subscripts(as(&quot;sub&quot;, expr, prog1(expression, curry(expect, &quot;]&quot;))), allow_calls);
+        }
+        if (allow_calls &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;(&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return subscripts(as(&quot;call&quot;, expr, expr_list(&quot;)&quot;)), true);
+        }
+        return expr;
+    };
+
+    function maybe_unary(allow_calls) {
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;) &amp;&amp; HOP(UNARY_PREFIX, S.token.value)) {
+            return make_unary(&quot;unary-prefix&quot;,
+                              prog1(S.token.value, next),
+                              maybe_unary(allow_calls));
+        }
+        var val = expr_atom(allow_calls);
+        while (is(&quot;operator&quot;) &amp;&amp; HOP(UNARY_POSTFIX, S.token.value) &amp;&amp; !S.token.nlb) {
+            val = make_unary(&quot;unary-postfix&quot;, S.token.value, val);
+            next();
+        }
+        return val;
+    };
+
+    function make_unary(tag, op, expr) {
+        if ((op == &quot;++&quot; || op == &quot;--&quot;) &amp;&amp; !is_assignable(expr))
+            croak(&quot;Invalid use of &quot; + op + &quot; operator&quot;);
+        return as(tag, op, expr);
+    };
+
+    function expr_op(left, min_prec, no_in) {
+        var op = is(&quot;operator&quot;) ? S.token.value : null;
+        if (op &amp;&amp; op == &quot;in&quot; &amp;&amp; no_in) op = null;
+        var prec = op != null ? PRECEDENCE[op] : null;
+        if (prec != null &amp;&amp; prec &gt; min_prec) {
+            next();
+            var right = expr_op(maybe_unary(true), prec, no_in);
+            return expr_op(as(&quot;binary&quot;, op, left, right), min_prec, no_in);
+        }
+        return left;
+    };
+
+    function expr_ops(no_in) {
+        return expr_op(maybe_unary(true), 0, no_in);
+    };
+
+    function maybe_conditional(no_in) {
+        var expr = expr_ops(no_in);
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;?&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            var yes = expression(false);
+            expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+            return as(&quot;conditional&quot;, expr, yes, expression(false, no_in));
+        }
+        return expr;
+    };
+
+    function is_assignable(expr) {
+        if (!exigent_mode) return true;
+        switch (expr[0]+&quot;&quot;) {
+          case &quot;dot&quot;:
+          case &quot;sub&quot;:
+          case &quot;new&quot;:
+          case &quot;call&quot;:
+            return true;
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+            return expr[1] != &quot;this&quot;;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function maybe_assign(no_in) {
+        var left = maybe_conditional(no_in), val = S.token.value;
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;) &amp;&amp; HOP(ASSIGNMENT, val)) {
+            if (is_assignable(left)) {
+                next();
+                return as(&quot;assign&quot;, ASSIGNMENT[val], left, maybe_assign(no_in));
+            }
+            croak(&quot;Invalid assignment&quot;);
+        }
+        return left;
+    };
+
+    var expression = maybe_embed_tokens(function(commas, no_in) {
+        if (arguments.length == 0)
+            commas = true;
+        var expr = maybe_assign(no_in);
+        if (commas &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return as(&quot;seq&quot;, expr, expression(true, no_in));
+        }
+        return expr;
+    });
+
+    function in_loop(cont) {
+        try {
+            ++S.in_loop;
+            return cont();
+        } finally {
+            --S.in_loop;
+        }
+    };
+
+    return as(&quot;toplevel&quot;, (function(a){
+        while (!is(&quot;eof&quot;))
+            a.push(statement());
+        return a;
+    })([]));
+
+};
+
+/* -----[ Utilities ]----- */
+
+function curry(f) {
+    var args = slice(arguments, 1);
+    return function() { return f.apply(this, args.concat(slice(arguments))); };
+};
+
+function prog1(ret) {
+    if (ret instanceof Function)
+        ret = ret();
+    for (var i = 1, n = arguments.length; --n &gt; 0; ++i)
+        arguments[i]();
+    return ret;
+};
+
+function array_to_hash(a) {
+    var ret = {};
+    for (var i = 0; i &lt; a.length; ++i)
+        ret[a[i]] = true;
+    return ret;
+};
+
+function slice(a, start) {
+    return Array.prototype.slice.call(a, start || 0);
+};
+
+function characters(str) {
+    return str.split(&quot;&quot;);
+};
+
+function member(name, array) {
+    for (var i = array.length; --i &gt;= 0;)
+        if (array[i] == name)
+            return true;
+    return false;
+};
+
+function HOP(obj, prop) {
+    return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(obj, prop);
+};
+
+var warn = function() {};
+
+/* -----[ Exports ]----- */
+
+exports.tokenizer = tokenizer;
+exports.parse = parse;
+exports.slice = slice;
+exports.curry = curry;
+exports.member = member;
+exports.array_to_hash = array_to_hash;
+exports.PRECEDENCE = PRECEDENCE;
+exports.KEYWORDS_ATOM = KEYWORDS_ATOM;
+exports.RESERVED_WORDS = RESERVED_WORDS;
+exports.KEYWORDS = KEYWORDS;
+exports.ATOMIC_START_TOKEN = ATOMIC_START_TOKEN;
+exports.OPERATORS = OPERATORS;
+exports.is_alphanumeric_char = is_alphanumeric_char;
+exports.is_identifier_start = is_identifier_start;
+exports.is_identifier_char = is_identifier_char;
+exports.set_logger = function(logger) {
+    warn = logger;
+};
+
+// Local variables:
+// js-indent-level: 4
+// End:
+});define('uglifyjs/squeeze-more', [&quot;require&quot;, &quot;exports&quot;, &quot;module&quot;, &quot;./parse-js&quot;, &quot;./squeeze-more&quot;], function(require, exports, module) {
+var jsp = require(&quot;./parse-js&quot;),
+    pro = require(&quot;./process&quot;),
+    slice = jsp.slice,
+    member = jsp.member,
+    curry = jsp.curry,
+    MAP = pro.MAP,
+    PRECEDENCE = jsp.PRECEDENCE,
+    OPERATORS = jsp.OPERATORS;
+
+function ast_squeeze_more(ast) {
+    var w = pro.ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
+    function with_scope(s, cont) {
+        var save = scope, ret;
+        scope = s;
+        ret = cont();
+        scope = save;
+        return ret;
+    };
+    function _lambda(name, args, body) {
+        return [ this[0], name, args, with_scope(body.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
+    };
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(body) {
+            return [ this[0], with_scope(this.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
+        },
+        &quot;function&quot;: _lambda,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: _lambda,
+        &quot;new&quot;: function(ctor, args) {
+            if (ctor[0] == &quot;name&quot;) {
+                if (ctor[1] == &quot;Array&quot; &amp;&amp; !scope.has(&quot;Array&quot;)) {
+                    if (args.length != 1) {
+                        return [ &quot;array&quot;, args ];
+                    } else {
+                        return walk([ &quot;call&quot;, [ &quot;name&quot;, &quot;Array&quot; ], args ]);
+                    }
+                } else if (ctor[1] == &quot;Object&quot; &amp;&amp; !scope.has(&quot;Object&quot;)) {
+                    if (!args.length) {
+                        return [ &quot;object&quot;, [] ];
+                    } else {
+                        return walk([ &quot;call&quot;, [ &quot;name&quot;, &quot;Object&quot; ], args ]);
+                    }
+                } else if ((ctor[1] == &quot;RegExp&quot; || ctor[1] == &quot;Function&quot; || ctor[1] == &quot;Error&quot;) &amp;&amp; !scope.has(ctor[1])) {
+                    return walk([ &quot;call&quot;, [ &quot;name&quot;, ctor[1] ], args]);
+                }
+            }
+        },
+        &quot;call&quot;: function(expr, args) {
+            if (expr[0] == &quot;dot&quot; &amp;&amp; expr[1][0] == &quot;string&quot; &amp;&amp; args.length == 1
+                &amp;&amp; (args[0][1] &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; expr[2] == &quot;substring&quot; || expr[2] == &quot;substr&quot;)) {
+                return [ &quot;call&quot;, [ &quot;dot&quot;, expr[1], &quot;slice&quot;], args];
+            }
+            if (expr[0] == &quot;dot&quot; &amp;&amp; expr[2] == &quot;toString&quot; &amp;&amp; args.length == 0) {
+                // foo.toString()  ==&gt;  foo+&quot;&quot;
+                if (expr[1][0] == &quot;string&quot;) return expr[1];
+                return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;+&quot;, expr[1], [ &quot;string&quot;, &quot;&quot; ]];
+            }
+            if (expr[0] == &quot;name&quot;) {
+                if (expr[1] == &quot;Array&quot; &amp;&amp; args.length != 1 &amp;&amp; !scope.has(&quot;Array&quot;)) {
+                    return [ &quot;array&quot;, args ];
+                }
+                if (expr[1] == &quot;Object&quot; &amp;&amp; !args.length &amp;&amp; !scope.has(&quot;Object&quot;)) {
+                    return [ &quot;object&quot;, [] ];
+                }
+                if (expr[1] == &quot;String&quot; &amp;&amp; !scope.has(&quot;String&quot;)) {
+                    return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;+&quot;, args[0], [ &quot;string&quot;, &quot;&quot; ]];
+                }
+            }
+        }
+    }, function() {
+        return walk(pro.ast_add_scope(ast));
+    });
+};
+
+exports.ast_squeeze_more = ast_squeeze_more;
+
+// Local variables:
+// js-indent-level: 4
+// End:
+});
+define('uglifyjs/process', [&quot;require&quot;, &quot;exports&quot;, &quot;module&quot;, &quot;./parse-js&quot;, &quot;./squeeze-more&quot;], function(require, exports, module) {
+/***********************************************************************
+
+  A JavaScript tokenizer / parser / beautifier / compressor.
+
+  This version is suitable for Node.js.  With minimal changes (the
+  exports stuff) it should work on any JS platform.
+
+  This file implements some AST processors.  They work on data built
+  by parse-js.
+
+  Exported functions:
+
+    - ast_mangle(ast, options) -- mangles the variable/function names
+      in the AST.  Returns an AST.
+
+    - ast_squeeze(ast) -- employs various optimizations to make the
+      final generated code even smaller.  Returns an AST.
+
+    - gen_code(ast, options) -- generates JS code from the AST.  Pass
+      true (or an object, see the code for some options) as second
+      argument to get &quot;pretty&quot; (indented) code.
+
+  -------------------------------- (C) ---------------------------------
+
+                           Author: Mihai Bazon
+                         &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+                       http://mihai.bazon.net/blog
+
+  Distributed under the BSD license:
+
+    Copyright 2010 (c) Mihai Bazon &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+
+    Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
+    modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
+    are met:
+
+        * Redistributions of source code must retain the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer.
+
+        * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
+          provided with the distribution.
+
+    THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER “AS IS” AND ANY
+    EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
+    IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
+    PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE
+    LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY,
+    OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
+    PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
+    PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
+    THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR
+    TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF
+    THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF
+    SUCH DAMAGE.
+
+ ***********************************************************************/
+
+var jsp = require(&quot;./parse-js&quot;),
+    curry = jsp.curry,
+    slice = jsp.slice,
+    member = jsp.member,
+    is_identifier_char = jsp.is_identifier_char,
+    PRECEDENCE = jsp.PRECEDENCE,
+    OPERATORS = jsp.OPERATORS;
+
+/* -----[ helper for AST traversal ]----- */
+
+function ast_walker() {
+    function _vardefs(defs) {
+        return [ this[0], MAP(defs, function(def){
+            var a = [ def[0] ];
+            if (def.length &gt; 1)
+                a[1] = walk(def[1]);
+            return a;
+        }) ];
+    };
+    function _block(statements) {
+        var out = [ this[0] ];
+        if (statements != null)
+            out.push(MAP(statements, walk));
+        return out;
+    };
+    var walkers = {
+        &quot;string&quot;: function(str) {
+            return [ this[0], str ];
+        },
+        &quot;num&quot;: function(num) {
+            return [ this[0], num ];
+        },
+        &quot;name&quot;: function(name) {
+            return [ this[0], name ];
+        },
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(statements) {
+            return [ this[0], MAP(statements, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;block&quot;: _block,
+        &quot;splice&quot;: _block,
+        &quot;var&quot;: _vardefs,
+        &quot;const&quot;: _vardefs,
+        &quot;try&quot;: function(t, c, f) {
+            return [
+                this[0],
+                MAP(t, walk),
+                c != null ? [ c[0], MAP(c[1], walk) ] : null,
+                f != null ? MAP(f, walk) : null
+            ];
+        },
+        &quot;throw&quot;: function(expr) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr) ];
+        },
+        &quot;new&quot;: function(ctor, args) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(ctor), MAP(args, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;switch&quot;: function(expr, body) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr), MAP(body, function(branch){
+                return [ branch[0] ? walk(branch[0]) : null,
+                         MAP(branch[1], walk) ];
+            }) ];
+        },
+        &quot;break&quot;: function(label) {
+            return [ this[0], label ];
+        },
+        &quot;continue&quot;: function(label) {
+            return [ this[0], label ];
+        },
+        &quot;conditional&quot;: function(cond, t, e) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(cond), walk(t), walk(e) ];
+        },
+        &quot;assign&quot;: function(op, lvalue, rvalue) {
+            return [ this[0], op, walk(lvalue), walk(rvalue) ];
+        },
+        &quot;dot&quot;: function(expr) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr) ].concat(slice(arguments, 1));
+        },
+        &quot;call&quot;: function(expr, args) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr), MAP(args, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;function&quot;: function(name, args, body) {
+            return [ this[0], name, args.slice(), MAP(body, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;debugger&quot;: function() {
+            return [ this[0] ];
+        },
+        &quot;defun&quot;: function(name, args, body) {
+            return [ this[0], name, args.slice(), MAP(body, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;if&quot;: function(conditional, t, e) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(conditional), walk(t), walk(e) ];
+        },
+        &quot;for&quot;: function(init, cond, step, block) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(init), walk(cond), walk(step), walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;for-in&quot;: function(vvar, key, hash, block) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(vvar), walk(key), walk(hash), walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;while&quot;: function(cond, block) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(cond), walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;do&quot;: function(cond, block) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(cond), walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;return&quot;: function(expr) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr) ];
+        },
+        &quot;binary&quot;: function(op, left, right) {
+            return [ this[0], op, walk(left), walk(right) ];
+        },
+        &quot;unary-prefix&quot;: function(op, expr) {
+            return [ this[0], op, walk(expr) ];
+        },
+        &quot;unary-postfix&quot;: function(op, expr) {
+            return [ this[0], op, walk(expr) ];
+        },
+        &quot;sub&quot;: function(expr, subscript) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr), walk(subscript) ];
+        },
+        &quot;object&quot;: function(props) {
+            return [ this[0], MAP(props, function(p){
+                return p.length == 2
+                    ? [ p[0], walk(p[1]) ]
+                    : [ p[0], walk(p[1]), p[2] ]; // get/set-ter
+            }) ];
+        },
+        &quot;regexp&quot;: function(rx, mods) {
+            return [ this[0], rx, mods ];
+        },
+        &quot;array&quot;: function(elements) {
+            return [ this[0], MAP(elements, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;stat&quot;: function(stat) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(stat) ];
+        },
+        &quot;seq&quot;: function() {
+            return [ this[0] ].concat(MAP(slice(arguments), walk));
+        },
+        &quot;label&quot;: function(name, block) {
+            return [ this[0], name, walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;with&quot;: function(expr, block) {
+            return [ this[0], walk(expr), walk(block) ];
+        },
+        &quot;atom&quot;: function(name) {
+            return [ this[0], name ];
+        },
+        &quot;directive&quot;: function(dir) {
+            return [ this[0], dir ];
+        }
+    };
+
+    var user = {};
+    var stack = [];
+    function walk(ast) {
+        if (ast == null)
+            return null;
+        try {
+            stack.push(ast);
+            var type = ast[0];
+            var gen = user[type];
+            if (gen) {
+                var ret = gen.apply(ast, ast.slice(1));
+                if (ret != null)
+                    return ret;
+            }
+            gen = walkers[type];
+            return gen.apply(ast, ast.slice(1));
+        } finally {
+            stack.pop();
+        }
+    };
+
+    function dive(ast) {
+        if (ast == null)
+            return null;
+        try {
+            stack.push(ast);
+            return walkers[ast[0]].apply(ast, ast.slice(1));
+        } finally {
+            stack.pop();
+        }
+    };
+
+    function with_walkers(walkers, cont){
+        var save = {}, i;
+        for (i in walkers) if (HOP(walkers, i)) {
+            save[i] = user[i];
+            user[i] = walkers[i];
+        }
+        var ret = cont();
+        for (i in save) if (HOP(save, i)) {
+            if (!save[i]) delete user[i];
+            else user[i] = save[i];
+        }
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    return {
+        walk: walk,
+        dive: dive,
+        with_walkers: with_walkers,
+        parent: function() {
