+            return stack[stack.length - 2]; // last one is current node
+        },
+        stack: function() {
+            return stack;
+        }
+    };
+};
+
+/* -----[ Scope and mangling ]----- */
+
+function Scope(parent) {
+    this.names = {};        // names defined in this scope
+    this.mangled = {};      // mangled names (orig.name =&gt; mangled)
+    this.rev_mangled = {};  // reverse lookup (mangled =&gt; orig.name)
+    this.cname = -1;        // current mangled name
+    this.refs = {};         // names referenced from this scope
+    this.uses_with = false; // will become TRUE if with() is detected in this or any subscopes
+    this.uses_eval = false; // will become TRUE if eval() is detected in this or any subscopes
+    this.directives = [];   // directives activated from this scope
+    this.parent = parent;   // parent scope
+    this.children = [];     // sub-scopes
+    if (parent) {
+        this.level = parent.level + 1;
+        parent.children.push(this);
+    } else {
+        this.level = 0;
+    }
+};
+
+function base54_digits() {
+    if (typeof DIGITS_OVERRIDE_FOR_TESTING != &quot;undefined&quot;)
+        return DIGITS_OVERRIDE_FOR_TESTING;
+    else
+        return &quot;etnrisouaflchpdvmgybwESxTNCkLAOM_DPHBjFIqRUzWXV$JKQGYZ0516372984&quot;;
+}
+
+var base54 = (function(){
+    var DIGITS = base54_digits();
+    return function(num) {
+        var ret = &quot;&quot;, base = 54;
+        do {
+            ret += DIGITS.charAt(num % base);
+            num = Math.floor(num / base);
+            base = 64;
+        } while (num &gt; 0);
+        return ret;
+    };
+})();
+
+Scope.prototype = {
+    has: function(name) {
+        for (var s = this; s; s = s.parent)
+            if (HOP(s.names, name))
+                return s;
+    },
+    has_mangled: function(mname) {
+        for (var s = this; s; s = s.parent)
+            if (HOP(s.rev_mangled, mname))
+                return s;
+    },
+    toJSON: function() {
+        return {
+            names: this.names,
+            uses_eval: this.uses_eval,
+            uses_with: this.uses_with
+        };
+    },
+
+    next_mangled: function() {
+        // we must be careful that the new mangled name:
+        //
+        // 1. doesn't shadow a mangled name from a parent
+        //    scope, unless we don't reference the original
+        //    name from this scope OR from any sub-scopes!
+        //    This will get slow.
+        //
+        // 2. doesn't shadow an original name from a parent
+        //    scope, in the event that the name is not mangled
+        //    in the parent scope and we reference that name
+        //    here OR IN ANY SUBSCOPES!
+        //
+        // 3. doesn't shadow a name that is referenced but not
+        //    defined (possibly global defined elsewhere).
+        for (;;) {
+            var m = base54(++this.cname), prior;
+
+            // case 1.
+            prior = this.has_mangled(m);
+            if (prior &amp;&amp; this.refs[prior.rev_mangled[m]] === prior)
+                continue;
+
+            // case 2.
+            prior = this.has(m);
+            if (prior &amp;&amp; prior !== this &amp;&amp; this.refs[m] === prior &amp;&amp; !prior.has_mangled(m))
+                continue;
+
+            // case 3.
+            if (HOP(this.refs, m) &amp;&amp; this.refs[m] == null)
+                continue;
+
+            // I got &quot;do&quot; once. :-/
+            if (!is_identifier(m))
+                continue;
+
+            return m;
+        }
+    },
+    set_mangle: function(name, m) {
+        this.rev_mangled[m] = name;
+        return this.mangled[name] = m;
+    },
+    get_mangled: function(name, newMangle) {
+        if (this.uses_eval || this.uses_with) return name; // no mangle if eval or with is in use
+        var s = this.has(name);
+        if (!s) return name; // not in visible scope, no mangle
+        if (HOP(s.mangled, name)) return s.mangled[name]; // already mangled in this scope
+        if (!newMangle) return name;                      // not found and no mangling requested
+        return s.set_mangle(name, s.next_mangled());
+    },
+    references: function(name) {
+        return name &amp;&amp; !this.parent || this.uses_with || this.uses_eval || this.refs[name];
+    },
+    define: function(name, type) {
+        if (name != null) {
+            if (type == &quot;var&quot; || !HOP(this.names, name))
+                this.names[name] = type || &quot;var&quot;;
+            return name;
+        }
+    },
+    active_directive: function(dir) {
+        return member(dir, this.directives) || this.parent &amp;&amp; this.parent.active_directive(dir);
+    }
+};
+
+function ast_add_scope(ast) {
+
+    var current_scope = null;
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk;
+    var having_eval = [];
+
+    function with_new_scope(cont) {
+        current_scope = new Scope(current_scope);
+        current_scope.labels = new Scope();
+        var ret = current_scope.body = cont();
+        ret.scope = current_scope;
+        current_scope = current_scope.parent;
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function define(name, type) {
+        return current_scope.define(name, type);
+    };
+
+    function reference(name) {
+        current_scope.refs[name] = true;
+    };
+
+    function _lambda(name, args, body) {
+        var is_defun = this[0] == &quot;defun&quot;;
+        return [ this[0], is_defun ? define(name, &quot;defun&quot;) : name, args, with_new_scope(function(){
+            if (!is_defun) define(name, &quot;lambda&quot;);
+            MAP(args, function(name){ define(name, &quot;arg&quot;) });
+            return MAP(body, walk);
+        })];
+    };
+
+    function _vardefs(type) {
+        return function(defs) {
+            MAP(defs, function(d){
+                define(d[0], type);
+                if (d[1]) reference(d[0]);
+            });
+        };
+    };
+
+    function _breacont(label) {
+        if (label)
+            current_scope.labels.refs[label] = true;
+    };
+
+    return with_new_scope(function(){
+        // process AST
+        var ret = w.with_walkers({
+            &quot;function&quot;: _lambda,
+            &quot;defun&quot;: _lambda,
+            &quot;label&quot;: function(name, stat) { current_scope.labels.define(name) },
+            &quot;break&quot;: _breacont,
+            &quot;continue&quot;: _breacont,
+            &quot;with&quot;: function(expr, block) {
+                for (var s = current_scope; s; s = s.parent)
+                    s.uses_with = true;
+            },
+            &quot;var&quot;: _vardefs(&quot;var&quot;),
+            &quot;const&quot;: _vardefs(&quot;const&quot;),
+            &quot;try&quot;: function(t, c, f) {
+                if (c != null) return [
+                    this[0],
+                    MAP(t, walk),
+                    [ define(c[0], &quot;catch&quot;), MAP(c[1], walk) ],
+                    f != null ? MAP(f, walk) : null
+                ];
+            },
+            &quot;name&quot;: function(name) {
+                if (name == &quot;eval&quot;)
+                    having_eval.push(current_scope);
+                reference(name);
+            }
+        }, function(){
+            return walk(ast);
+        });
+
+        // the reason why we need an additional pass here is
+        // that names can be used prior to their definition.
+
+        // scopes where eval was detected and their parents
+        // are marked with uses_eval, unless they define the
+        // &quot;eval&quot; name.
+        MAP(having_eval, function(scope){
+            if (!scope.has(&quot;eval&quot;)) while (scope) {
+                scope.uses_eval = true;
+                scope = scope.parent;
+            }
+        });
+
+        // for referenced names it might be useful to know
+        // their origin scope.  current_scope here is the
+        // toplevel one.
+        function fixrefs(scope, i) {
+            // do children first; order shouldn't matter
+            for (i = scope.children.length; --i &gt;= 0;)
+                fixrefs(scope.children[i]);
+            for (i in scope.refs) if (HOP(scope.refs, i)) {
+                // find origin scope and propagate the reference to origin
+                for (var origin = scope.has(i), s = scope; s; s = s.parent) {
+                    s.refs[i] = origin;
+                    if (s === origin) break;
+                }
+            }
+        };
+        fixrefs(current_scope);
+
+        return ret;
+    });
+
+};
+
+/* -----[ mangle names ]----- */
+
+function ast_mangle(ast, options) {
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
+    options = defaults(options, {
+        mangle       : true,
+        toplevel     : false,
+        defines      : null,
+        except       : null,
+        no_functions : false
+    });
+
+    function get_mangled(name, newMangle) {
+        if (!options.mangle) return name;
+        if (!options.toplevel &amp;&amp; !scope.parent) return name; // don't mangle toplevel
+        if (options.except &amp;&amp; member(name, options.except))
+            return name;
+        if (options.no_functions &amp;&amp; HOP(scope.names, name) &amp;&amp;
+            (scope.names[name] == 'defun' || scope.names[name] == 'lambda'))
+            return name;
+        return scope.get_mangled(name, newMangle);
+    };
+
+    function get_define(name) {
+        if (options.defines) {
+            // we always lookup a defined symbol for the current scope FIRST, so declared
+            // vars trump a DEFINE symbol, but if no such var is found, then match a DEFINE value
+            if (!scope.has(name)) {
+                if (HOP(options.defines, name)) {
+                    return options.defines[name];
+                }
+            }
+            return null;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function _lambda(name, args, body) {
+        if (!options.no_functions &amp;&amp; options.mangle) {
+            var is_defun = this[0] == &quot;defun&quot;, extra;
+            if (name) {
+                if (is_defun) name = get_mangled(name);
+                else if (body.scope.references(name)) {
+                    extra = {};
+                    if (!(scope.uses_eval || scope.uses_with))
+                        name = extra[name] = scope.next_mangled();
+                    else
+                        extra[name] = name;
+                }
+                else name = null;
+            }
+        }
+        body = with_scope(body.scope, function(){
+            args = MAP(args, function(name){ return get_mangled(name) });
+            return MAP(body, walk);
+        }, extra);
+        return [ this[0], name, args, body ];
+    };
+
+    function with_scope(s, cont, extra) {
+        var _scope = scope;
+        scope = s;
+        if (extra) for (var i in extra) if (HOP(extra, i)) {
+            s.set_mangle(i, extra[i]);
+        }
+        for (var i in s.names) if (HOP(s.names, i)) {
+            get_mangled(i, true);
+        }
+        var ret = cont();
+        ret.scope = s;
+        scope = _scope;
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function _vardefs(defs) {
+        return [ this[0], MAP(defs, function(d){
+            return [ get_mangled(d[0]), walk(d[1]) ];
+        }) ];
+    };
+
+    function _breacont(label) {
+        if (label) return [ this[0], scope.labels.get_mangled(label) ];
+    };
+
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;function&quot;: _lambda,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: function() {
+            // move function declarations to the top when
+            // they are not in some block.
+            var ast = _lambda.apply(this, arguments);
+            switch (w.parent()[0]) {
+              case &quot;toplevel&quot;:
+              case &quot;function&quot;:
+              case &quot;defun&quot;:
+                return MAP.at_top(ast);
+            }
+            return ast;
+        },
+        &quot;label&quot;: function(label, stat) {
+            if (scope.labels.refs[label]) return [
+                this[0],
+                scope.labels.get_mangled(label, true),
+                walk(stat)
+            ];
+            return walk(stat);
+        },
+        &quot;break&quot;: _breacont,
+        &quot;continue&quot;: _breacont,
+        &quot;var&quot;: _vardefs,
+        &quot;const&quot;: _vardefs,
+        &quot;name&quot;: function(name) {
+            return get_define(name) || [ this[0], get_mangled(name) ];
+        },
+        &quot;try&quot;: function(t, c, f) {
+            return [ this[0],
+                     MAP(t, walk),
+                     c != null ? [ get_mangled(c[0]), MAP(c[1], walk) ] : null,
+                     f != null ? MAP(f, walk) : null ];
+        },
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(body) {
+            var self = this;
+            return with_scope(self.scope, function(){
+                return [ self[0], MAP(body, walk) ];
+            });
+        },
+        &quot;directive&quot;: function() {
+            return MAP.at_top(this);
+        }
+    }, function() {
+        return walk(ast_add_scope(ast));
+    });
+};
+
+/* -----[
+   - compress foo[&quot;bar&quot;] into foo.bar,
+   - remove block brackets {} where possible
+   - join consecutive var declarations
+   - various optimizations for IFs:
+   - if (cond) foo(); else bar();  ==&gt;  cond?foo():bar();
+   - if (cond) foo();  ==&gt;  cond&amp;&amp;foo();
+   - if (foo) return bar(); else return baz();  ==&gt; return foo?bar():baz(); // also for throw
+   - if (foo) return bar(); else something();  ==&gt; {if(foo)return bar();something()}
+   ]----- */
+
+var warn = function(){};
+
+function best_of(ast1, ast2) {
+    return gen_code(ast1).length &gt; gen_code(ast2[0] == &quot;stat&quot; ? ast2[1] : ast2).length ? ast2 : ast1;
+};
+
+function last_stat(b) {
+    if (b[0] == &quot;block&quot; &amp;&amp; b[1] &amp;&amp; b[1].length &gt; 0)
+        return b[1][b[1].length - 1];
+    return b;
+}
+
+function aborts(t) {
+    if (t) switch (last_stat(t)[0]) {
+      case &quot;return&quot;:
+      case &quot;break&quot;:
+      case &quot;continue&quot;:
+      case &quot;throw&quot;:
+        return true;
+    }
+};
+
+function boolean_expr(expr) {
+    return ( (expr[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; member(expr[1], [ &quot;!&quot;, &quot;delete&quot; ])) ||
+
+             (expr[0] == &quot;binary&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; member(expr[1], [ &quot;in&quot;, &quot;instanceof&quot;, &quot;==&quot;, &quot;!=&quot;, &quot;===&quot;, &quot;!==&quot;, &quot;&lt;&quot;, &quot;&lt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;&quot; ])) ||
+
+             (expr[0] == &quot;binary&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; member(expr[1], [ &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;, &quot;||&quot; ])
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[2])
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[3])) ||
+
+             (expr[0] == &quot;conditional&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[2])
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[3])) ||
+
+             (expr[0] == &quot;assign&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; expr[1] === true
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[3])) ||
+
+             (expr[0] == &quot;seq&quot;
+              &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[expr.length - 1]))
+           );
+};
+
+function empty(b) {
+    return !b || (b[0] == &quot;block&quot; &amp;&amp; (!b[1] || b[1].length == 0));
+};
+
+function is_string(node) {
+    return (node[0] == &quot;string&quot; ||
+            node[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot; &amp;&amp; node[1] == &quot;typeof&quot; ||
+            node[0] == &quot;binary&quot; &amp;&amp; node[1] == &quot;+&quot; &amp;&amp;
+            (is_string(node[2]) || is_string(node[3])));
+};
+
+var when_constant = (function(){
+
+    var $NOT_CONSTANT = {};
+
+    // this can only evaluate constant expressions.  If it finds anything
+    // not constant, it throws $NOT_CONSTANT.
+    function evaluate(expr) {
+        switch (expr[0]) {
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+            return expr[1];
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            switch (expr[1]) {
+              case &quot;true&quot;: return true;
+              case &quot;false&quot;: return false;
+              case &quot;null&quot;: return null;
+            }
+            break;
+          case &quot;unary-prefix&quot;:
+            switch (expr[1]) {
+              case &quot;!&quot;: return !evaluate(expr[2]);
+              case &quot;typeof&quot;: return typeof evaluate(expr[2]);
+              case &quot;~&quot;: return ~evaluate(expr[2]);
+              case &quot;-&quot;: return -evaluate(expr[2]);
+              case &quot;+&quot;: return +evaluate(expr[2]);
+            }
+            break;
+          case &quot;binary&quot;:
+            var left = expr[2], right = expr[3];
+            switch (expr[1]) {
+              case &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;         : return evaluate(left) &amp;&amp;         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;||&quot;         : return evaluate(left) ||         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;|&quot;          : return evaluate(left) |          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&amp;&quot;          : return evaluate(left) &amp;          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;^&quot;          : return evaluate(left) ^          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;+&quot;          : return evaluate(left) +          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;*&quot;          : return evaluate(left) *          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;/&quot;          : return evaluate(left) /          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;%&quot;          : return evaluate(left) %          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;-&quot;          : return evaluate(left) -          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;         : return evaluate(left) &lt;&lt;         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&gt;&gt;&quot;         : return evaluate(left) &gt;&gt;         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;&quot;        : return evaluate(left) &gt;&gt;&gt;        evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;==&quot;         : return evaluate(left) ==         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;===&quot;        : return evaluate(left) ===        evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;!=&quot;         : return evaluate(left) !=         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;!==&quot;        : return evaluate(left) !==        evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&lt;&quot;          : return evaluate(left) &lt;          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&lt;=&quot;         : return evaluate(left) &lt;=         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&gt;&quot;          : return evaluate(left) &gt;          evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;&gt;=&quot;         : return evaluate(left) &gt;=         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;in&quot;         : return evaluate(left) in         evaluate(right);
+              case &quot;instanceof&quot; : return evaluate(left) instanceof evaluate(right);
+            }
+        }
+        throw $NOT_CONSTANT;
+    };
+
+    return function(expr, yes, no) {
+        try {
+            var val = evaluate(expr), ast;
+            switch (typeof val) {
+              case &quot;string&quot;: ast =  [ &quot;string&quot;, val ]; break;
+              case &quot;number&quot;: ast =  [ &quot;num&quot;, val ]; break;
+              case &quot;boolean&quot;: ast =  [ &quot;name&quot;, String(val) ]; break;
+              default:
+                if (val === null) { ast = [ &quot;atom&quot;, &quot;null&quot; ]; break; }
+                throw new Error(&quot;Can't handle constant of type: &quot; + (typeof val));
+            }
+            return yes.call(expr, ast, val);
+        } catch(ex) {
+            if (ex === $NOT_CONSTANT) {
+                if (expr[0] == &quot;binary&quot;
+                    &amp;&amp; (expr[1] == &quot;===&quot; || expr[1] == &quot;!==&quot;)
+                    &amp;&amp; ((is_string(expr[2]) &amp;&amp; is_string(expr[3]))
+                        || (boolean_expr(expr[2]) &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(expr[3])))) {
+                    expr[1] = expr[1].substr(0, 2);
+                }
+                else if (no &amp;&amp; expr[0] == &quot;binary&quot;
+                         &amp;&amp; (expr[1] == &quot;||&quot; || expr[1] == &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;)) {
+                    // the whole expression is not constant but the lval may be...
+                    try {
+                        var lval = evaluate(expr[2]);
+                        expr = ((expr[1] == &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot; &amp;&amp; (lval ? expr[3] : lval))    ||
+                                (expr[1] == &quot;||&quot; &amp;&amp; (lval ? lval    : expr[3])) ||
+                                expr);
+                    } catch(ex2) {
+                        // IGNORE... lval is not constant
+                    }
+                }
+                return no ? no.call(expr, expr) : null;
+            }
+            else throw ex;
+        }
+    };
+
+})();
+
+function warn_unreachable(ast) {
+    if (!empty(ast))
+        warn(&quot;Dropping unreachable code: &quot; + gen_code(ast, true));
+};
+
+function prepare_ifs(ast) {
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk;
+    // In this first pass, we rewrite ifs which abort with no else with an
+    // if-else.  For example:
+    //
+    // if (x) {
+    //     blah();
+    //     return y;
+    // }
+    // foobar();
+    //
+    // is rewritten into:
+    //
+    // if (x) {
+    //     blah();
+    //     return y;
+    // } else {
+    //     foobar();
+    // }
+    function redo_if(statements) {
+        statements = MAP(statements, walk);
+
+        for (var i = 0; i &lt; statements.length; ++i) {
+            var fi = statements[i];
+            if (fi[0] != &quot;if&quot;) continue;
+
+            if (fi[3]) continue;
+
+            var t = fi[2];
+            if (!aborts(t)) continue;
+
+            var conditional = walk(fi[1]);
+
+            var e_body = redo_if(statements.slice(i + 1));
+            var e = e_body.length == 1 ? e_body[0] : [ &quot;block&quot;, e_body ];
+
+            return statements.slice(0, i).concat([ [
+                fi[0],          // &quot;if&quot;
+                conditional,    // conditional
+                t,              // then
+                e               // else
+            ] ]);
+        }
+
+        return statements;
+    };
+
+    function redo_if_lambda(name, args, body) {
+        body = redo_if(body);
+        return [ this[0], name, args, body ];
+    };
+
+    function redo_if_block(statements) {
+        return [ this[0], statements != null ? redo_if(statements) : null ];
+    };
+
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;defun&quot;: redo_if_lambda,
+        &quot;function&quot;: redo_if_lambda,
+        &quot;block&quot;: redo_if_block,
+        &quot;splice&quot;: redo_if_block,
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(statements) {
+            return [ this[0], redo_if(statements) ];
+        },
+        &quot;try&quot;: function(t, c, f) {
+            return [
+                this[0],
+                redo_if(t),
+                c != null ? [ c[0], redo_if(c[1]) ] : null,
+                f != null ? redo_if(f) : null
+            ];
+        }
+    }, function() {
+        return walk(ast);
+    });
+};
+
+function for_side_effects(ast, handler) {
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk;
+    var $stop = {}, $restart = {};
+    function stop() { throw $stop };
+    function restart() { throw $restart };
+    function found(){ return handler.call(this, this, w, stop, restart) };
+    function unary(op) {
+        if (op == &quot;++&quot; || op == &quot;--&quot;)
+            return found.apply(this, arguments);
+    };
+    function binary(op) {
+        if (op == &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot; || op == &quot;||&quot;)
+            return found.apply(this, arguments);
+    };
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;try&quot;: found,
+        &quot;throw&quot;: found,
+        &quot;return&quot;: found,
+        &quot;new&quot;: found,
+        &quot;switch&quot;: found,
+        &quot;break&quot;: found,
+        &quot;continue&quot;: found,
+        &quot;assign&quot;: found,
+        &quot;call&quot;: found,
+        &quot;if&quot;: found,
+        &quot;for&quot;: found,
+        &quot;for-in&quot;: found,
+        &quot;while&quot;: found,
+        &quot;do&quot;: found,
+        &quot;return&quot;: found,
+        &quot;unary-prefix&quot;: unary,
+        &quot;unary-postfix&quot;: unary,
+        &quot;conditional&quot;: found,
+        &quot;binary&quot;: binary,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: found
+    }, function(){
+        while (true) try {
+            walk(ast);
+            break;
+        } catch(ex) {
+            if (ex === $stop) break;
+            if (ex === $restart) continue;
+            throw ex;
+        }
+    });
+};
+
+function ast_lift_variables(ast) {
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
+    function do_body(body, env) {
+        var _scope = scope;
+        scope = env;
+        body = MAP(body, walk);
+        var hash = {}, names = MAP(env.names, function(type, name){
+            if (type != &quot;var&quot;) return MAP.skip;
+            if (!env.references(name)) return MAP.skip;
+            hash[name] = true;
+            return [ name ];
+        });
+        if (names.length &gt; 0) {
+            // looking for assignments to any of these variables.
+            // we can save considerable space by moving the definitions
+            // in the var declaration.
+            for_side_effects([ &quot;block&quot;, body ], function(ast, walker, stop, restart) {
+                if (ast[0] == &quot;assign&quot;
+                    &amp;&amp; ast[1] === true
+                    &amp;&amp; ast[2][0] == &quot;name&quot;
+                    &amp;&amp; HOP(hash, ast[2][1])) {
+                    // insert the definition into the var declaration
+                    for (var i = names.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+                        if (names[i][0] == ast[2][1]) {
+                            if (names[i][1]) // this name already defined, we must stop
+                                stop();
+                            names[i][1] = ast[3]; // definition
+                            names.push(names.splice(i, 1)[0]);
+                            break;
+                        }
+                    }
+                    // remove this assignment from the AST.
+                    var p = walker.parent();
+                    if (p[0] == &quot;seq&quot;) {
+                        var a = p[2];
+                        a.unshift(0, p.length);
+                        p.splice.apply(p, a);
+                    }
+                    else if (p[0] == &quot;stat&quot;) {
+                        p.splice(0, p.length, &quot;block&quot;); // empty statement
+                    }
+                    else {
+                        stop();
+                    }
+                    restart();
+                }
+                stop();
+            });
+            body.unshift([ &quot;var&quot;, names ]);
+        }
+        scope = _scope;
+        return body;
+    };
+    function _vardefs(defs) {
+        var ret = null;
+        for (var i = defs.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+            var d = defs[i];
+            if (!d[1]) continue;
+            d = [ &quot;assign&quot;, true, [ &quot;name&quot;, d[0] ], d[1] ];
+            if (ret == null) ret = d;
+            else ret = [ &quot;seq&quot;, d, ret ];
+        }
+        if (ret == null &amp;&amp; w.parent()[0] != &quot;for&quot;) {
+            if (w.parent()[0] == &quot;for-in&quot;)
+                return [ &quot;name&quot;, defs[0][0] ];
+            return MAP.skip;
+        }
+        return [ &quot;stat&quot;, ret ];
+    };
+    function _toplevel(body) {
+        return [ this[0], do_body(body, this.scope) ];
+    };
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;function&quot;: function(name, args, body){
+            for (var i = args.length; --i &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; !body.scope.references(args[i]);)
+                args.pop();
+            if (!body.scope.references(name)) name = null;
+            return [ this[0], name, args, do_body(body, body.scope) ];
+        },
+        &quot;defun&quot;: function(name, args, body){
+            if (!scope.references(name)) return MAP.skip;
+            for (var i = args.length; --i &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; !body.scope.references(args[i]);)
+                args.pop();
+            return [ this[0], name, args, do_body(body, body.scope) ];
+        },
+        &quot;var&quot;: _vardefs,
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: _toplevel
+    }, function(){
+        return walk(ast_add_scope(ast));
+    });
+};
+
+function ast_squeeze(ast, options) {
+    ast = squeeze_1(ast, options);
+    ast = squeeze_2(ast, options);
+    return ast;
+};
+
+function squeeze_1(ast, options) {
+    options = defaults(options, {
+        make_seqs   : true,
+        dead_code   : true,
+        no_warnings : false,
+        keep_comps  : true,
+        unsafe      : false
+    });
+
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
+
+    function negate(c) {
+        var not_c = [ &quot;unary-prefix&quot;, &quot;!&quot;, c ];
+        switch (c[0]) {
+          case &quot;unary-prefix&quot;:
+            return c[1] == &quot;!&quot; &amp;&amp; boolean_expr(c[2]) ? c[2] : not_c;
+          case &quot;seq&quot;:
+            c = slice(c);
+            c[c.length - 1] = negate(c[c.length - 1]);
+            return c;
+          case &quot;conditional&quot;:
+            return best_of(not_c, [ &quot;conditional&quot;, c[1], negate(c[2]), negate(c[3]) ]);
+          case &quot;binary&quot;:
+            var op = c[1], left = c[2], right = c[3];
+            if (!options.keep_comps) switch (op) {
+              case &quot;&lt;=&quot;  : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&gt;&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;&lt;&quot;   : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&gt;=&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;&gt;=&quot;  : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&lt;&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;&gt;&quot;   : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&lt;=&quot;, left, right ];
+            }
+            switch (op) {
+              case &quot;==&quot;  : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;!=&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;!=&quot;  : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;==&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;===&quot; : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;!==&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;!==&quot; : return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;===&quot;, left, right ];
+              case &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;  : return best_of(not_c, [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;||&quot;, negate(left), negate(right) ]);
+              case &quot;||&quot;  : return best_of(not_c, [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;, negate(left), negate(right) ]);
+            }
+            break;
+        }
+        return not_c;
+    };
+
+    function make_conditional(c, t, e) {
+        var make_real_conditional = function() {
+            if (c[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot; &amp;&amp; c[1] == &quot;!&quot;) {
+                return e ? [ &quot;conditional&quot;, c[2], e, t ] : [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;||&quot;, c[2], t ];
+            } else {
+                return e ? best_of(
+                    [ &quot;conditional&quot;, c, t, e ],
+                    [ &quot;conditional&quot;, negate(c), e, t ]
+                ) : [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;, c, t ];
+            }
+        };
+        // shortcut the conditional if the expression has a constant value
+        return when_constant(c, function(ast, val){
+            warn_unreachable(val ? e : t);
+            return          (val ? t : e);
+        }, make_real_conditional);
+    };
+
+    function rmblock(block) {
+        if (block != null &amp;&amp; block[0] == &quot;block&quot; &amp;&amp; block[1]) {
+            if (block[1].length == 1)
+                block = block[1][0];
+            else if (block[1].length == 0)
+                block = [ &quot;block&quot; ];
+        }
+        return block;
+    };
+
+    function _lambda(name, args, body) {
+        return [ this[0], name, args, tighten(body, &quot;lambda&quot;) ];
+    };
+
+    // this function does a few things:
+    // 1. discard useless blocks
+    // 2. join consecutive var declarations
+    // 3. remove obviously dead code
+    // 4. transform consecutive statements using the comma operator
+    // 5. if block_type == &quot;lambda&quot; and it detects constructs like if(foo) return ... - rewrite like if (!foo) { ... }
+    function tighten(statements, block_type) {
+        statements = MAP(statements, walk);
+
+        statements = statements.reduce(function(a, stat){
+            if (stat[0] == &quot;block&quot;) {
+                if (stat[1]) {
+                    a.push.apply(a, stat[1]);
+                }
+            } else {
+                a.push(stat);
+            }
+            return a;
+        }, []);
+
+        statements = (function(a, prev){
+            statements.forEach(function(cur){
+                if (prev &amp;&amp; ((cur[0] == &quot;var&quot; &amp;&amp; prev[0] == &quot;var&quot;) ||
+                             (cur[0] == &quot;const&quot; &amp;&amp; prev[0] == &quot;const&quot;))) {
+                    prev[1] = prev[1].concat(cur[1]);
+                } else {
+                    a.push(cur);
+                    prev = cur;
+                }
+            });
+            return a;
+        })([]);
+
+        if (options.dead_code) statements = (function(a, has_quit){
+            statements.forEach(function(st){
+                if (has_quit) {
+                    if (st[0] == &quot;function&quot; || st[0] == &quot;defun&quot;) {
+                        a.push(st);
+                    }
+                    else if (st[0] == &quot;var&quot; || st[0] == &quot;const&quot;) {
+                        if (!options.no_warnings)
+                            warn(&quot;Variables declared in unreachable code&quot;);
+                        st[1] = MAP(st[1], function(def){
+                            if (def[1] &amp;&amp; !options.no_warnings)
+                                warn_unreachable([ &quot;assign&quot;, true, [ &quot;name&quot;, def[0] ], def[1] ]);
+                            return [ def[0] ];
+                        });
+                        a.push(st);
+                    }
+                    else if (!options.no_warnings)
+                        warn_unreachable(st);
+                }
+                else {
+                    a.push(st);
+                    if (member(st[0], [ &quot;return&quot;, &quot;throw&quot;, &quot;break&quot;, &quot;continue&quot; ]))
+                        has_quit = true;
+                }
+            });
+            return a;
+        })([]);
+
+        if (options.make_seqs) statements = (function(a, prev) {
+            statements.forEach(function(cur){
+                if (prev &amp;&amp; prev[0] == &quot;stat&quot; &amp;&amp; cur[0] == &quot;stat&quot;) {
+                    prev[1] = [ &quot;seq&quot;, prev[1], cur[1] ];
+                } else {
+                    a.push(cur);
+                    prev = cur;
+                }
+            });
+            if (a.length &gt;= 2
+                &amp;&amp; a[a.length-2][0] == &quot;stat&quot;
+                &amp;&amp; (a[a.length-1][0] == &quot;return&quot; || a[a.length-1][0] == &quot;throw&quot;)
+                &amp;&amp; a[a.length-1][1])
+            {
+                a.splice(a.length - 2, 2,
+                         [ a[a.length-1][0],
+                           [ &quot;seq&quot;, a[a.length-2][1], a[a.length-1][1] ]]);
+            }
+            return a;
+        })([]);
+
+        // this increases jQuery by 1K.  Probably not such a good idea after all..
+        // part of this is done in prepare_ifs anyway.
+        // if (block_type == &quot;lambda&quot;) statements = (function(i, a, stat){
+        //         while (i &lt; statements.length) {
+        //                 stat = statements[i++];
+        //                 if (stat[0] == &quot;if&quot; &amp;&amp; !stat[3]) {
+        //                         if (stat[2][0] == &quot;return&quot; &amp;&amp; stat[2][1] == null) {
+        //                                 a.push(make_if(negate(stat[1]), [ &quot;block&quot;, statements.slice(i) ]));
+        //                                 break;
+        //                         }
+        //                         var last = last_stat(stat[2]);
+        //                         if (last[0] == &quot;return&quot; &amp;&amp; last[1] == null) {
+        //                                 a.push(make_if(stat[1], [ &quot;block&quot;, stat[2][1].slice(0, -1) ], [ &quot;block&quot;, statements.slice(i) ]));
+        //                                 break;
+        //                         }
+        //                 }
+        //                 a.push(stat);
+        //         }
+        //         return a;
+        // })(0, []);
+
+        return statements;
+    };
+
+    function make_if(c, t, e) {
+        return when_constant(c, function(ast, val){
+            if (val) {
+                t = walk(t);
+                warn_unreachable(e);
+                return t || [ &quot;block&quot; ];
+            } else {
+                e = walk(e);
+                warn_unreachable(t);
+                return e || [ &quot;block&quot; ];
+            }
+        }, function() {
+            return make_real_if(c, t, e);
+        });
+    };
+
+    function abort_else(c, t, e) {
+        var ret = [ [ &quot;if&quot;, negate(c), e ] ];
+        if (t[0] == &quot;block&quot;) {
+            if (t[1]) ret = ret.concat(t[1]);
+        } else {
+            ret.push(t);
+        }
+        return walk([ &quot;block&quot;, ret ]);
+    };
+
+    function make_real_if(c, t, e) {
+        c = walk(c);
+        t = walk(t);
+        e = walk(e);
+
+        if (empty(e) &amp;&amp; empty(t))
+            return [ &quot;stat&quot;, c ];
+
+        if (empty(t)) {
+            c = negate(c);
+            t = e;
+            e = null;
+        } else if (empty(e)) {
+            e = null;
+        } else {
+            // if we have both else and then, maybe it makes sense to switch them?
+            (function(){
+                var a = gen_code(c);
+                var n = negate(c);
+                var b = gen_code(n);
+                if (b.length &lt; a.length) {
+                    var tmp = t;
+                    t = e;
+                    e = tmp;
+                    c = n;
+                }
+            })();
+        }
+        var ret = [ &quot;if&quot;, c, t, e ];
+        if (t[0] == &quot;if&quot; &amp;&amp; empty(t[3]) &amp;&amp; empty(e)) {
+            ret = best_of(ret, walk([ &quot;if&quot;, [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;, c, t[1] ], t[2] ]));
+        }
+        else if (t[0] == &quot;stat&quot;) {
+            if (e) {
+                if (e[0] == &quot;stat&quot;)
+                    ret = best_of(ret, [ &quot;stat&quot;, make_conditional(c, t[1], e[1]) ]);
+                else if (aborts(e))
+                    ret = abort_else(c, t, e);
+            }
+            else {
+                ret = best_of(ret, [ &quot;stat&quot;, make_conditional(c, t[1]) ]);
+            }
+        }
+        else if (e &amp;&amp; t[0] == e[0] &amp;&amp; (t[0] == &quot;return&quot; || t[0] == &quot;throw&quot;) &amp;&amp; t[1] &amp;&amp; e[1]) {
+            ret = best_of(ret, [ t[0], make_conditional(c, t[1], e[1] ) ]);
+        }
+        else if (e &amp;&amp; aborts(t)) {
+            ret = [ [ &quot;if&quot;, c, t ] ];
+            if (e[0] == &quot;block&quot;) {
+                if (e[1]) ret = ret.concat(e[1]);
+            }
+            else {
+                ret.push(e);
+            }
+            ret = walk([ &quot;block&quot;, ret ]);
+        }
+        else if (t &amp;&amp; aborts(e)) {
+            ret = abort_else(c, t, e);
+        }
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function _do_while(cond, body) {
+        return when_constant(cond, function(cond, val){
+            if (!val) {
+                warn_unreachable(body);
+                return [ &quot;block&quot; ];
+            } else {
+                return [ &quot;for&quot;, null, null, null, walk(body) ];
+            }
+        });
+    };
+
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;sub&quot;: function(expr, subscript) {
+            if (subscript[0] == &quot;string&quot;) {
+                var name = subscript[1];
+                if (is_identifier(name))
+                    return [ &quot;dot&quot;, walk(expr), name ];
+                else if (/^[1-9][0-9]*$/.test(name) || name === &quot;0&quot;)
+                    return [ &quot;sub&quot;, walk(expr), [ &quot;num&quot;, parseInt(name, 10) ] ];
+            }
+        },
+        &quot;if&quot;: make_if,
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(body) {
+            return [ &quot;toplevel&quot;, tighten(body) ];
+        },
+        &quot;switch&quot;: function(expr, body) {
+            var last = body.length - 1;
+            return [ &quot;switch&quot;, walk(expr), MAP(body, function(branch, i){
+                var block = tighten(branch[1]);
+                if (i == last &amp;&amp; block.length &gt; 0) {
+                    var node = block[block.length - 1];
+                    if (node[0] == &quot;break&quot; &amp;&amp; !node[1])
+                        block.pop();
+                }
+                return [ branch[0] ? walk(branch[0]) : null, block ];
+            }) ];
+        },
+        &quot;function&quot;: _lambda,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: _lambda,
+        &quot;block&quot;: function(body) {
+            if (body) return rmblock([ &quot;block&quot;, tighten(body) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;binary&quot;: function(op, left, right) {
+            return when_constant([ &quot;binary&quot;, op, walk(left), walk(right) ], function yes(c){
+                return best_of(walk(c), this);
+            }, function no() {
+                return function(){
+                    if(op != &quot;==&quot; &amp;&amp; op != &quot;!=&quot;) return;
+                    var l = walk(left), r = walk(right);
+                    if(l &amp;&amp; l[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot; &amp;&amp; l[1] == &quot;!&quot; &amp;&amp; l[2][0] == &quot;num&quot;)
+                        left = ['num', +!l[2][1]];
+                    else if (r &amp;&amp; r[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot; &amp;&amp; r[1] == &quot;!&quot; &amp;&amp; r[2][0] == &quot;num&quot;)
+                        right = ['num', +!r[2][1]];
+                    return [&quot;binary&quot;, op, left, right];
+                }() || this;
+            });
+        },
+        &quot;conditional&quot;: function(c, t, e) {
+            return make_conditional(walk(c), walk(t), walk(e));
+        },
+        &quot;try&quot;: function(t, c, f) {
+            return [
+                &quot;try&quot;,
+                tighten(t),
+                c != null ? [ c[0], tighten(c[1]) ] : null,
+                f != null ? tighten(f) : null
+            ];
+        },
+        &quot;unary-prefix&quot;: function(op, expr) {
+            expr = walk(expr);
+            var ret = [ &quot;unary-prefix&quot;, op, expr ];
+            if (op == &quot;!&quot;)
+                ret = best_of(ret, negate(expr));
+            return when_constant(ret, function(ast, val){
+                return walk(ast); // it's either true or false, so minifies to !0 or !1
+            }, function() { return ret });
+        },
+        &quot;name&quot;: function(name) {
+            switch (name) {
+              case &quot;true&quot;: return [ &quot;unary-prefix&quot;, &quot;!&quot;, [ &quot;num&quot;, 0 ]];
+              case &quot;false&quot;: return [ &quot;unary-prefix&quot;, &quot;!&quot;, [ &quot;num&quot;, 1 ]];
+            }
+        },
+        &quot;while&quot;: _do_while,
+        &quot;assign&quot;: function(op, lvalue, rvalue) {
+            lvalue = walk(lvalue);
+            rvalue = walk(rvalue);
+            var okOps = [ '+', '-', '/', '*', '%', '&gt;&gt;', '&lt;&lt;', '&gt;&gt;&gt;', '|', '^', '&amp;' ];
+            if (op === true &amp;&amp; lvalue[0] === &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp; rvalue[0] === &quot;binary&quot; &amp;&amp;
+                ~okOps.indexOf(rvalue[1]) &amp;&amp; rvalue[2][0] === &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp;
+                rvalue[2][1] === lvalue[1]) {
+                return [ this[0], rvalue[1], lvalue, rvalue[3] ]
+            }
+            return [ this[0], op, lvalue, rvalue ];
+        },
+        &quot;call&quot;: function(expr, args) {
+            expr = walk(expr);
+            if (options.unsafe &amp;&amp; expr[0] == &quot;dot&quot; &amp;&amp; expr[1][0] == &quot;string&quot; &amp;&amp; expr[2] == &quot;toString&quot;) {
+                return expr[1];
+            }
+            return [ this[0], expr,  MAP(args, walk) ];
+        },
+        &quot;num&quot;: function (num) {
+            if (!isFinite(num))
+                return [ &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;/&quot;, num === 1 / 0
+                         ? [ &quot;num&quot;, 1 ] : num === -1 / 0
+                         ? [ &quot;unary-prefix&quot;, &quot;-&quot;, [ &quot;num&quot;, 1 ] ]
+                         : [ &quot;num&quot;, 0 ], [ &quot;num&quot;, 0 ] ];
+
+            return [ this[0], num ];
+        }
+    }, function() {
+        return walk(prepare_ifs(walk(prepare_ifs(ast))));
+    });
+};
+
+function squeeze_2(ast, options) {
+    var w = ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
+    function with_scope(s, cont) {
+        var save = scope, ret;
+        scope = s;
+        ret = cont();
+        scope = save;
+        return ret;
+    };
+    function lambda(name, args, body) {
+        return [ this[0], name, args, with_scope(body.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
+    };
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;directive&quot;: function(dir) {
+            if (scope.active_directive(dir))
+                return [ &quot;block&quot; ];
+            scope.directives.push(dir);
+        },
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(body) {
+            return [ this[0], with_scope(this.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
+        },
+        &quot;function&quot;: lambda,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: lambda
+    }, function(){
+        return walk(ast_add_scope(ast));
+    });
+};
+
+/* -----[ re-generate code from the AST ]----- */
+
+var DOT_CALL_NO_PARENS = jsp.array_to_hash([
+    &quot;name&quot;,
+    &quot;array&quot;,
+    &quot;object&quot;,
+    &quot;string&quot;,
+    &quot;dot&quot;,
+    &quot;sub&quot;,
+    &quot;call&quot;,
+    &quot;regexp&quot;,
+    &quot;defun&quot;
+]);
+
+function make_string(str, ascii_only) {
+    var dq = 0, sq = 0;
+    str = str.replace(/[\\\b\f\n\r\t\x22\x27\u2028\u2029\0]/g, function(s){
+        switch (s) {
+          case &quot;\\&quot;: return &quot;\\\\&quot;;
+          case &quot;\b&quot;: return &quot;\\b&quot;;
+          case &quot;\f&quot;: return &quot;\\f&quot;;
+          case &quot;\n&quot;: return &quot;\\n&quot;;
+          case &quot;\r&quot;: return &quot;\\r&quot;;
+          case &quot;\u2028&quot;: return &quot;\\u2028&quot;;
+          case &quot;\u2029&quot;: return &quot;\\u2029&quot;;
+          case '&quot;': ++dq; return '&quot;';
+          case &quot;'&quot;: ++sq; return &quot;'&quot;;
+          case &quot;\0&quot;: return &quot;\\0&quot;;
+        }
+        return s;
+    });
+    if (ascii_only) str = to_ascii(str);
+    if (dq &gt; sq) return &quot;'&quot; + str.replace(/\x27/g, &quot;\\'&quot;) + &quot;'&quot;;
+    else return '&quot;' + str.replace(/\x22/g, '\\&quot;') + '&quot;';
+};
+
+function to_ascii(str) {
+    return str.replace(/[\u0080-\uffff]/g, function(ch) {
+        var code = ch.charCodeAt(0).toString(16);
+        while (code.length &lt; 4) code = &quot;0&quot; + code;
+        return &quot;\\u&quot; + code;
+    });
+};
+
+var SPLICE_NEEDS_BRACKETS = jsp.array_to_hash([ &quot;if&quot;, &quot;while&quot;, &quot;do&quot;, &quot;for&quot;, &quot;for-in&quot;, &quot;with&quot; ]);
+
+function gen_code(ast, options) {
+    options = defaults(options, {
+        indent_start : 0,
+        indent_level : 4,
+        quote_keys   : false,
+        space_colon  : false,
+        beautify     : false,
+        ascii_only   : false,
+        inline_script: false
+    });
+    var beautify = !!options.beautify;
+    var indentation = 0,
+    newline = beautify ? &quot;\n&quot; : &quot;&quot;,
+    space = beautify ? &quot; &quot; : &quot;&quot;;
+
+    function encode_string(str) {
+        var ret = make_string(str, options.ascii_only);
+        if (options.inline_script)
+            ret = ret.replace(/&lt;\x2fscript([&gt;\/\t\n\f\r ])/gi, &quot;&lt;\\/script$1&quot;);
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function make_name(name) {
+        name = name.toString();
+        if (options.ascii_only)
+            name = to_ascii(name);
+        return name;
+    };
+
+    function indent(line) {
+        if (line == null)
+            line = &quot;&quot;;
+        if (beautify)
+            line = repeat_string(&quot; &quot;, options.indent_start + indentation * options.indent_level) + line;
+        return line;
+    };
+
+    function with_indent(cont, incr) {
+        if (incr == null) incr = 1;
+        indentation += incr;
+        try { return cont.apply(null, slice(arguments, 1)); }
+        finally { indentation -= incr; }
+    };
+
+    function last_char(str) {
+        str = str.toString();
+        return str.charAt(str.length - 1);
+    };
+
+    function first_char(str) {
+        return str.toString().charAt(0);
+    };
+
+    function add_spaces(a) {
+        if (beautify)
+            return a.join(&quot; &quot;);
+        var b = [];
+        for (var i = 0; i &lt; a.length; ++i) {
+            var next = a[i + 1];
+            b.push(a[i]);
+            if (next &amp;&amp;
+                ((is_identifier_char(last_char(a[i])) &amp;&amp; (is_identifier_char(first_char(next))
+                                                          || first_char(next) == &quot;\\&quot;)) ||
+                 (/[\+\-]$/.test(a[i].toString()) &amp;&amp; /^[\+\-]/.test(next.toString()) ||
+                 last_char(a[i]) == &quot;/&quot; &amp;&amp; first_char(next) == &quot;/&quot;))) {
+                b.push(&quot; &quot;);
+            }
+        }
+        return b.join(&quot;&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function add_commas(a) {
+        return a.join(&quot;,&quot; + space);
+    };
+
+    function parenthesize(expr) {
+        var gen = make(expr);
+        for (var i = 1; i &lt; arguments.length; ++i) {
+            var el = arguments[i];
+            if ((el instanceof Function &amp;&amp; el(expr)) || expr[0] == el)
+                return &quot;(&quot; + gen + &quot;)&quot;;
+        }
+        return gen;
+    };
+
+    function best_of(a) {
+        if (a.length == 1) {
+            return a[0];
+        }
+        if (a.length == 2) {
+            var b = a[1];
+            a = a[0];
+            return a.length &lt;= b.length ? a : b;
+        }
+        return best_of([ a[0], best_of(a.slice(1)) ]);
+    };
+
+    function needs_parens(expr) {
+        if (expr[0] == &quot;function&quot; || expr[0] == &quot;object&quot;) {
+            // dot/call on a literal function requires the
+            // function literal itself to be parenthesized
+            // only if it's the first &quot;thing&quot; in a
+            // statement.  This means that the parent is
+            // &quot;stat&quot;, but it could also be a &quot;seq&quot; and
+            // we're the first in this &quot;seq&quot; and the
+            // parent is &quot;stat&quot;, and so on.  Messy stuff,
+            // but it worths the trouble.
+            var a = slice(w.stack()), self = a.pop(), p = a.pop();
+            while (p) {
+                if (p[0] == &quot;stat&quot;) return true;
+                if (((p[0] == &quot;seq&quot; || p[0] == &quot;call&quot; || p[0] == &quot;dot&quot; || p[0] == &quot;sub&quot; || p[0] == &quot;conditional&quot;) &amp;&amp; p[1] === self) ||
+                    ((p[0] == &quot;binary&quot; || p[0] == &quot;assign&quot; || p[0] == &quot;unary-postfix&quot;) &amp;&amp; p[2] === self)) {
+                    self = p;
+                    p = a.pop();
+                } else {
+                    return false;
+                }
+            }
+        }
+        return !HOP(DOT_CALL_NO_PARENS, expr[0]);
+    };
+
+    function make_num(num) {
+        var str = num.toString(10), a = [ str.replace(/^0\./, &quot;.&quot;).replace('e+', 'e') ], m;
+        if (Math.floor(num) === num) {
+            if (num &gt;= 0) {
+                a.push(&quot;0x&quot; + num.toString(16).toLowerCase(), // probably pointless
+                       &quot;0&quot; + num.toString(8)); // same.
+            } else {
+                a.push(&quot;-0x&quot; + (-num).toString(16).toLowerCase(), // probably pointless
+                       &quot;-0&quot; + (-num).toString(8)); // same.
+            }
+            if ((m = /^(.*?)(0+)$/.exec(num))) {
+                a.push(m[1] + &quot;e&quot; + m[2].length);
+            }
+        } else if ((m = /^0?\.(0+)(.*)$/.exec(num))) {
+            a.push(m[2] + &quot;e-&quot; + (m[1].length + m[2].length),
+                   str.substr(str.indexOf(&quot;.&quot;)));
+        }
+        return best_of(a);
+    };
+
+    var w = ast_walker();
+    var make = w.walk;
+    return w.with_walkers({
+        &quot;string&quot;: encode_string,
+        &quot;num&quot;: make_num,
+        &quot;name&quot;: make_name,
+        &quot;debugger&quot;: function(){ return &quot;debugger;&quot; },
+        &quot;toplevel&quot;: function(statements) {
+            return make_block_statements(statements)
+                .join(newline + newline);
+        },
+        &quot;splice&quot;: function(statements) {
+            var parent = w.parent();
+            if (HOP(SPLICE_NEEDS_BRACKETS, parent)) {
+                // we need block brackets in this case
+                return make_block.apply(this, arguments);
+            } else {
+                return MAP(make_block_statements(statements, true),
+                           function(line, i) {
+                               // the first line is already indented
+                               return i &gt; 0 ? indent(line) : line;
+                           }).join(newline);
+            }
+        },
+        &quot;block&quot;: make_block,
+        &quot;var&quot;: function(defs) {
+            return &quot;var &quot; + add_commas(MAP(defs, make_1vardef)) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;const&quot;: function(defs) {
+            return &quot;const &quot; + add_commas(MAP(defs, make_1vardef)) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;try&quot;: function(tr, ca, fi) {
+            var out = [ &quot;try&quot;, make_block(tr) ];
+            if (ca) out.push(&quot;catch&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + ca[0] + &quot;)&quot;, make_block(ca[1]));
+            if (fi) out.push(&quot;finally&quot;, make_block(fi));
+            return add_spaces(out);
+        },
+        &quot;throw&quot;: function(expr) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;throw&quot;, make(expr) ]) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;new&quot;: function(ctor, args) {
+            args = args.length &gt; 0 ? &quot;(&quot; + add_commas(MAP(args, function(expr){
+                return parenthesize(expr, &quot;seq&quot;);
+            })) + &quot;)&quot; : &quot;&quot;;
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;new&quot;, parenthesize(ctor, &quot;seq&quot;, &quot;binary&quot;, &quot;conditional&quot;, &quot;assign&quot;, function(expr){
+                var w = ast_walker(), has_call = {};
+                try {
+                    w.with_walkers({
+                        &quot;call&quot;: function() { throw has_call },
+                        &quot;function&quot;: function() { return this }
+                    }, function(){
+                        w.walk(expr);
+                    });
+                } catch(ex) {
+                    if (ex === has_call)
+                        return true;
+                    throw ex;
+                }
+            }) + args ]);
+        },
+        &quot;switch&quot;: function(expr, body) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;switch&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + make(expr) + &quot;)&quot;, make_switch_block(body) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;break&quot;: function(label) {
+            var out = &quot;break&quot;;
+            if (label != null)
+                out += &quot; &quot; + make_name(label);
+            return out + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;continue&quot;: function(label) {
+            var out = &quot;continue&quot;;
+            if (label != null)
+                out += &quot; &quot; + make_name(label);
+            return out + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;conditional&quot;: function(co, th, el) {
+            return add_spaces([ parenthesize(co, &quot;assign&quot;, &quot;seq&quot;, &quot;conditional&quot;), &quot;?&quot;,
+                                parenthesize(th, &quot;seq&quot;), &quot;:&quot;,
+                                parenthesize(el, &quot;seq&quot;) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;assign&quot;: function(op, lvalue, rvalue) {
+            if (op &amp;&amp; op !== true) op += &quot;=&quot;;
+            else op = &quot;=&quot;;
+            return add_spaces([ make(lvalue), op, parenthesize(rvalue, &quot;seq&quot;) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;dot&quot;: function(expr) {
+            var out = make(expr), i = 1;
+            if (expr[0] == &quot;num&quot;) {
+                if (!/[a-f.]/i.test(out))
+                    out += &quot;.&quot;;
+            } else if (expr[0] != &quot;function&quot; &amp;&amp; needs_parens(expr))
+                out = &quot;(&quot; + out + &quot;)&quot;;
+            while (i &lt; arguments.length)
+                out += &quot;.&quot; + make_name(arguments[i++]);
+            return out;
+        },
+        &quot;call&quot;: function(func, args) {
+            var f = make(func);
+            if (f.charAt(0) != &quot;(&quot; &amp;&amp; needs_parens(func))
+                f = &quot;(&quot; + f + &quot;)&quot;;
+            return f + &quot;(&quot; + add_commas(MAP(args, function(expr){
+                return parenthesize(expr, &quot;seq&quot;);
+            })) + &quot;)&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;function&quot;: make_function,
+        &quot;defun&quot;: make_function,
+        &quot;if&quot;: function(co, th, el) {
+            var out = [ &quot;if&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + make(co) + &quot;)&quot;, el ? make_then(th) : make(th) ];
+            if (el) {
+                out.push(&quot;else&quot;, make(el));
+            }
+            return add_spaces(out);
+        },
+        &quot;for&quot;: function(init, cond, step, block) {
+            var out = [ &quot;for&quot; ];
+            init = (init != null ? make(init) : &quot;&quot;).replace(/;*\s*$/, &quot;;&quot; + space);
+            cond = (cond != null ? make(cond) : &quot;&quot;).replace(/;*\s*$/, &quot;;&quot; + space);
+            step = (step != null ? make(step) : &quot;&quot;).replace(/;*\s*$/, &quot;&quot;);
+            var args = init + cond + step;
+            if (args == &quot;; ; &quot;) args = &quot;;;&quot;;
+            out.push(&quot;(&quot; + args + &quot;)&quot;, make(block));
+            return add_spaces(out);
+        },
+        &quot;for-in&quot;: function(vvar, key, hash, block) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;for&quot;, &quot;(&quot; +
+                                (vvar ? make(vvar).replace(/;+$/, &quot;&quot;) : make(key)),
+                                &quot;in&quot;,
+                                make(hash) + &quot;)&quot;, make(block) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;while&quot;: function(condition, block) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;while&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + make(condition) + &quot;)&quot;, make(block) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;do&quot;: function(condition, block) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;do&quot;, make(block), &quot;while&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + make(condition) + &quot;)&quot; ]) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;return&quot;: function(expr) {
+            var out = [ &quot;return&quot; ];
+            if (expr != null) out.push(make(expr));
+            return add_spaces(out) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;binary&quot;: function(operator, lvalue, rvalue) {
+            var left = make(lvalue), right = make(rvalue);
+            // XXX: I'm pretty sure other cases will bite here.
+            //      we need to be smarter.
+            //      adding parens all the time is the safest bet.
+            if (member(lvalue[0], [ &quot;assign&quot;, &quot;conditional&quot;, &quot;seq&quot; ]) ||
+                lvalue[0] == &quot;binary&quot; &amp;&amp; PRECEDENCE[operator] &gt; PRECEDENCE[lvalue[1]] ||
+                lvalue[0] == &quot;function&quot; &amp;&amp; needs_parens(this)) {
+                left = &quot;(&quot; + left + &quot;)&quot;;
+            }
+            if (member(rvalue[0], [ &quot;assign&quot;, &quot;conditional&quot;, &quot;seq&quot; ]) ||
+                rvalue[0] == &quot;binary&quot; &amp;&amp; PRECEDENCE[operator] &gt;= PRECEDENCE[rvalue[1]] &amp;&amp;
+                !(rvalue[1] == operator &amp;&amp; member(operator, [ &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;, &quot;||&quot;, &quot;*&quot; ]))) {
+                right = &quot;(&quot; + right + &quot;)&quot;;
+            }
+            else if (!beautify &amp;&amp; options.inline_script &amp;&amp; (operator == &quot;&lt;&quot; || operator == &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;)
+                     &amp;&amp; rvalue[0] == &quot;regexp&quot; &amp;&amp; /^script/i.test(rvalue[1])) {
+                right = &quot; &quot; + right;
+            }
+            return add_spaces([ left, operator, right ]);
+        },
+        &quot;unary-prefix&quot;: function(operator, expr) {
+            var val = make(expr);
+            if (!(expr[0] == &quot;num&quot; || (expr[0] == &quot;unary-prefix&quot; &amp;&amp; !HOP(OPERATORS, operator + expr[1])) || !needs_parens(expr)))
+                val = &quot;(&quot; + val + &quot;)&quot;;
+            return operator + (jsp.is_alphanumeric_char(operator.charAt(0)) ? &quot; &quot; : &quot;&quot;) + val;
+        },
+        &quot;unary-postfix&quot;: function(operator, expr) {
+            var val = make(expr);
+            if (!(expr[0] == &quot;num&quot; || (expr[0] == &quot;unary-postfix&quot; &amp;&amp; !HOP(OPERATORS, operator + expr[1])) || !needs_parens(expr)))
+                val = &quot;(&quot; + val + &quot;)&quot;;
+            return val + operator;
+        },
+        &quot;sub&quot;: function(expr, subscript) {
+            var hash = make(expr);
+            if (needs_parens(expr))
+                hash = &quot;(&quot; + hash + &quot;)&quot;;
+            return hash + &quot;[&quot; + make(subscript) + &quot;]&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;object&quot;: function(props) {
+            var obj_needs_parens = needs_parens(this);
+            if (props.length == 0)
+                return obj_needs_parens ? &quot;({})&quot; : &quot;{}&quot;;
+            var out = &quot;{&quot; + newline + with_indent(function(){
+                return MAP(props, function(p){
+                    if (p.length == 3) {
+                        // getter/setter.  The name is in p[0], the arg.list in p[1][2], the
+                        // body in p[1][3] and type (&quot;get&quot; / &quot;set&quot;) in p[2].
+                        return indent(make_function(p[0], p[1][2], p[1][3], p[2], true));
+                    }
+                    var key = p[0], val = parenthesize(p[1], &quot;seq&quot;);
+                    if (options.quote_keys) {
+                        key = encode_string(key);
+                    } else if ((typeof key == &quot;number&quot; || !beautify &amp;&amp; +key + &quot;&quot; == key)
+                               &amp;&amp; parseFloat(key) &gt;= 0) {
+                        key = make_num(+key);
+                    } else if (!is_identifier(key)) {
+                        key = encode_string(key);
+                    }
+                    return indent(add_spaces(beautify &amp;&amp; options.space_colon
+                                             ? [ key, &quot;:&quot;, val ]
+                                             : [ key + &quot;:&quot;, val ]));
+                }).join(&quot;,&quot; + newline);
+            }) + newline + indent(&quot;}&quot;);
+            return obj_needs_parens ? &quot;(&quot; + out + &quot;)&quot; : out;
+        },
+        &quot;regexp&quot;: function(rx, mods) {
+            if (options.ascii_only) rx = to_ascii(rx);
+            return &quot;/&quot; + rx + &quot;/&quot; + mods;
+        },
+        &quot;array&quot;: function(elements) {
+            if (elements.length == 0) return &quot;[]&quot;;
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;[&quot;, add_commas(MAP(elements, function(el, i){
+                if (!beautify &amp;&amp; el[0] == &quot;atom&quot; &amp;&amp; el[1] == &quot;undefined&quot;) return i === elements.length - 1 ? &quot;,&quot; : &quot;&quot;;
+                return parenthesize(el, &quot;seq&quot;);
+            })), &quot;]&quot; ]);
+        },
+        &quot;stat&quot;: function(stmt) {
+            return stmt != null
+                ? make(stmt).replace(/;*\s*$/, &quot;;&quot;)
+                : &quot;;&quot;;
+        },
+        &quot;seq&quot;: function() {
+            return add_commas(MAP(slice(arguments), make));
+        },
+        &quot;label&quot;: function(name, block) {
+            return add_spaces([ make_name(name), &quot;:&quot;, make(block) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;with&quot;: function(expr, block) {
+            return add_spaces([ &quot;with&quot;, &quot;(&quot; + make(expr) + &quot;)&quot;, make(block) ]);
+        },
+        &quot;atom&quot;: function(name) {
+            return make_name(name);
+        },
+        &quot;directive&quot;: function(dir) {
+            return make_string(dir) + &quot;;&quot;;
+        }
+    }, function(){ return make(ast) });
+
+    // The squeezer replaces &quot;block&quot;-s that contain only a single
+    // statement with the statement itself; technically, the AST
+    // is correct, but this can create problems when we output an
+    // IF having an ELSE clause where the THEN clause ends in an
+    // IF *without* an ELSE block (then the outer ELSE would refer
+    // to the inner IF).  This function checks for this case and
+    // adds the block brackets if needed.
+    function make_then(th) {
+        if (th == null) return &quot;;&quot;;
+        if (th[0] == &quot;do&quot;) {
+            // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/#issue/57
+            // IE croaks with &quot;syntax error&quot; on code like this:
+            //     if (foo) do ... while(cond); else ...
+            // we need block brackets around do/while
+            return make_block([ th ]);
+        }
+        var b = th;
+        while (true) {
+            var type = b[0];
+            if (type == &quot;if&quot;) {
+                if (!b[3])
+                    // no else, we must add the block
+                    return make([ &quot;block&quot;, [ th ]]);
+                b = b[3];
+            }
+            else if (type == &quot;while&quot; || type == &quot;do&quot;) b = b[2];
+            else if (type == &quot;for&quot; || type == &quot;for-in&quot;) b = b[4];
+            else break;
+        }
+        return make(th);
+    };
+
+    function make_function(name, args, body, keyword, no_parens) {
+        var out = keyword || &quot;function&quot;;
+        if (name) {
+            out += &quot; &quot; + make_name(name);
+        }
+        out += &quot;(&quot; + add_commas(MAP(args, make_name)) + &quot;)&quot;;
+        out = add_spaces([ out, make_block(body) ]);
+        return (!no_parens &amp;&amp; needs_parens(this)) ? &quot;(&quot; + out + &quot;)&quot; : out;
+    };
+
+    function must_has_semicolon(node) {
+        switch (node[0]) {
+          case &quot;with&quot;:
+          case &quot;while&quot;:
+            return empty(node[2]) || must_has_semicolon(node[2]);
+          case &quot;for&quot;:
+          case &quot;for-in&quot;:
+            return empty(node[4]) || must_has_semicolon(node[4]);
+          case &quot;if&quot;:
+            if (empty(node[2]) &amp;&amp; !node[3]) return true; // `if' with empty `then' and no `else'
+            if (node[3]) {
+                if (empty(node[3])) return true; // `else' present but empty
+                return must_has_semicolon(node[3]); // dive into the `else' branch
+            }
+            return must_has_semicolon(node[2]); // dive into the `then' branch
+          case &quot;directive&quot;:
+            return true;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function make_block_statements(statements, noindent) {
+        for (var a = [], last = statements.length - 1, i = 0; i &lt;= last; ++i) {
+            var stat = statements[i];
+            var code = make(stat);
+            if (code != &quot;;&quot;) {
+                if (!beautify &amp;&amp; i == last &amp;&amp; !must_has_semicolon(stat)) {
+                    code = code.replace(/;+\s*$/, &quot;&quot;);
+                }
+                a.push(code);
+            }
+        }
+        return noindent ? a : MAP(a, indent);
+    };
+
+    function make_switch_block(body) {
+        var n = body.length;
+        if (n == 0) return &quot;{}&quot;;
+        return &quot;{&quot; + newline + MAP(body, function(branch, i){
+            var has_body = branch[1].length &gt; 0, code = with_indent(function(){
+                return indent(branch[0]
+                              ? add_spaces([ &quot;case&quot;, make(branch[0]) + &quot;:&quot; ])
+                              : &quot;default:&quot;);
+            }, 0.5) + (has_body ? newline + with_indent(function(){
+                return make_block_statements(branch[1]).join(newline);
+            }) : &quot;&quot;);
+            if (!beautify &amp;&amp; has_body &amp;&amp; i &lt; n - 1)
+                code += &quot;;&quot;;
+            return code;
+        }).join(newline) + newline + indent(&quot;}&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function make_block(statements) {
+        if (!statements) return &quot;;&quot;;
+        if (statements.length == 0) return &quot;{}&quot;;
+        return &quot;{&quot; + newline + with_indent(function(){
+            return make_block_statements(statements).join(newline);
+        }) + newline + indent(&quot;}&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function make_1vardef(def) {
+        var name = def[0], val = def[1];
+        if (val != null)
+            name = add_spaces([ make_name(name), &quot;=&quot;, parenthesize(val, &quot;seq&quot;) ]);
+        return name;
+    };
+
+};
+
+function split_lines(code, max_line_length) {
+    var splits = [ 0 ];
+    jsp.parse(function(){
+        var next_token = jsp.tokenizer(code);
+        var last_split = 0;
+        var prev_token;
+        function current_length(tok) {
+            return tok.pos - last_split;
+        };
+        function split_here(tok) {
+            last_split = tok.pos;
+            splits.push(last_split);
+        };
+        function custom(){
+            var tok = next_token.apply(this, arguments);
+            out: {
+                if (prev_token) {
+                    if (prev_token.type == &quot;keyword&quot;) break out;
+                }
+                if (current_length(tok) &gt; max_line_length) {
+                    switch (tok.type) {
+                      case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+                      case &quot;atom&quot;:
+                      case &quot;name&quot;:
+                      case &quot;punc&quot;:
+                        split_here(tok);
+                        break out;
+                    }
+                }
+            }
+            prev_token = tok;
+            return tok;
+        };
+        custom.context = function() {
+            return next_token.context.apply(this, arguments);
+        };
+        return custom;
+    }());
+    return splits.map(function(pos, i){
+        return code.substring(pos, splits[i + 1] || code.length);
+    }).join(&quot;\n&quot;);
+};
+
+/* -----[ Utilities ]----- */
+
+function repeat_string(str, i) {
+    if (i &lt;= 0) return &quot;&quot;;
+    if (i == 1) return str;
+    var d = repeat_string(str, i &gt;&gt; 1);
+    d += d;
+    if (i &amp; 1) d += str;
+    return d;
+};
+
+function defaults(args, defs) {
+    var ret = {};
+    if (args === true)
+        args = {};
+    for (var i in defs) if (HOP(defs, i)) {
+        ret[i] = (args &amp;&amp; HOP(args, i)) ? args[i] : defs[i];
+    }
+    return ret;
+};
+
+function is_identifier(name) {
+    return /^[a-z_$][a-z0-9_$]*$/i.test(name)
+        &amp;&amp; name != &quot;this&quot;
+        &amp;&amp; !HOP(jsp.KEYWORDS_ATOM, name)
+        &amp;&amp; !HOP(jsp.RESERVED_WORDS, name)
+        &amp;&amp; !HOP(jsp.KEYWORDS, name);
+};
+
+function HOP(obj, prop) {
+    return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(obj, prop);
+};
+
+// some utilities
+
+var MAP;
+
+(function(){
+    MAP = function(a, f, o) {
+        var ret = [], top = [], i;
+        function doit() {
+            var val = f.call(o, a[i], i);
+            if (val instanceof AtTop) {
+                val = val.v;
+                if (val instanceof Splice) {
+                    top.push.apply(top, val.v);
+                } else {
+                    top.push(val);
+                }
+            }
+            else if (val != skip) {
+                if (val instanceof Splice) {
+                    ret.push.apply(ret, val.v);
+                } else {
+                    ret.push(val);
+                }
+            }
+        };
+        if (a instanceof Array) for (i = 0; i &lt; a.length; ++i) doit();
+        else for (i in a) if (HOP(a, i)) doit();
+        return top.concat(ret);
+    };
+    MAP.at_top = function(val) { return new AtTop(val) };
+    MAP.splice = function(val) { return new Splice(val) };
+    var skip = MAP.skip = {};
+    function AtTop(val) { this.v = val };
+    function Splice(val) { this.v = val };
+})();
+
+/* -----[ Exports ]----- */
+
+exports.ast_walker = ast_walker;
+exports.ast_mangle = ast_mangle;
+exports.ast_squeeze = ast_squeeze;
+exports.ast_lift_variables = ast_lift_variables;
+exports.gen_code = gen_code;
+exports.ast_add_scope = ast_add_scope;
+exports.set_logger = function(logger) { warn = logger };
+exports.make_string = make_string;
+exports.split_lines = split_lines;
+exports.MAP = MAP;
+
+// keep this last!
+exports.ast_squeeze_more = require(&quot;./squeeze-more&quot;).ast_squeeze_more;
+
+// Local variables:
+// js-indent-level: 4
+// End:
+});
+define('uglifyjs/index', [&quot;require&quot;, &quot;exports&quot;, &quot;module&quot;, &quot;./parse-js&quot;, &quot;./process&quot;, &quot;./consolidator&quot;], function(require, exports, module) {
+//convienence function(src, [options]);
+function uglify(orig_code, options){
+  options || (options = {});
+  var jsp = uglify.parser;
+  var pro = uglify.uglify;
+
+  var ast = jsp.parse(orig_code, options.strict_semicolons); // parse code and get the initial AST
+  ast = pro.ast_mangle(ast, options.mangle_options); // get a new AST with mangled names
+  ast = pro.ast_squeeze(ast, options.squeeze_options); // get an AST with compression optimizations
+  var final_code = pro.gen_code(ast, options.gen_options); // compressed code here
+  return final_code;
+};
+
+uglify.parser = require(&quot;./parse-js&quot;);
+uglify.uglify = require(&quot;./process&quot;);
+uglify.consolidator = require(&quot;./consolidator&quot;);
+
+module.exports = uglify
+});/* -*- Mode: js; js-indent-level: 2; -*- */
+/*
+ * Copyright 2011 Mozilla Foundation and contributors
+ * Licensed under the New BSD license. See LICENSE or:
+ * http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause
+ */
+
+define('source-map/array-set', function (require, exports, module) {
+
+  var util = require('./util');
+
+  /**
+   * A data structure which is a combination of an array and a set. Adding a new
+   * member is O(1), testing for membership is O(1), and finding the index of an
+   * element is O(1). Removing elements from the set is not supported. Only
+   * strings are supported for membership.
+   */
+  function ArraySet() {
+    this._array = [];
+    this._set = {};
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Static method for creating ArraySet instances from an existing array.
+   */
+  ArraySet.fromArray = function ArraySet_fromArray(aArray, aAllowDuplicates) {
+    var set = new ArraySet();
+    for (var i = 0, len = aArray.length; i &lt; len; i++) {
+      set.add(aArray[i], aAllowDuplicates);
+    }
+    return set;
+  };
+
+  /**
+   * Add the given string to this set.
+   *
+   * @param String aStr
+   */
+  ArraySet.prototype.add = function ArraySet_add(aStr, aAllowDuplicates) {
+    var isDuplicate = this.has(aStr);
+    var idx = this._array.length;
+    if (!isDuplicate || aAllowDuplicates) {
+      this._array.push(aStr);
+    }
+    if (!isDuplicate) {
+      this._set[util.toSetString(aStr)] = idx;
+    }
+  };
+
+  /**
+   * Is the given string a member of this set?
+   *
+   * @param String aStr
+   */
+  ArraySet.prototype.has = function ArraySet_has(aStr) {
+    return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(this._set,
+                                                util.toSetString(aStr));
+  };
+
+  /**
+   * What is the index of the given string in the array?
+   *
+   * @param String aStr
+   */
+  ArraySet.prototype.indexOf = function ArraySet_indexOf(aStr) {
+    if (this.has(aStr)) {
+      return this._set[util.toSetString(aStr)];
+    }
+    throw new Error('&quot;' + aStr + '&quot; is not in the set.');
+  };
+
+  /**
+   * What is the element at the given index?
+   *
+   * @param Number aIdx
+   */
+  ArraySet.prototype.at = function ArraySet_at(aIdx) {
+    if (aIdx &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; aIdx &lt; this._array.length) {
+      return this._array[aIdx];
+    }
+    throw new Error('No element indexed by ' + aIdx);
+  };
+
+  /**
+   * Returns the array representation of this set (which has the proper indices
+   * indicated by indexOf). Note that this is a copy of the internal array used
+   * for storing the members so that no one can mess with internal state.
+   */
+  ArraySet.prototype.toArray = function ArraySet_toArray() {
+    return this._array.slice();
+  };
+
+  exports.ArraySet = ArraySet;
+
+});
+/* -*- Mode: js; js-indent-level: 2; -*- */
+/*
+ * Copyright 2011 Mozilla Foundation and contributors
+ * Licensed under the New BSD license. See LICENSE or:
+ * http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause
+ *
+ * Based on the Base 64 VLQ implementation in Closure Compiler:
+ * https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/trunk/src/com/google/debugging/sourcemap/Base64VLQ.java
+ *
+ * Copyright 2011 The Closure Compiler Authors. All rights reserved.
+ * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
+ * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
+ * met:
+ *
+ *  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright
+ *    notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
