+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.init._walk(visitor);
+            this.object._walk(visitor);
+            this.body._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_IterationStatement);
+
+var AST_With = DEFNODE(&quot;With&quot;, &quot;expression&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `with` statement&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] the `with` expression&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+            this.body._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_StatementWithBody);
+
+/* -----[ scope and functions ]----- */
+
+var AST_Scope = DEFNODE(&quot;Scope&quot;, &quot;directives variables functions uses_with uses_eval parent_scope enclosed cname&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for all statements introducing a lexical scope&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        directives: &quot;[string*/S] an array of directives declared in this scope&quot;,
+        variables: &quot;[Object/S] a map of name -&gt; SymbolDef for all variables/functions defined in this scope&quot;,
+        functions: &quot;[Object/S] like `variables`, but only lists function declarations&quot;,
+        uses_with: &quot;[boolean/S] tells whether this scope uses the `with` statement&quot;,
+        uses_eval: &quot;[boolean/S] tells whether this scope contains a direct call to the global `eval`&quot;,
+        parent_scope: &quot;[AST_Scope?/S] link to the parent scope&quot;,
+        enclosed: &quot;[SymbolDef*/S] a list of all symbol definitions that are accessed from this scope or any subscopes&quot;,
+        cname: &quot;[integer/S] current index for mangling variables (used internally by the mangler)&quot;,
+    },
+}, AST_Block);
+
+var AST_Toplevel = DEFNODE(&quot;Toplevel&quot;, &quot;globals&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The toplevel scope&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        globals: &quot;[Object/S] a map of name -&gt; SymbolDef for all undeclared names&quot;,
+    },
+    wrap_enclose: function(arg_parameter_pairs) {
+        var self = this;
+        var args = [];
+        var parameters = [];
+
+        arg_parameter_pairs.forEach(function(pair) {
+            var split = pair.split(&quot;:&quot;);
+
+            args.push(split[0]);
+            parameters.push(split[1]);
+        });
+
+        var wrapped_tl = &quot;(function(&quot; + parameters.join(&quot;,&quot;) + &quot;){ '$ORIG'; })(&quot; + args.join(&quot;,&quot;) + &quot;)&quot;;
+        wrapped_tl = parse(wrapped_tl);
+        wrapped_tl = wrapped_tl.transform(new TreeTransformer(function before(node){
+            if (node instanceof AST_Directive &amp;&amp; node.value == &quot;$ORIG&quot;) {
+                return MAP.splice(self.body);
+            }
+        }));
+        return wrapped_tl;
+    },
+    wrap_commonjs: function(name, export_all) {
+        var self = this;
+        var to_export = [];
+        if (export_all) {
+            self.figure_out_scope();
+            self.walk(new TreeWalker(function(node){
+                if (node instanceof AST_SymbolDeclaration &amp;&amp; node.definition().global) {
+                    if (!find_if(function(n){ return n.name == node.name }, to_export))
+                        to_export.push(node);
+                }
+            }));
+        }
+        var wrapped_tl = &quot;(function(exports, global){ global['&quot; + name + &quot;'] = exports; '$ORIG'; '$EXPORTS'; }({}, (function(){return this}())))&quot;;
+        wrapped_tl = parse(wrapped_tl);
+        wrapped_tl = wrapped_tl.transform(new TreeTransformer(function before(node){
+            if (node instanceof AST_SimpleStatement) {
+                node = node.body;
+                if (node instanceof AST_String) switch (node.getValue()) {
+                  case &quot;$ORIG&quot;:
+                    return MAP.splice(self.body);
+                  case &quot;$EXPORTS&quot;:
+                    var body = [];
+                    to_export.forEach(function(sym){
+                        body.push(new AST_SimpleStatement({
+                            body: new AST_Assign({
+                                left: new AST_Sub({
+                                    expression: new AST_SymbolRef({ name: &quot;exports&quot; }),
+                                    property: new AST_String({ value: sym.name }),
+                                }),
+                                operator: &quot;=&quot;,
+                                right: new AST_SymbolRef(sym),
+                            }),
+                        }));
+                    });
+                    return MAP.splice(body);
+                }
+            }
+        }));
+        return wrapped_tl;
+    }
+}, AST_Scope);
+
+var AST_Lambda = DEFNODE(&quot;Lambda&quot;, &quot;name argnames uses_arguments&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for functions&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        name: &quot;[AST_SymbolDeclaration?] the name of this function&quot;,
+        argnames: &quot;[AST_SymbolFunarg*] array of function arguments&quot;,
+        uses_arguments: &quot;[boolean/S] tells whether this function accesses the arguments array&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            if (this.name) this.name._walk(visitor);
+            this.argnames.forEach(function(arg){
+                arg._walk(visitor);
+            });
+            walk_body(this, visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Scope);
+
+var AST_Accessor = DEFNODE(&quot;Accessor&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A setter/getter function.  The `name` property is always null.&quot;
+}, AST_Lambda);
+
+var AST_Function = DEFNODE(&quot;Function&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A function expression&quot;
+}, AST_Lambda);
+
+var AST_Defun = DEFNODE(&quot;Defun&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A function definition&quot;
+}, AST_Lambda);
+
+/* -----[ JUMPS ]----- */
+
+var AST_Jump = DEFNODE(&quot;Jump&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for “jumps” (for now that's `return`, `throw`, `break` and `continue`)&quot;
+}, AST_Statement);
+
+var AST_Exit = DEFNODE(&quot;Exit&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for “exits” (`return` and `throw`)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        value: &quot;[AST_Node?] the value returned or thrown by this statement; could be null for AST_Return&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, this.value &amp;&amp; function(){
+            this.value._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Jump);
+
+var AST_Return = DEFNODE(&quot;Return&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `return` statement&quot;
+}, AST_Exit);
+
+var AST_Throw = DEFNODE(&quot;Throw&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `throw` statement&quot;
+}, AST_Exit);
+
+var AST_LoopControl = DEFNODE(&quot;LoopControl&quot;, &quot;label&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for loop control statements (`break` and `continue`)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        label: &quot;[AST_LabelRef?] the label, or null if none&quot;,
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, this.label &amp;&amp; function(){
+            this.label._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Jump);
+
+var AST_Break = DEFNODE(&quot;Break&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `break` statement&quot;
+}, AST_LoopControl);
+
+var AST_Continue = DEFNODE(&quot;Continue&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `continue` statement&quot;
+}, AST_LoopControl);
+
+/* -----[ IF ]----- */
+
+var AST_If = DEFNODE(&quot;If&quot;, &quot;condition alternative&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `if` statement&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        condition: &quot;[AST_Node] the `if` condition&quot;,
+        alternative: &quot;[AST_Statement?] the `else` part, or null if not present&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.condition._walk(visitor);
+            this.body._walk(visitor);
+            if (this.alternative) this.alternative._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_StatementWithBody);
+
+/* -----[ SWITCH ]----- */
+
+var AST_Switch = DEFNODE(&quot;Switch&quot;, &quot;expression&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `switch` statement&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] the `switch` “discriminant”&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+            walk_body(this, visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Block);
+
+var AST_SwitchBranch = DEFNODE(&quot;SwitchBranch&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for `switch` branches&quot;,
+}, AST_Block);
+
+var AST_Default = DEFNODE(&quot;Default&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `default` switch branch&quot;,
+}, AST_SwitchBranch);
+
+var AST_Case = DEFNODE(&quot;Case&quot;, &quot;expression&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `case` switch branch&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] the `case` expression&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+            walk_body(this, visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_SwitchBranch);
+
+/* -----[ EXCEPTIONS ]----- */
+
+var AST_Try = DEFNODE(&quot;Try&quot;, &quot;bcatch bfinally&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `try` statement&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        bcatch: &quot;[AST_Catch?] the catch block, or null if not present&quot;,
+        bfinally: &quot;[AST_Finally?] the finally block, or null if not present&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            walk_body(this, visitor);
+            if (this.bcatch) this.bcatch._walk(visitor);
+            if (this.bfinally) this.bfinally._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Block);
+
+var AST_Catch = DEFNODE(&quot;Catch&quot;, &quot;argname&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `catch` node; only makes sense as part of a `try` statement&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        argname: &quot;[AST_SymbolCatch] symbol for the exception&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.argname._walk(visitor);
+            walk_body(this, visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Block);
+
+var AST_Finally = DEFNODE(&quot;Finally&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `finally` node; only makes sense as part of a `try` statement&quot;
+}, AST_Block);
+
+/* -----[ VAR/CONST ]----- */
+
+var AST_Definitions = DEFNODE(&quot;Definitions&quot;, &quot;definitions&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for `var` or `const` nodes (variable declarations/initializations)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        definitions: &quot;[AST_VarDef*] array of variable definitions&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.definitions.forEach(function(def){
+                def._walk(visitor);
+            });
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_Statement);
+
+var AST_Var = DEFNODE(&quot;Var&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `var` statement&quot;
+}, AST_Definitions);
+
+var AST_Const = DEFNODE(&quot;Const&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A `const` statement&quot;
+}, AST_Definitions);
+
+var AST_VarDef = DEFNODE(&quot;VarDef&quot;, &quot;name value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A variable declaration; only appears in a AST_Definitions node&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        name: &quot;[AST_SymbolVar|AST_SymbolConst] name of the variable&quot;,
+        value: &quot;[AST_Node?] initializer, or null of there's no initializer&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.name._walk(visitor);
+            if (this.value) this.value._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+/* -----[ OTHER ]----- */
+
+var AST_Call = DEFNODE(&quot;Call&quot;, &quot;expression args&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A function call expression&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] expression to invoke as function&quot;,
+        args: &quot;[AST_Node*] array of arguments&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+            this.args.forEach(function(arg){
+                arg._walk(visitor);
+            });
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_New = DEFNODE(&quot;New&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An object instantiation.  Derives from a function call since it has exactly the same properties&quot;
+}, AST_Call);
+
+var AST_Seq = DEFNODE(&quot;Seq&quot;, &quot;car cdr&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A sequence expression (two comma-separated expressions)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        car: &quot;[AST_Node] first element in sequence&quot;,
+        cdr: &quot;[AST_Node] second element in sequence&quot;
+    },
+    $cons: function(x, y) {
+        var seq = new AST_Seq(x);
+        seq.car = x;
+        seq.cdr = y;
+        return seq;
+    },
+    $from_array: function(array) {
+        if (array.length == 0) return null;
+        if (array.length == 1) return array[0].clone();
+        var list = null;
+        for (var i = array.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+            list = AST_Seq.cons(array[i], list);
+        }
+        var p = list;
+        while (p) {
+            if (p.cdr &amp;&amp; !p.cdr.cdr) {
+                p.cdr = p.cdr.car;
+                break;
+            }
+            p = p.cdr;
+        }
+        return list;
+    },
+    to_array: function() {
+        var p = this, a = [];
+        while (p) {
+            a.push(p.car);
+            if (p.cdr &amp;&amp; !(p.cdr instanceof AST_Seq)) {
+                a.push(p.cdr);
+                break;
+            }
+            p = p.cdr;
+        }
+        return a;
+    },
+    add: function(node) {
+        var p = this;
+        while (p) {
+            if (!(p.cdr instanceof AST_Seq)) {
+                var cell = AST_Seq.cons(p.cdr, node);
+                return p.cdr = cell;
+            }
+            p = p.cdr;
+        }
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.car._walk(visitor);
+            if (this.cdr) this.cdr._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_PropAccess = DEFNODE(&quot;PropAccess&quot;, &quot;expression property&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for property access expressions, i.e. `a.foo` or `a[\&quot;foo\&quot;]`&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] the “container” expression&quot;,
+        property: &quot;[AST_Node|string] the property to access.  For AST_Dot this is always a plain string, while for AST_Sub it's an arbitrary AST_Node&quot;
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_Dot = DEFNODE(&quot;Dot&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A dotted property access expression&quot;,
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_PropAccess);
+
+var AST_Sub = DEFNODE(&quot;Sub&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Index-style property access, i.e. `a[\&quot;foo\&quot;]`&quot;,
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+            this.property._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+}, AST_PropAccess);
+
+var AST_Unary = DEFNODE(&quot;Unary&quot;, &quot;operator expression&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for unary expressions&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        operator: &quot;[string] the operator&quot;,
+        expression: &quot;[AST_Node] expression that this unary operator applies to&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.expression._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_UnaryPrefix = DEFNODE(&quot;UnaryPrefix&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Unary prefix expression, i.e. `typeof i` or `++i`&quot;
+}, AST_Unary);
+
+var AST_UnaryPostfix = DEFNODE(&quot;UnaryPostfix&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Unary postfix expression, i.e. `i++`&quot;
+}, AST_Unary);
+
+var AST_Binary = DEFNODE(&quot;Binary&quot;, &quot;left operator right&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Binary expression, i.e. `a + b`&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        left: &quot;[AST_Node] left-hand side expression&quot;,
+        operator: &quot;[string] the operator&quot;,
+        right: &quot;[AST_Node] right-hand side expression&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.left._walk(visitor);
+            this.right._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_Conditional = DEFNODE(&quot;Conditional&quot;, &quot;condition consequent alternative&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Conditional expression using the ternary operator, i.e. `a ? b : c`&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        condition: &quot;[AST_Node]&quot;,
+        consequent: &quot;[AST_Node]&quot;,
+        alternative: &quot;[AST_Node]&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.condition._walk(visitor);
+            this.consequent._walk(visitor);
+            this.alternative._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_Assign = DEFNODE(&quot;Assign&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An assignment expression — `a = b + 5`&quot;,
+}, AST_Binary);
+
+/* -----[ LITERALS ]----- */
+
+var AST_Array = DEFNODE(&quot;Array&quot;, &quot;elements&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An array literal&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        elements: &quot;[AST_Node*] array of elements&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.elements.forEach(function(el){
+                el._walk(visitor);
+            });
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_Object = DEFNODE(&quot;Object&quot;, &quot;properties&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An object literal&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        properties: &quot;[AST_ObjectProperty*] array of properties&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.properties.forEach(function(prop){
+                prop._walk(visitor);
+            });
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_ObjectProperty = DEFNODE(&quot;ObjectProperty&quot;, &quot;key value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for literal object properties&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        key: &quot;[string] the property name converted to a string for ObjectKeyVal.  For setters and getters this is an arbitrary AST_Node.&quot;,
+        value: &quot;[AST_Node] property value.  For setters and getters this is an AST_Function.&quot;
+    },
+    _walk: function(visitor) {
+        return visitor._visit(this, function(){
+            this.value._walk(visitor);
+        });
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_ObjectKeyVal = DEFNODE(&quot;ObjectKeyVal&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A key: value object property&quot;,
+}, AST_ObjectProperty);
+
+var AST_ObjectSetter = DEFNODE(&quot;ObjectSetter&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An object setter property&quot;,
+}, AST_ObjectProperty);
+
+var AST_ObjectGetter = DEFNODE(&quot;ObjectGetter&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;An object getter property&quot;,
+}, AST_ObjectProperty);
+
+var AST_Symbol = DEFNODE(&quot;Symbol&quot;, &quot;scope name thedef&quot;, {
+    $propdoc: {
+        name: &quot;[string] name of this symbol&quot;,
+        scope: &quot;[AST_Scope/S] the current scope (not necessarily the definition scope)&quot;,
+        thedef: &quot;[SymbolDef/S] the definition of this symbol&quot;
+    },
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for all symbols&quot;,
+});
+
+var AST_SymbolAccessor = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolAccessor&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The name of a property accessor (setter/getter function)&quot;
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_SymbolDeclaration = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolDeclaration&quot;, &quot;init&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A declaration symbol (symbol in var/const, function name or argument, symbol in catch)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        init: &quot;[AST_Node*/S] array of initializers for this declaration.&quot;
+    }
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_SymbolVar = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolVar&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol defining a variable&quot;,
+}, AST_SymbolDeclaration);
+
+var AST_SymbolConst = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolConst&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A constant declaration&quot;
+}, AST_SymbolDeclaration);
+
+var AST_SymbolFunarg = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolFunarg&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol naming a function argument&quot;,
+}, AST_SymbolVar);
+
+var AST_SymbolDefun = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolDefun&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol defining a function&quot;,
+}, AST_SymbolDeclaration);
+
+var AST_SymbolLambda = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolLambda&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol naming a function expression&quot;,
+}, AST_SymbolDeclaration);
+
+var AST_SymbolCatch = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolCatch&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol naming the exception in catch&quot;,
+}, AST_SymbolDeclaration);
+
+var AST_Label = DEFNODE(&quot;Label&quot;, &quot;references&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Symbol naming a label (declaration)&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        references: &quot;[AST_LoopControl*] a list of nodes referring to this label&quot;
+    },
+    initialize: function() {
+        this.references = [];
+        this.thedef = this;
+    }
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_SymbolRef = DEFNODE(&quot;SymbolRef&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Reference to some symbol (not definition/declaration)&quot;,
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_LabelRef = DEFNODE(&quot;LabelRef&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Reference to a label symbol&quot;,
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_This = DEFNODE(&quot;This&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `this` symbol&quot;,
+}, AST_Symbol);
+
+var AST_Constant = DEFNODE(&quot;Constant&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for all constants&quot;,
+    getValue: function() {
+        return this.value;
+    }
+});
+
+var AST_String = DEFNODE(&quot;String&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A string literal&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        value: &quot;[string] the contents of this string&quot;
+    }
+}, AST_Constant);
+
+var AST_Number = DEFNODE(&quot;Number&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A number literal&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        value: &quot;[number] the numeric value&quot;
+    }
+}, AST_Constant);
+
+var AST_RegExp = DEFNODE(&quot;RegExp&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A regexp literal&quot;,
+    $propdoc: {
+        value: &quot;[RegExp] the actual regexp&quot;
+    }
+}, AST_Constant);
+
+var AST_Atom = DEFNODE(&quot;Atom&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for atoms&quot;,
+}, AST_Constant);
+
+var AST_Null = DEFNODE(&quot;Null&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `null` atom&quot;,
+    value: null
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_NaN = DEFNODE(&quot;NaN&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The impossible value&quot;,
+    value: 0/0
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_Undefined = DEFNODE(&quot;Undefined&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `undefined` value&quot;,
+    value: (function(){}())
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_Hole = DEFNODE(&quot;Hole&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;A hole in an array&quot;,
+    value: (function(){}())
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_Infinity = DEFNODE(&quot;Infinity&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `Infinity` value&quot;,
+    value: 1/0
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_Boolean = DEFNODE(&quot;Boolean&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;Base class for booleans&quot;,
+}, AST_Atom);
+
+var AST_False = DEFNODE(&quot;False&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `false` atom&quot;,
+    value: false
+}, AST_Boolean);
+
+var AST_True = DEFNODE(&quot;True&quot;, null, {
+    $documentation: &quot;The `true` atom&quot;,
+    value: true
+}, AST_Boolean);
+
+/* -----[ TreeWalker ]----- */
+
+function TreeWalker(callback) {
+    this.visit = callback;
+    this.stack = [];
+};
+TreeWalker.prototype = {
+    _visit: function(node, descend) {
+        this.stack.push(node);
+        var ret = this.visit(node, descend ? function(){
+            descend.call(node);
+        } : noop);
+        if (!ret &amp;&amp; descend) {
+            descend.call(node);
+        }
+        this.stack.pop();
+        return ret;
+    },
+    parent: function(n) {
+        return this.stack[this.stack.length - 2 - (n || 0)];
+    },
+    push: function (node) {
+        this.stack.push(node);
+    },
+    pop: function() {
+        return this.stack.pop();
+    },
+    self: function() {
+        return this.stack[this.stack.length - 1];
+    },
+    find_parent: function(type) {
+        var stack = this.stack;
+        for (var i = stack.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+            var x = stack[i];
+            if (x instanceof type) return x;
+        }
+    },
+    has_directive: function(type) {
+        return this.find_parent(AST_Scope).has_directive(type);
+    },
+    in_boolean_context: function() {
+        var stack = this.stack;
+        var i = stack.length, self = stack[--i];
+        while (i &gt; 0) {
+            var p = stack[--i];
+            if ((p instanceof AST_If           &amp;&amp; p.condition === self) ||
+                (p instanceof AST_Conditional  &amp;&amp; p.condition === self) ||
+                (p instanceof AST_DWLoop       &amp;&amp; p.condition === self) ||
+                (p instanceof AST_For          &amp;&amp; p.condition === self) ||
+                (p instanceof AST_UnaryPrefix  &amp;&amp; p.operator == &quot;!&quot; &amp;&amp; p.expression === self))
+            {
+                return true;
+            }
+            if (!(p instanceof AST_Binary &amp;&amp; (p.operator == &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot; || p.operator == &quot;||&quot;)))
+                return false;
+            self = p;
+        }
+    },
+    loopcontrol_target: function(label) {
+        var stack = this.stack;
+        if (label) for (var i = stack.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+            var x = stack[i];
+            if (x instanceof AST_LabeledStatement &amp;&amp; x.label.name == label.name) {
+                return x.body;
+            }
+        } else for (var i = stack.length; --i &gt;= 0;) {
+            var x = stack[i];
+            if (x instanceof AST_Switch || x instanceof AST_IterationStatement)
+                return x;
+        }
+    }
+};
+
+/***********************************************************************
+
+  A JavaScript tokenizer / parser / beautifier / compressor.
+  https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS2
+
+  -------------------------------- (C) ---------------------------------
+
+                           Author: Mihai Bazon
+                         &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+                       http://mihai.bazon.net/blog
+
+  Distributed under the BSD license:
+
+    Copyright 2012 (c) Mihai Bazon &lt;mihai.bazon@gmail.com&gt;
+    Parser based on parse-js (http://marijn.haverbeke.nl/parse-js/).
+
+    Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
+    modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
+    are met:
+
+        * Redistributions of source code must retain the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer.
+
+        * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above
+          copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
+          disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
+          provided with the distribution.
+
+    THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER “AS IS” AND ANY
+    EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
+    IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
+    PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE
+    LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY,
+    OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
+    PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
+    PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
+    THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR
+    TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF
+    THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF
+    SUCH DAMAGE.
+
+ ***********************************************************************/
+
+&quot;use strict&quot;;
+
+var KEYWORDS = 'break case catch const continue debugger default delete do else finally for function if in instanceof new return switch throw try typeof var void while with';
+var KEYWORDS_ATOM = 'false null true';
+var RESERVED_WORDS = 'abstract boolean byte char class double enum export extends final float goto implements import int interface long native package private protected public short static super synchronized this throws transient volatile'
+    + &quot; &quot; + KEYWORDS_ATOM + &quot; &quot; + KEYWORDS;
+var KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = 'return new delete throw else case';
+
+KEYWORDS = makePredicate(KEYWORDS);
+RESERVED_WORDS = makePredicate(RESERVED_WORDS);
+KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = makePredicate(KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION);
+KEYWORDS_ATOM = makePredicate(KEYWORDS_ATOM);
+
+var OPERATOR_CHARS = makePredicate(characters(&quot;+-*&amp;%=&lt;&gt;!?|~^&quot;));
+
+var RE_HEX_NUMBER = /^0x[0-9a-f]+$/i;
+var RE_OCT_NUMBER = /^0[0-7]+$/;
+var RE_DEC_NUMBER = /^\d*\.?\d*(?:e[+-]?\d*(?:\d\.?|\.?\d)\d*)?$/i;
+
+var OPERATORS = makePredicate([
+    &quot;in&quot;,
+    &quot;instanceof&quot;,
+    &quot;typeof&quot;,
+    &quot;new&quot;,
+    &quot;void&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;++&quot;,
+    &quot;--&quot;,
+    &quot;+&quot;,
+    &quot;-&quot;,
+    &quot;!&quot;,
+    &quot;~&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;&quot;,
+    &quot;|&quot;,
+    &quot;^&quot;,
+    &quot;*&quot;,
+    &quot;/&quot;,
+    &quot;%&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;==&quot;,
+    &quot;===&quot;,
+    &quot;!=&quot;,
+    &quot;!==&quot;,
+    &quot;?&quot;,
+    &quot;=&quot;,
+    &quot;+=&quot;,
+    &quot;-=&quot;,
+    &quot;/=&quot;,
+    &quot;*=&quot;,
+    &quot;%=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&lt;&lt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;=&quot;,
+    &quot;|=&quot;,
+    &quot;^=&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;=&quot;,
+    &quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;,
+    &quot;||&quot;
+]);
+
+var WHITESPACE_CHARS = makePredicate(characters(&quot; \u00a0\n\r\t\f\u000b\u200b\u180e\u2000\u2001\u2002\u2003\u2004\u2005\u2006\u2007\u2008\u2009\u200a\u202f\u205f\u3000&quot;));
+
+var PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = makePredicate(characters(&quot;[{(,.;:&quot;));
+
+var PUNC_CHARS = makePredicate(characters(&quot;[]{}(),;:&quot;));
+
+var REGEXP_MODIFIERS = makePredicate(characters(&quot;gmsiy&quot;));
+
+/* -----[ Tokenizer ]----- */
+
+// regexps adapted from http://xregexp.com/plugins/#unicode
+var UNICODE = {
+    letter: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0041-\\u005A\\u0061-\\u007A\\u00AA\\u00B5\\u00BA\\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02C1\\u02C6-\\u02D1\\u02E0-\\u02E4\\u02EC\\u02EE\\u0370-\\u0374\\u0376\\u0377\\u037A-\\u037D\\u0386\\u0388-\\u038A\\u038C\\u038E-\\u03A1\\u03A3-\\u03F5\\u03F7-\\u0481\\u048A-\\u0523\\u0531-\\u0556\\u0559\\u0561-\\u0587\\u05D0-\\u05EA\\u05F0-\\u05F2\\u0621-\\u064A\\u066E\\u066F\\u0671-\\u06D3\\u06D5\\u06E5\\u06E6\\u06EE\\u06EF\\u06FA-\\u06FC\\u06FF\\u0710\\u0712-\\u072F\\u074D-\\u07A5\\u07B1\\u07CA-\\u07EA\\u07F4\\u07F5\\u07FA\\u0904-\\u0939\\u093D\\u0950\\u0958-\\u0961\\u0971\\u0972\\u097B-\\u097F\\u0985-\\u098C\\u098F\\u0990\\u0993-\\u09A8\\u09AA-\\u09B0\\u09B2\\u09B6-\\u09B9\\u09BD\\u09CE\\u09DC\\u09DD\\u09DF-\\u09E1\\u09F0\\u09F1\\u0A05-\\u0A0A\\u0A0F\\u0A10\\u0A13-\\u0A28\\u0A2A-\\u0A30\\u0A32\\u0A33\\u0A35\\u0A36\\u0A38\\u0A39\\u0A59-\\u0A5C\\u0A5E\\u0A72-\\u0A74\\u0A85-\\u0A8D\\u0A8F-\\u0A91\\u0A93-\\u0AA8\\u0AAA-\\u0AB0\\u0AB2\\u0AB3\\u0AB5-\\u0AB9
 \\u0ABD\\u0AD0\\u0AE0\\u0AE1\\u0B05-\\u0B0C\\u0B0F\\u0B10\\u0B13-\\u0B28\\u0B2A-\\u0B30\\u0B32\\u0B33\\u0B35-\\u0B39\\u0B3D\\u0B5C\\u0B5D\\u0B5F-\\u0B61\\u0B71\\u0B83\\u0B85-\\u0B8A\\u0B8E-\\u0B90\\u0B92-\\u0B95\\u0B99\\u0B9A\\u0B9C\\u0B9E\\u0B9F\\u0BA3\\u0BA4\\u0BA8-\\u0BAA\\u0BAE-\\u0BB9\\u0BD0\\u0C05-\\u0C0C\\u0C0E-\\u0C10\\u0C12-\\u0C28\\u0C2A-\\u0C33\\u0C35-\\u0C39\\u0C3D\\u0C58\\u0C59\\u0C60\\u0C61\\u0C85-\\u0C8C\\u0C8E-\\u0C90\\u0C92-\\u0CA8\\u0CAA-\\u0CB3\\u0CB5-\\u0CB9\\u0CBD\\u0CDE\\u0CE0\\u0CE1\\u0D05-\\u0D0C\\u0D0E-\\u0D10\\u0D12-\\u0D28\\u0D2A-\\u0D39\\u0D3D\\u0D60\\u0D61\\u0D7A-\\u0D7F\\u0D85-\\u0D96\\u0D9A-\\u0DB1\\u0DB3-\\u0DBB\\u0DBD\\u0DC0-\\u0DC6\\u0E01-\\u0E30\\u0E32\\u0E33\\u0E40-\\u0E46\\u0E81\\u0E82\\u0E84\\u0E87\\u0E88\\u0E8A\\u0E8D\\u0E94-\\u0E97\\u0E99-\\u0E9F\\u0EA1-\\u0EA3\\u0EA5\\u0EA7\\u0EAA\\u0EAB\\u0EAD-\\u0EB0\\u0EB2\\u0EB3\\u0EBD\\u0EC0-\\u0EC4\\u0EC6\\u0EDC\\u0EDD\\u0F00\\u0F40-\\u0F47\\u0F49-\\u0F6C\\u0F88-\\u0F8B\\u1000-\\u102A\\u103F\\u1
 050-\\u1055\\u105A-\\u105D\\u1061\\u1065\\u1066\\u106E-\\u1070\\u1075-\\u1081\\u108E\\u10A0-\\u10C5\\u10D0-\\u10FA\\u10FC\\u1100-\\u1159\\u115F-\\u11A2\\u11A8-\\u11F9\\u1200-\\u1248\\u124A-\\u124D\\u1250-\\u1256\\u1258\\u125A-\\u125D\\u1260-\\u1288\\u128A-\\u128D\\u1290-\\u12B0\\u12B2-\\u12B5\\u12B8-\\u12BE\\u12C0\\u12C2-\\u12C5\\u12C8-\\u12D6\\u12D8-\\u1310\\u1312-\\u1315\\u1318-\\u135A\\u1380-\\u138F\\u13A0-\\u13F4\\u1401-\\u166C\\u166F-\\u1676\\u1681-\\u169A\\u16A0-\\u16EA\\u1700-\\u170C\\u170E-\\u1711\\u1720-\\u1731\\u1740-\\u1751\\u1760-\\u176C\\u176E-\\u1770\\u1780-\\u17B3\\u17D7\\u17DC\\u1820-\\u1877\\u1880-\\u18A8\\u18AA\\u1900-\\u191C\\u1950-\\u196D\\u1970-\\u1974\\u1980-\\u19A9\\u19C1-\\u19C7\\u1A00-\\u1A16\\u1B05-\\u1B33\\u1B45-\\u1B4B\\u1B83-\\u1BA0\\u1BAE\\u1BAF\\u1C00-\\u1C23\\u1C4D-\\u1C4F\\u1C5A-\\u1C7D\\u1D00-\\u1DBF\\u1E00-\\u1F15\\u1F18-\\u1F1D\\u1F20-\\u1F45\\u1F48-\\u1F4D\\u1F50-\\u1F57\\u1F59\\u1F5B\\u1F5D\\u1F5F-\\u1F7D\\u1F80-\\u1FB4\\u1FB6-\\u1FBC\\u
 1FBE\\u1FC2-\\u1FC4\\u1FC6-\\u1FCC\\u1FD0-\\u1FD3\\u1FD6-\\u1FDB\\u1FE0-\\u1FEC\\u1FF2-\\u1FF4\\u1FF6-\\u1FFC\\u2071\\u207F\\u2090-\\u2094\\u2102\\u2107\\u210A-\\u2113\\u2115\\u2119-\\u211D\\u2124\\u2126\\u2128\\u212A-\\u212D\\u212F-\\u2139\\u213C-\\u213F\\u2145-\\u2149\\u214E\\u2183\\u2184\\u2C00-\\u2C2E\\u2C30-\\u2C5E\\u2C60-\\u2C6F\\u2C71-\\u2C7D\\u2C80-\\u2CE4\\u2D00-\\u2D25\\u2D30-\\u2D65\\u2D6F\\u2D80-\\u2D96\\u2DA0-\\u2DA6\\u2DA8-\\u2DAE\\u2DB0-\\u2DB6\\u2DB8-\\u2DBE\\u2DC0-\\u2DC6\\u2DC8-\\u2DCE\\u2DD0-\\u2DD6\\u2DD8-\\u2DDE\\u2E2F\\u3005\\u3006\\u3031-\\u3035\\u303B\\u303C\\u3041-\\u3096\\u309D-\\u309F\\u30A1-\\u30FA\\u30FC-\\u30FF\\u3105-\\u312D\\u3131-\\u318E\\u31A0-\\u31B7\\u31F0-\\u31FF\\u3400\\u4DB5\\u4E00\\u9FC3\\uA000-\\uA48C\\uA500-\\uA60C\\uA610-\\uA61F\\uA62A\\uA62B\\uA640-\\uA65F\\uA662-\\uA66E\\uA67F-\\uA697\\uA717-\\uA71F\\uA722-\\uA788\\uA78B\\uA78C\\uA7FB-\\uA801\\uA803-\\uA805\\uA807-\\uA80A\\uA80C-\\uA822\\uA840-\\uA873\\uA882-\\uA8B3\\uA90A-\\uA925
 \\uA930-\\uA946\\uAA00-\\uAA28\\uAA40-\\uAA42\\uAA44-\\uAA4B\\uAC00\\uD7A3\\uF900-\\uFA2D\\uFA30-\\uFA6A\\uFA70-\\uFAD9\\uFB00-\\uFB06\\uFB13-\\uFB17\\uFB1D\\uFB1F-\\uFB28\\uFB2A-\\uFB36\\uFB38-\\uFB3C\\uFB3E\\uFB40\\uFB41\\uFB43\\uFB44\\uFB46-\\uFBB1\\uFBD3-\\uFD3D\\uFD50-\\uFD8F\\uFD92-\\uFDC7\\uFDF0-\\uFDFB\\uFE70-\\uFE74\\uFE76-\\uFEFC\\uFF21-\\uFF3A\\uFF41-\\uFF5A\\uFF66-\\uFFBE\\uFFC2-\\uFFC7\\uFFCA-\\uFFCF\\uFFD2-\\uFFD7\\uFFDA-\\uFFDC]&quot;),
+    non_spacing_mark: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0300-\\u036F\\u0483-\\u0487\\u0591-\\u05BD\\u05BF\\u05C1\\u05C2\\u05C4\\u05C5\\u05C7\\u0610-\\u061A\\u064B-\\u065E\\u0670\\u06D6-\\u06DC\\u06DF-\\u06E4\\u06E7\\u06E8\\u06EA-\\u06ED\\u0711\\u0730-\\u074A\\u07A6-\\u07B0\\u07EB-\\u07F3\\u0816-\\u0819\\u081B-\\u0823\\u0825-\\u0827\\u0829-\\u082D\\u0900-\\u0902\\u093C\\u0941-\\u0948\\u094D\\u0951-\\u0955\\u0962\\u0963\\u0981\\u09BC\\u09C1-\\u09C4\\u09CD\\u09E2\\u09E3\\u0A01\\u0A02\\u0A3C\\u0A41\\u0A42\\u0A47\\u0A48\\u0A4B-\\u0A4D\\u0A51\\u0A70\\u0A71\\u0A75\\u0A81\\u0A82\\u0ABC\\u0AC1-\\u0AC5\\u0AC7\\u0AC8\\u0ACD\\u0AE2\\u0AE3\\u0B01\\u0B3C\\u0B3F\\u0B41-\\u0B44\\u0B4D\\u0B56\\u0B62\\u0B63\\u0B82\\u0BC0\\u0BCD\\u0C3E-\\u0C40\\u0C46-\\u0C48\\u0C4A-\\u0C4D\\u0C55\\u0C56\\u0C62\\u0C63\\u0CBC\\u0CBF\\u0CC6\\u0CCC\\u0CCD\\u0CE2\\u0CE3\\u0D41-\\u0D44\\u0D4D\\u0D62\\u0D63\\u0DCA\\u0DD2-\\u0DD4\\u0DD6\\u0E31\\u0E34-\\u0E3A\\u0E47-\\u0E4E\\u0EB1\\u0EB4-\\u0EB9\\u0EBB\\u0EBC\\u0EC8-\\u0ECD\\u0F18\
 \u0F19\\u0F35\\u0F37\\u0F39\\u0F71-\\u0F7E\\u0F80-\\u0F84\\u0F86\\u0F87\\u0F90-\\u0F97\\u0F99-\\u0FBC\\u0FC6\\u102D-\\u1030\\u1032-\\u1037\\u1039\\u103A\\u103D\\u103E\\u1058\\u1059\\u105E-\\u1060\\u1071-\\u1074\\u1082\\u1085\\u1086\\u108D\\u109D\\u135F\\u1712-\\u1714\\u1732-\\u1734\\u1752\\u1753\\u1772\\u1773\\u17B7-\\u17BD\\u17C6\\u17C9-\\u17D3\\u17DD\\u180B-\\u180D\\u18A9\\u1920-\\u1922\\u1927\\u1928\\u1932\\u1939-\\u193B\\u1A17\\u1A18\\u1A56\\u1A58-\\u1A5E\\u1A60\\u1A62\\u1A65-\\u1A6C\\u1A73-\\u1A7C\\u1A7F\\u1B00-\\u1B03\\u1B34\\u1B36-\\u1B3A\\u1B3C\\u1B42\\u1B6B-\\u1B73\\u1B80\\u1B81\\u1BA2-\\u1BA5\\u1BA8\\u1BA9\\u1C2C-\\u1C33\\u1C36\\u1C37\\u1CD0-\\u1CD2\\u1CD4-\\u1CE0\\u1CE2-\\u1CE8\\u1CED\\u1DC0-\\u1DE6\\u1DFD-\\u1DFF\\u20D0-\\u20DC\\u20E1\\u20E5-\\u20F0\\u2CEF-\\u2CF1\\u2DE0-\\u2DFF\\u302A-\\u302F\\u3099\\u309A\\uA66F\\uA67C\\uA67D\\uA6F0\\uA6F1\\uA802\\uA806\\uA80B\\uA825\\uA826\\uA8C4\\uA8E0-\\uA8F1\\uA926-\\uA92D\\uA947-\\uA951\\uA980-\\uA982\\uA9B3\\uA9B6-\\uA9B9
 \\uA9BC\\uAA29-\\uAA2E\\uAA31\\uAA32\\uAA35\\uAA36\\uAA43\\uAA4C\\uAAB0\\uAAB2-\\uAAB4\\uAAB7\\uAAB8\\uAABE\\uAABF\\uAAC1\\uABE5\\uABE8\\uABED\\uFB1E\\uFE00-\\uFE0F\\uFE20-\\uFE26]&quot;),
+    space_combining_mark: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u0903\\u093E-\\u0940\\u0949-\\u094C\\u094E\\u0982\\u0983\\u09BE-\\u09C0\\u09C7\\u09C8\\u09CB\\u09CC\\u09D7\\u0A03\\u0A3E-\\u0A40\\u0A83\\u0ABE-\\u0AC0\\u0AC9\\u0ACB\\u0ACC\\u0B02\\u0B03\\u0B3E\\u0B40\\u0B47\\u0B48\\u0B4B\\u0B4C\\u0B57\\u0BBE\\u0BBF\\u0BC1\\u0BC2\\u0BC6-\\u0BC8\\u0BCA-\\u0BCC\\u0BD7\\u0C01-\\u0C03\\u0C41-\\u0C44\\u0C82\\u0C83\\u0CBE\\u0CC0-\\u0CC4\\u0CC7\\u0CC8\\u0CCA\\u0CCB\\u0CD5\\u0CD6\\u0D02\\u0D03\\u0D3E-\\u0D40\\u0D46-\\u0D48\\u0D4A-\\u0D4C\\u0D57\\u0D82\\u0D83\\u0DCF-\\u0DD1\\u0DD8-\\u0DDF\\u0DF2\\u0DF3\\u0F3E\\u0F3F\\u0F7F\\u102B\\u102C\\u1031\\u1038\\u103B\\u103C\\u1056\\u1057\\u1062-\\u1064\\u1067-\\u106D\\u1083\\u1084\\u1087-\\u108C\\u108F\\u109A-\\u109C\\u17B6\\u17BE-\\u17C5\\u17C7\\u17C8\\u1923-\\u1926\\u1929-\\u192B\\u1930\\u1931\\u1933-\\u1938\\u19B0-\\u19C0\\u19C8\\u19C9\\u1A19-\\u1A1B\\u1A55\\u1A57\\u1A61\\u1A63\\u1A64\\u1A6D-\\u1A72\\u1B04\\u1B35\\u1B3B\\u1B3D-\\u1B41\\u1B43\\u1B44\\u1B82\\u1BA1\
 \u1BA6\\u1BA7\\u1BAA\\u1C24-\\u1C2B\\u1C34\\u1C35\\u1CE1\\u1CF2\\uA823\\uA824\\uA827\\uA880\\uA881\\uA8B4-\\uA8C3\\uA952\\uA953\\uA983\\uA9B4\\uA9B5\\uA9BA\\uA9BB\\uA9BD-\\uA9C0\\uAA2F\\uAA30\\uAA33\\uAA34\\uAA4D\\uAA7B\\uABE3\\uABE4\\uABE6\\uABE7\\uABE9\\uABEA\\uABEC]&quot;),
+    connector_punctuation: new RegExp(&quot;[\\u005F\\u203F\\u2040\\u2054\\uFE33\\uFE34\\uFE4D-\\uFE4F\\uFF3F]&quot;)
+};
+
+function is_letter(code) {
+    return (code &gt;= 97 &amp;&amp; code &lt;= 122)
+        || (code &gt;= 65 &amp;&amp; code &lt;= 90)
+        || (code &gt;= 0xaa &amp;&amp; UNICODE.letter.test(String.fromCharCode(code)));
+};
+
+function is_digit(code) {
+    return code &gt;= 48 &amp;&amp; code &lt;= 57; //XXX: find out if &quot;UnicodeDigit&quot; means something else than 0..9
+};
+
+function is_alphanumeric_char(code) {
+    return is_digit(code) || is_letter(code);
+};
+
+function is_unicode_combining_mark(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.non_spacing_mark.test(ch) || UNICODE.space_combining_mark.test(ch);
+};
+
+function is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch) {
+    return UNICODE.connector_punctuation.test(ch);
+};
+
+function is_identifier(name) {
+    return !RESERVED_WORDS(name) &amp;&amp; /^[a-z_$][a-z0-9_$]*$/i.test(name);
+};
+
+function is_identifier_start(code) {
+    return code == 36 || code == 95 || is_letter(code);
+};
+
+function is_identifier_char(ch) {
+    var code = ch.charCodeAt(0);
+    return is_identifier_start(code)
+        || is_digit(code)
+        || code == 8204 // \u200c: zero-width non-joiner &lt;ZWNJ&gt;
+        || code == 8205 // \u200d: zero-width joiner &lt;ZWJ&gt; (in my ECMA-262 PDF, this is also 200c)
+        || is_unicode_combining_mark(ch)
+        || is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch)
+    ;
+};
+
+function is_identifier_string(str){
+    var i = str.length;
+    if (i == 0) return false;
+    if (!is_identifier_start(str.charCodeAt(0))) return false;
+    while (--i &gt;= 0) {
+        if (!is_identifier_char(str.charAt(i)))
+            return false;
+    }
+    return true;
+};
+
+function parse_js_number(num) {
+    if (RE_HEX_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseInt(num.substr(2), 16);
+    } else if (RE_OCT_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseInt(num.substr(1), 8);
+    } else if (RE_DEC_NUMBER.test(num)) {
+        return parseFloat(num);
+    }
+};
+
+function JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos) {
+    this.message = message;
+    this.line = line;
+    this.col = col;
+    this.pos = pos;
+    this.stack = new Error().stack;
+};
+
+JS_Parse_Error.prototype.toString = function() {
+    return this.message + &quot; (line: &quot; + this.line + &quot;, col: &quot; + this.col + &quot;, pos: &quot; + this.pos + &quot;)&quot; + &quot;\n\n&quot; + this.stack;
+};
+
+function js_error(message, filename, line, col, pos) {
+    throw new JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos);
+};
+
+function is_token(token, type, val) {
+    return token.type == type &amp;&amp; (val == null || token.value == val);
+};
+
+var EX_EOF = {};
+
+function tokenizer($TEXT, filename, html5_comments) {
+
+    var S = {
+        text            : $TEXT.replace(/\r\n?|[\n\u2028\u2029]/g, &quot;\n&quot;).replace(/\uFEFF/g, ''),
+        filename        : filename,
+        pos             : 0,
+        tokpos          : 0,
+        line            : 1,
+        tokline         : 0,
+        col             : 0,
+        tokcol          : 0,
+        newline_before  : false,
+        regex_allowed   : false,
+        comments_before : []
+    };
+
+    function peek() { return S.text.charAt(S.pos); };
+
+    function next(signal_eof, in_string) {
+        var ch = S.text.charAt(S.pos++);
+        if (signal_eof &amp;&amp; !ch)
+            throw EX_EOF;
+        if (ch == &quot;\n&quot;) {
+            S.newline_before = S.newline_before || !in_string;
+            ++S.line;
+            S.col = 0;
+        } else {
+            ++S.col;
+        }
+        return ch;
+    };
+
+    function forward(i) {
+        while (i-- &gt; 0) next();
+    };
+
+    function looking_at(str) {
+        return S.text.substr(S.pos, str.length) == str;
+    };
+
+    function find(what, signal_eof) {
+        var pos = S.text.indexOf(what, S.pos);
+        if (signal_eof &amp;&amp; pos == -1) throw EX_EOF;
+        return pos;
+    };
+
+    function start_token() {
+        S.tokline = S.line;
+        S.tokcol = S.col;
+        S.tokpos = S.pos;
+    };
+
+    var prev_was_dot = false;
+    function token(type, value, is_comment) {
+        S.regex_allowed = ((type == &quot;operator&quot; &amp;&amp; !UNARY_POSTFIX(value)) ||
+                           (type == &quot;keyword&quot; &amp;&amp; KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION(value)) ||
+                           (type == &quot;punc&quot; &amp;&amp; PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION(value)));
+        prev_was_dot = (type == &quot;punc&quot; &amp;&amp; value == &quot;.&quot;);
+        var ret = {
+            type   : type,
+            value  : value,
+            line   : S.tokline,
+            col    : S.tokcol,
+            pos    : S.tokpos,
+            endpos : S.pos,
+            nlb    : S.newline_before,
+            file   : filename
+        };
+        if (!is_comment) {
+            ret.comments_before = S.comments_before;
+            S.comments_before = [];
+            // make note of any newlines in the comments that came before
+            for (var i = 0, len = ret.comments_before.length; i &lt; len; i++) {
+                ret.nlb = ret.nlb || ret.comments_before[i].nlb;
+            }
+        }
+        S.newline_before = false;
+        return new AST_Token(ret);
+    };
+
+    function skip_whitespace() {
+        while (WHITESPACE_CHARS(peek()))
+            next();
+    };
+
+    function read_while(pred) {
+        var ret = &quot;&quot;, ch, i = 0;
+        while ((ch = peek()) &amp;&amp; pred(ch, i++))
+            ret += next();
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    function parse_error(err) {
+        js_error(err, filename, S.tokline, S.tokcol, S.tokpos);
+    };
+
+    function read_num(prefix) {
+        var has_e = false, after_e = false, has_x = false, has_dot = prefix == &quot;.&quot;;
+        var num = read_while(function(ch, i){
+            var code = ch.charCodeAt(0);
+            switch (code) {
+              case 120: case 88: // xX
+                return has_x ? false : (has_x = true);
+              case 101: case 69: // eE
+                return has_x ? true : has_e ? false : (has_e = after_e = true);
+              case 45: // -
+                return after_e || (i == 0 &amp;&amp; !prefix);
+              case 43: // +
+                return after_e;
+              case (after_e = false, 46): // .
+                return (!has_dot &amp;&amp; !has_x &amp;&amp; !has_e) ? (has_dot = true) : false;
+            }
+            return is_alphanumeric_char(code);
+        });
+        if (prefix) num = prefix + num;
+        var valid = parse_js_number(num);
+        if (!isNaN(valid)) {
+            return token(&quot;num&quot;, valid);
+        } else {
+            parse_error(&quot;Invalid syntax: &quot; + num);
+        }
+    };
+
+    function read_escaped_char(in_string) {
+        var ch = next(true, in_string);
+        switch (ch.charCodeAt(0)) {
+          case 110 : return &quot;\n&quot;;
+          case 114 : return &quot;\r&quot;;
+          case 116 : return &quot;\t&quot;;
+          case 98  : return &quot;\b&quot;;
+          case 118 : return &quot;\u000b&quot;; // \v
+          case 102 : return &quot;\f&quot;;
+          case 48  : return &quot;\0&quot;;
+          case 120 : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(2)); // \x
+          case 117 : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(4)); // \u
+          case 10  : return &quot;&quot;; // newline
+          default  : return ch;
+        }
+    };
+
+    function hex_bytes(n) {
+        var num = 0;
+        for (; n &gt; 0; --n) {
+            var digit = parseInt(next(true), 16);
+            if (isNaN(digit))
+                parse_error(&quot;Invalid hex-character pattern in string&quot;);
+            num = (num &lt;&lt; 4) | digit;
+        }
+        return num;
+    };
+
+    var read_string = with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated string constant&quot;, function(){
+        var quote = next(), ret = &quot;&quot;;
+        for (;;) {
+            var ch = next(true);
+            if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) {
+                // read OctalEscapeSequence (XXX: deprecated if &quot;strict mode&quot;)
+                // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/178
+                var octal_len = 0, first = null;
+                ch = read_while(function(ch){
+                    if (ch &gt;= &quot;0&quot; &amp;&amp; ch &lt;= &quot;7&quot;) {
+                        if (!first) {
+                            first = ch;
+                            return ++octal_len;
+                        }
+                        else if (first &lt;= &quot;3&quot; &amp;&amp; octal_len &lt;= 2) return ++octal_len;
+                        else if (first &gt;= &quot;4&quot; &amp;&amp; octal_len &lt;= 1) return ++octal_len;
+                    }
+                    return false;
+                });
+                if (octal_len &gt; 0) ch = String.fromCharCode(parseInt(ch, 8));
+                else ch = read_escaped_char(true);
+            }
+            else if (ch == quote) break;
+            ret += ch;
+        }
+        return token(&quot;string&quot;, ret);
+    });
+
+    function skip_line_comment(type) {
+        var regex_allowed = S.regex_allowed;
+        var i = find(&quot;\n&quot;), ret;
+        if (i == -1) {
+            ret = S.text.substr(S.pos);
+            S.pos = S.text.length;
+        } else {
+            ret = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
+            S.pos = i;
+        }
+        S.comments_before.push(token(type, ret, true));
+        S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
+        return next_token();
+    };
+
+    var skip_multiline_comment = with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated multiline comment&quot;, function(){
+        var regex_allowed = S.regex_allowed;
+        var i = find(&quot;*/&quot;, true);
+        var text = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
+        var a = text.split(&quot;\n&quot;), n = a.length;
+        // update stream position
+        S.pos = i + 2;
+        S.line += n - 1;
+        if (n &gt; 1) S.col = a[n - 1].length;
+        else S.col += a[n - 1].length;
+        S.col += 2;
+        var nlb = S.newline_before = S.newline_before || text.indexOf(&quot;\n&quot;) &gt;= 0;
+        S.comments_before.push(token(&quot;comment2&quot;, text, true));
+        S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
+        S.newline_before = nlb;
+        return next_token();
+    });
+
+    function read_name() {
+        var backslash = false, name = &quot;&quot;, ch, escaped = false, hex;
+        while ((ch = peek()) != null) {
+            if (!backslash) {
+                if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) escaped = backslash = true, next();
+                else if (is_identifier_char(ch)) name += next();
+                else break;
+            }
+            else {
+                if (ch != &quot;u&quot;) parse_error(&quot;Expecting UnicodeEscapeSequence -- uXXXX&quot;);
+                ch = read_escaped_char();
+                if (!is_identifier_char(ch)) parse_error(&quot;Unicode char: &quot; + ch.charCodeAt(0) + &quot; is not valid in identifier&quot;);
+                name += ch;
+                backslash = false;
+            }
+        }
+        if (KEYWORDS(name) &amp;&amp; escaped) {
+            hex = name.charCodeAt(0).toString(16).toUpperCase();
+            name = &quot;\\u&quot; + &quot;0000&quot;.substr(hex.length) + hex + name.slice(1);
+        }
+        return name;
+    };
+
+    var read_regexp = with_eof_error(&quot;Unterminated regular expression&quot;, function(regexp){
+        var prev_backslash = false, ch, in_class = false;
+        while ((ch = next(true))) if (prev_backslash) {
+            regexp += &quot;\\&quot; + ch;
+            prev_backslash = false;
+        } else if (ch == &quot;[&quot;) {
+            in_class = true;
+            regexp += ch;
+        } else if (ch == &quot;]&quot; &amp;&amp; in_class) {
+            in_class = false;
+            regexp += ch;
+        } else if (ch == &quot;/&quot; &amp;&amp; !in_class) {
+            break;
+        } else if (ch == &quot;\\&quot;) {
+            prev_backslash = true;
+        } else {
+            regexp += ch;
+        }
+        var mods = read_name();
+        return token(&quot;regexp&quot;, new RegExp(regexp, mods));
+    });
+
+    function read_operator(prefix) {
+        function grow(op) {
+            if (!peek()) return op;
+            var bigger = op + peek();
+            if (OPERATORS(bigger)) {
+                next();
+                return grow(bigger);
+            } else {
+                return op;
+            }
+        };
+        return token(&quot;operator&quot;, grow(prefix || next()));
+    };
+
+    function handle_slash() {
+        next();
+        switch (peek()) {
+          case &quot;/&quot;:
+            next();
+            return skip_line_comment(&quot;comment1&quot;);
+          case &quot;*&quot;:
+            next();
+            return skip_multiline_comment();
+        }
+        return S.regex_allowed ? read_regexp(&quot;&quot;) : read_operator(&quot;/&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function handle_dot() {
+        next();
+        return is_digit(peek().charCodeAt(0))
+            ? read_num(&quot;.&quot;)
+            : token(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;.&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function read_word() {
+        var word = read_name();
+        if (prev_was_dot) return token(&quot;name&quot;, word);
+        return KEYWORDS_ATOM(word) ? token(&quot;atom&quot;, word)
+            : !KEYWORDS(word) ? token(&quot;name&quot;, word)
+            : OPERATORS(word) ? token(&quot;operator&quot;, word)
+            : token(&quot;keyword&quot;, word);
+    };
+
+    function with_eof_error(eof_error, cont) {
+        return function(x) {
+            try {
+                return cont(x);
+            } catch(ex) {
+                if (ex === EX_EOF) parse_error(eof_error);
+                else throw ex;
+            }
+        };
+    };
+
+    function next_token(force_regexp) {
+        if (force_regexp != null)
+            return read_regexp(force_regexp);
+        skip_whitespace();
+        start_token();
+        if (html5_comments) {
+            if (looking_at(&quot;&lt;!--&quot;)) {
+                forward(4);
+                return skip_line_comment(&quot;comment3&quot;);
+            }
+            if (looking_at(&quot;--&gt;&quot;) &amp;&amp; S.newline_before) {
+                forward(3);
+                return skip_line_comment(&quot;comment4&quot;);
+            }
+        }
+        var ch = peek();
+        if (!ch) return token(&quot;eof&quot;);
+        var code = ch.charCodeAt(0);
+        switch (code) {
+          case 34: case 39: return read_string();
+          case 46: return handle_dot();
+          case 47: return handle_slash();
+        }
+        if (is_digit(code)) return read_num();
+        if (PUNC_CHARS(ch)) return token(&quot;punc&quot;, next());
+        if (OPERATOR_CHARS(ch)) return read_operator();
+        if (code == 92 || is_identifier_start(code)) return read_word();
+        parse_error(&quot;Unexpected character '&quot; + ch + &quot;'&quot;);
+    };
+
+    next_token.context = function(nc) {
+        if (nc) S = nc;
+        return S;
+    };
+
+    return next_token;
+
+};
+
+/* -----[ Parser (constants) ]----- */
+
+var UNARY_PREFIX = makePredicate([
+    &quot;typeof&quot;,
+    &quot;void&quot;,
+    &quot;delete&quot;,
+    &quot;--&quot;,
+    &quot;++&quot;,
+    &quot;!&quot;,
+    &quot;~&quot;,
+    &quot;-&quot;,
+    &quot;+&quot;
+]);
+
+var UNARY_POSTFIX = makePredicate([ &quot;--&quot;, &quot;++&quot; ]);
+
+var ASSIGNMENT = makePredicate([ &quot;=&quot;, &quot;+=&quot;, &quot;-=&quot;, &quot;/=&quot;, &quot;*=&quot;, &quot;%=&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;&lt;&lt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;|=&quot;, &quot;^=&quot;, &quot;&amp;=&quot; ]);
+
+var PRECEDENCE = (function(a, ret){
+    for (var i = 0; i &lt; a.length; ++i) {
+        var b = a[i];
+        for (var j = 0; j &lt; b.length; ++j) {
+            ret[b[j]] = i + 1;
+        }
+    }
+    return ret;
+})(
+    [
+        [&quot;||&quot;],
+        [&quot;&amp;&amp;&quot;],
+        [&quot;|&quot;],
+        [&quot;^&quot;],
+        [&quot;&amp;&quot;],
+        [&quot;==&quot;, &quot;===&quot;, &quot;!=&quot;, &quot;!==&quot;],
+        [&quot;&lt;&quot;, &quot;&gt;&quot;, &quot;&lt;=&quot;, &quot;&gt;=&quot;, &quot;in&quot;, &quot;instanceof&quot;],
+        [&quot;&gt;&gt;&quot;, &quot;&lt;&lt;&quot;, &quot;&gt;&gt;&gt;&quot;],
+        [&quot;+&quot;, &quot;-&quot;],
+        [&quot;*&quot;, &quot;/&quot;, &quot;%&quot;]
+    ],
+    {}
+);
+
+var STATEMENTS_WITH_LABELS = array_to_hash([ &quot;for&quot;, &quot;do&quot;, &quot;while&quot;, &quot;switch&quot; ]);
+
+var ATOMIC_START_TOKEN = array_to_hash([ &quot;atom&quot;, &quot;num&quot;, &quot;string&quot;, &quot;regexp&quot;, &quot;name&quot; ]);
+
+/* -----[ Parser ]----- */
+
+function parse($TEXT, options) {
+
+    options = defaults(options, {
+        strict         : false,
+        filename       : null,
+        toplevel       : null,
+        expression     : false,
+        html5_comments : true,
+    });
+
+    var S = {
+        input         : (typeof $TEXT == &quot;string&quot;
+                         ? tokenizer($TEXT, options.filename,
+                                     options.html5_comments)
+                         : $TEXT),
+        token         : null,
+        prev          : null,
+        peeked        : null,
+        in_function   : 0,
+        in_directives : true,
+        in_loop       : 0,
+        labels        : []
+    };
+
+    S.token = next();
+
+    function is(type, value) {
+        return is_token(S.token, type, value);
+    };
+
+    function peek() { return S.peeked || (S.peeked = S.input()); };
+
+    function next() {
+        S.prev = S.token;
+        if (S.peeked) {
+            S.token = S.peeked;
+            S.peeked = null;
+        } else {
+            S.token = S.input();
+        }
+        S.in_directives = S.in_directives &amp;&amp; (
+            S.token.type == &quot;string&quot; || is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)
+        );
+        return S.token;
+    };
+
+    function prev() {
+        return S.prev;
+    };
+
+    function croak(msg, line, col, pos) {
+        var ctx = S.input.context();
+        js_error(msg,
+                 ctx.filename,
+                 line != null ? line : ctx.tokline,
+                 col != null ? col : ctx.tokcol,
+                 pos != null ? pos : ctx.tokpos);
+    };
+
+    function token_error(token, msg) {
+        croak(msg, token.line, token.col);
+    };
+
+    function unexpected(token) {
+        if (token == null)
+            token = S.token;
+        token_error(token, &quot;Unexpected token: &quot; + token.type + &quot; (&quot; + token.value + &quot;)&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function expect_token(type, val) {
+        if (is(type, val)) {
+            return next();
+        }
+        token_error(S.token, &quot;Unexpected token &quot; + S.token.type + &quot; «&quot; + S.token.value + &quot;»&quot; + &quot;, expected &quot; + type + &quot; «&quot; + val + &quot;»&quot;);
+    };
+
+    function expect(punc) { return expect_token(&quot;punc&quot;, punc); };
+
+    function can_insert_semicolon() {
+        return !options.strict &amp;&amp; (
+            S.token.nlb || is(&quot;eof&quot;) || is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)
+        );
+    };
+
+    function semicolon() {
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)) next();
+        else if (!can_insert_semicolon()) unexpected();
+    };
+
+    function parenthesised() {
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        var exp = expression(true);
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return exp;
+    };
+
+    function embed_tokens(parser) {
+        return function() {
+            var start = S.token;
+            var expr = parser();
+            var end = prev();
+            expr.start = start;
+            expr.end = end;
+            return expr;
+        };
+    };
+
+    function handle_regexp() {
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;/&quot;) || is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;/=&quot;)) {
+            S.peeked = null;
+            S.token = S.input(S.token.value.substr(1)); // force regexp
+        }
+    };
+
+    var statement = embed_tokens(function() {
+        var tmp;
+        handle_regexp();
+        switch (S.token.type) {
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+            var dir = S.in_directives, stat = simple_statement();
+            // XXXv2: decide how to fix directives
+            if (dir &amp;&amp; stat.body instanceof AST_String &amp;&amp; !is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;))
+                return new AST_Directive({ value: stat.body.value });
+            return stat;
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+          case &quot;regexp&quot;:
+          case &quot;operator&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            return simple_statement();
+
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+            return is_token(peek(), &quot;punc&quot;, &quot;:&quot;)
+                ? labeled_statement()
+                : simple_statement();
+
+          case &quot;punc&quot;:
+            switch (S.token.value) {
+              case &quot;{&quot;:
+                return new AST_BlockStatement({
+                    start : S.token,
+                    body  : block_(),
+                    end   : prev()
+                });
+              case &quot;[&quot;:
+              case &quot;(&quot;:
+                return simple_statement();
+              case &quot;;&quot;:
+                next();
+                return new AST_EmptyStatement();
+              default:
+                unexpected();
+            }
+
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+            switch (tmp = S.token.value, next(), tmp) {
+              case &quot;break&quot;:
+                return break_cont(AST_Break);
+
+              case &quot;continue&quot;:
+                return break_cont(AST_Continue);
+
+              case &quot;debugger&quot;:
+                semicolon();
+                return new AST_Debugger();
+
+              case &quot;do&quot;:
+                return new AST_Do({
+                    body      : in_loop(statement),
+                    condition : (expect_token(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;while&quot;), tmp = parenthesised(), semicolon(), tmp)
+                });
+
+              case &quot;while&quot;:
+                return new AST_While({
+                    condition : parenthesised(),
+                    body      : in_loop(statement)
+                });
+
+              case &quot;for&quot;:
+                return for_();
+
+              case &quot;function&quot;:
+                return function_(AST_Defun);
+
+              case &quot;if&quot;:
+                return if_();
+
+              case &quot;return&quot;:
+                if (S.in_function == 0)
+                    croak(&quot;'return' outside of function&quot;);
+                return new AST_Return({
+                    value: ( is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)
+                             ? (next(), null)
+                             : can_insert_semicolon()
+                             ? null
+                             : (tmp = expression(true), semicolon(), tmp) )
+                });
+
+              case &quot;switch&quot;:
+                return new AST_Switch({
+                    expression : parenthesised(),
+                    body       : in_loop(switch_body_)
+                });
+
+              case &quot;throw&quot;:
+                if (S.token.nlb)
+                    croak(&quot;Illegal newline after 'throw'&quot;);
+                return new AST_Throw({
+                    value: (tmp = expression(true), semicolon(), tmp)
+                });
+
+              case &quot;try&quot;:
+                return try_();
+
+              case &quot;var&quot;:
+                return tmp = var_(), semicolon(), tmp;
+
+              case &quot;const&quot;:
+                return tmp = const_(), semicolon(), tmp;
+
+              case &quot;with&quot;:
+                return new AST_With({
+                    expression : parenthesised(),
+                    body       : statement()
+                });
+
+              default:
+                unexpected();
+            }
+        }
+    });
+
+    function labeled_statement() {
+        var label = as_symbol(AST_Label);
+        if (find_if(function(l){ return l.name == label.name }, S.labels)) {
+            // ECMA-262, 12.12: An ECMAScript program is considered
+            // syntactically incorrect if it contains a
+            // LabelledStatement that is enclosed by a
+            // LabelledStatement with the same Identifier as label.
+            croak(&quot;Label &quot; + label.name + &quot; defined twice&quot;);
+        }
+        expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+        S.labels.push(label);
+        var stat = statement();
+        S.labels.pop();
+        if (!(stat instanceof AST_IterationStatement)) {
+            // check for `continue` that refers to this label.
+            // those should be reported as syntax errors.
+            // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS2/issues/287
+            label.references.forEach(function(ref){
+                if (ref instanceof AST_Continue) {
+                    ref = ref.label.start;
+                    croak(&quot;Continue label `&quot; + label.name + &quot;` refers to non-IterationStatement.&quot;,
+                          ref.line, ref.col, ref.pos);
+                }
+            });
+        }
+        return new AST_LabeledStatement({ body: stat, label: label });
+    };
+
+    function simple_statement(tmp) {
+        return new AST_SimpleStatement({ body: (tmp = expression(true), semicolon(), tmp) });
+    };
+
+    function break_cont(type) {
+        var label = null, ldef;
+        if (!can_insert_semicolon()) {
+            label = as_symbol(AST_LabelRef, true);
+        }
+        if (label != null) {
+            ldef = find_if(function(l){ return l.name == label.name }, S.labels);
+            if (!ldef)
+                croak(&quot;Undefined label &quot; + label.name);
+            label.thedef = ldef;
+        }
+        else if (S.in_loop == 0)
+            croak(type.TYPE + &quot; not inside a loop or switch&quot;);
+        semicolon();
+        var stat = new type({ label: label });
+        if (ldef) ldef.references.push(stat);
+        return stat;
+    };
+
+    function for_() {
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        var init = null;
+        if (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;)) {
+            init = is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;var&quot;)
+                ? (next(), var_(true))
+                : expression(true, true);
+            if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;in&quot;)) {
+                if (init instanceof AST_Var &amp;&amp; init.definitions.length &gt; 1)
+                    croak(&quot;Only one variable declaration allowed in for..in loop&quot;);
+                next();
+                return for_in(init);
+            }
+        }
+        return regular_for(init);
+    };
+
+    function regular_for(init) {
+        expect(&quot;;&quot;);
+        var test = is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;;&quot;) ? null : expression(true);
+        expect(&quot;;&quot;);
+        var step = is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;)&quot;) ? null : expression(true);
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return new AST_For({
+            init      : init,
+            condition : test,
+            step      : step,
+            body      : in_loop(statement)
+        });
+    };
+
+    function for_in(init) {
+        var lhs = init instanceof AST_Var ? init.definitions[0].name : null;
+        var obj = expression(true);
+        expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+        return new AST_ForIn({
+            init   : init,
+            name   : lhs,
+            object : obj,
+            body   : in_loop(statement)
+        });
+    };
+
+    var function_ = function(ctor) {
+        var in_statement = ctor === AST_Defun;
+        var name = is(&quot;name&quot;) ? as_symbol(in_statement ? AST_SymbolDefun : AST_SymbolLambda) : null;
+        if (in_statement &amp;&amp; !name)
+            unexpected();
+        expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+        return new ctor({
+            name: name,
+            argnames: (function(first, a){
+                while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;)&quot;)) {
+                    if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+                    a.push(as_symbol(AST_SymbolFunarg));
+                }
+                next();
+                return a;
+            })(true, []),
+            body: (function(loop, labels){
+                ++S.in_function;
+                S.in_directives = true;
+                S.in_loop = 0;
+                S.labels = [];
+                var a = block_();
+                --S.in_function;
+                S.in_loop = loop;
+                S.labels = labels;
+                return a;
+            })(S.in_loop, S.labels)
+        });
+    };
+
+    function if_() {
+        var cond = parenthesised(), body = statement(), belse = null;
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;else&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            belse = statement();
+        }
+        return new AST_If({
+            condition   : cond,
+            body        : body,
+            alternative : belse
+        });
+    };
+
+    function block_() {
+        expect(&quot;{&quot;);
+        var a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (is(&quot;eof&quot;)) unexpected();
+            a.push(statement());
+        }
+        next();
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    function switch_body_() {
+        expect(&quot;{&quot;);
+        var a = [], cur = null, branch = null, tmp;
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (is(&quot;eof&quot;)) unexpected();
+            if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;case&quot;)) {
+                if (branch) branch.end = prev();
+                cur = [];
+                branch = new AST_Case({
+                    start      : (tmp = S.token, next(), tmp),
+                    expression : expression(true),
+                    body       : cur
+                });
+                a.push(branch);
+                expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+            }
+            else if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;default&quot;)) {
+                if (branch) branch.end = prev();
+                cur = [];
+                branch = new AST_Default({
+                    start : (tmp = S.token, next(), expect(&quot;:&quot;), tmp),
+                    body  : cur
+                });
+                a.push(branch);
+            }
+            else {
+                if (!cur) unexpected();
+                cur.push(statement());
+            }
+        }
+        if (branch) branch.end = prev();
+        next();
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    function try_() {
+        var body = block_(), bcatch = null, bfinally = null;
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;catch&quot;)) {
+            var start = S.token;
+            next();
+            expect(&quot;(&quot;);
+            var name = as_symbol(AST_SymbolCatch);
+            expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+            bcatch = new AST_Catch({
+                start   : start,
+                argname : name,
+                body    : block_(),
+                end     : prev()
+            });
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;finally&quot;)) {
+            var start = S.token;
+            next();
+            bfinally = new AST_Finally({
+                start : start,
+                body  : block_(),
+                end   : prev()
+            });
+        }
+        if (!bcatch &amp;&amp; !bfinally)
+            croak(&quot;Missing catch/finally blocks&quot;);
+        return new AST_Try({
+            body     : body,
+            bcatch   : bcatch,
+            bfinally : bfinally
+        });
+    };
+
+    function vardefs(no_in, in_const) {
+        var a = [];
+        for (;;) {
+            a.push(new AST_VarDef({
+                start : S.token,
+                name  : as_symbol(in_const ? AST_SymbolConst : AST_SymbolVar),
+                value : is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;=&quot;) ? (next(), expression(false, no_in)) : null,
+                end   : prev()
+            }));
+            if (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;))
+                break;
+            next();
+        }
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    var var_ = function(no_in) {
+        return new AST_Var({
+            start       : prev(),
+            definitions : vardefs(no_in, false),
+            end         : prev()
+        });
+    };
+
+    var const_ = function() {
+        return new AST_Const({
+            start       : prev(),
+            definitions : vardefs(false, true),
+            end         : prev()
+        });
+    };
+
+    var new_ = function() {
+        var start = S.token;
+        expect_token(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;new&quot;);
+        var newexp = expr_atom(false), args;
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;(&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            args = expr_list(&quot;)&quot;);
+        } else {
+            args = [];
+        }
+        return subscripts(new AST_New({
+            start      : start,
+            expression : newexp,
+            args       : args,
+            end        : prev()
+        }), true);
+    };
+
+    function as_atom_node() {
+        var tok = S.token, ret;
+        switch (tok.type) {
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+            ret = _make_symbol(AST_SymbolRef);
+            break;
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+            ret = new AST_Number({ start: tok, end: tok, value: tok.value });
+            break;
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+            ret = new AST_String({ start: tok, end: tok, value: tok.value });
+            break;
+          case &quot;regexp&quot;:
+            ret = new AST_RegExp({ start: tok, end: tok, value: tok.value });
+            break;
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            switch (tok.value) {
+              case &quot;false&quot;:
+                ret = new AST_False({ start: tok, end: tok });
+                break;
+              case &quot;true&quot;:
+                ret = new AST_True({ start: tok, end: tok });
+                break;
+              case &quot;null&quot;:
+                ret = new AST_Null({ start: tok, end: tok });
+                break;
+            }
+            break;
+        }
+        next();
+        return ret;
+    };
+
+    var expr_atom = function(allow_calls) {
+        if (is(&quot;operator&quot;, &quot;new&quot;)) {
+            return new_();
+        }
+        var start = S.token;
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;)) {
+            switch (start.value) {
+              case &quot;(&quot;:
+                next();
+                var ex = expression(true);
+                ex.start = start;
+                ex.end = S.token;
+                expect(&quot;)&quot;);
+                return subscripts(ex, allow_calls);
+              case &quot;[&quot;:
+                return subscripts(array_(), allow_calls);
+              case &quot;{&quot;:
+                return subscripts(object_(), allow_calls);
+            }
+            unexpected();
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;function&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            var func = function_(AST_Function);
+            func.start = start;
+            func.end = prev();
+            return subscripts(func, allow_calls);
+        }
+        if (ATOMIC_START_TOKEN[S.token.type]) {
+            return subscripts(as_atom_node(), allow_calls);
+        }
+        unexpected();
+    };
+
+    function expr_list(closing, allow_trailing_comma, allow_empty) {
+        var first = true, a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, closing)) {
+            if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+            if (allow_trailing_comma &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, closing)) break;
+            if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;,&quot;) &amp;&amp; allow_empty) {
+                a.push(new AST_Hole({ start: S.token, end: S.token }));
+            } else {
+                a.push(expression(false));
+            }
+        }
+        next();
+        return a;
+    };
+
+    var array_ = embed_tokens(function() {
+        expect(&quot;[&quot;);
+        return new AST_Array({
+            elements: expr_list(&quot;]&quot;, !options.strict, true)
+        });
+    });
+
+    var object_ = embed_tokens(function() {
+        expect(&quot;{&quot;);
+        var first = true, a = [];
+        while (!is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;)) {
+            if (first) first = false; else expect(&quot;,&quot;);
+            if (!options.strict &amp;&amp; is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;}&quot;))
+                // allow trailing comma
+                break;
+            var start = S.token;
+            var type = start.type;
+            var name = as_property_name();
+            if (type == &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp; !is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;:&quot;)) {
+                if (name == &quot;get&quot;) {
+                    a.push(new AST_ObjectGetter({
+                        start : start,
+                        key   : as_atom_node(),
+                        value : function_(AST_Accessor),
+                        end   : prev()
+                    }));
+                    continue;
+                }
+                if (name == &quot;set&quot;) {
+                    a.push(new AST_ObjectSetter({
+                        start : start,
+                        key   : as_atom_node(),
+                        value : function_(AST_Accessor),
+                        end   : prev()
+                    }));
+                    continue;
+                }
+            }
+            expect(&quot;:&quot;);
+            a.push(new AST_ObjectKeyVal({
+                start : start,
+                key   : name,
+                value : expression(false),
+                end   : prev()
+            }));
+        }
+        next();
+        return new AST_Object({ properties: a });
+    });
+
+    function as_property_name() {
+        var tmp = S.token;
+        next();
+        switch (tmp.type) {
+          case &quot;num&quot;:
+          case &quot;string&quot;:
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+          case &quot;operator&quot;:
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            return tmp.value;
+          default:
+            unexpected();
+        }
+    };
+
+    function as_name() {
+        var tmp = S.token;
+        next();
+        switch (tmp.type) {
+          case &quot;name&quot;:
+          case &quot;operator&quot;:
+          case &quot;keyword&quot;:
+          case &quot;atom&quot;:
+            return tmp.value;
+          default:
+            unexpected();
+        }
+    };
+
+    function _make_symbol(type) {
+        var name = S.token.value;
+        return new (name == &quot;this&quot; ? AST_This : type)({
+            name  : String(name),
+            start : S.token,
+            end   : S.token
+        });
+    };
+
+    function as_symbol(type, noerror) {
+        if (!is(&quot;name&quot;)) {
+            if (!noerror) croak(&quot;Name expected&quot;);
+            return null;
+        }
+        var sym = _make_symbol(type);
+        next();
+        return sym;
+    };
+
+    var subscripts = function(expr, allow_calls) {
+        var start = expr.start;
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;.&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            return subscripts(new AST_Dot({
+                start      : start,
+                expression : expr,
+                property   : as_name(),
+                end        : prev()
+            }), allow_calls);
+        }
+        if (is(&quot;punc&quot;, &quot;[&quot;)) {
+            next();
+            var prop = expression(true);
+            expect(&quot;]&quot;);
+            return subscripts(new AST_Sub({
+                start      : start,
+                expression : expr,
+                property   : prop,
